Actually something that does bug me almost as much as the video issue is the placement of the pop up flash, which sometimes will pop up under my finger, and then I have to adjust my fingers, and turn it on again to get the flash to come up all the way.  I have had the camera shut down while taking videos that are over a minute with a lot of zoom, but as I mentioned previously, I can then turn it on, and the battery is still full, and you can take more pictures or video.  So if you are like me, and want a camera mostly for taking really good pictures, that isn't too big, this is a really good option.  The zoom and all the options on the camera are great, and produce generally wonderful picture quality.  If you do want to take long HD videos with lots of zoom, then definitely get another camera, or a camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Battery ssues the ultimate deal-breaker.
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this camera - pictures were crisp & clear, but the ultimate deal-breaker was the battery issue that others have mentioned. Last straw was taking a video with what started as a full battery charge (fresh off the charger). Literally, in under 2 minutes, the battery was drained and the indicator was flashing that the battery was almost dead.  Come on, Canon, fix this!

Reviews.Title: Awful battery performance
Reviews.Author: Smiley
Reviews.Content: This was rated very highly by CNET and has great reviews.  They all stated that battery life was an issue and they weren't kidding.  The camera, just sitting on my desk powered down, discharges in about a week.  For some reason, they designed the camera to keep the GPS circuit active which I believe is what kills the battery.  So, if you want to use the GPS function, you need to turn it on when needed, but turn it off before shutting the camera off so it doesn't sap the battery.  I'm still experimenting and will update this review as I learn more.As with all camera's these days, the images are very good and the video is also very good.  No complaints there at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it but hate it also
Reviews.Author: Anthony Doodnath
Reviews.Content: Positives about this camera include wonderful and vibrant photos which are truly a notch above similar sized point and shoot cameras.Now for the drawbacks: I am an international customer living outside the United States. Apparently this particular model was supposed to be distributed in the US only because I can't find it on the Canon website to register it. Also features like iPad sync doesn't work outside the US, partly because the iPad app on the App Store is only available to US customers.Batteries, oh the batteries. Luckily I purchased 2 extra batteries along with this camera. On a typical day, we take a lot of pictures so often times all 3 batteries can be spent in a day. This is further exacerbated when taking video. Much has been mentioned about the battery warning icon blinking when shooting video. My experience with this is similar and I therefore hope that this can be resolved by the manufacturer. If it is, then my other hope is that it is made available to international customers.

Reviews.Title: Battery & usability problems, clunky but useful wi-fi
Reviews.Author: A. Benenson
Reviews.Content: I really liked the previous model of this camera, the SX260. It did have the same industrial design issues (see below) but I could overlook them since there weren't any other problems. However, this new model has enough other problems that it's just not worth keeping; I've returned it and I'm going to try a different Canon wi-fi model.- Battery problems: Even after updating the firmware, I'm running into the same problem that others mentioned; the camera will show a full battery symbol until I start recording video, when it immediately shows the low battery warning. If I record anyway, it will automatically shut off after about a minute of recording. Turning it back on shows a full battery again, and it's happy to let me shoot dozens of stills without complaining.- Dumb design: When you're holding the camera, your index fingers naturally end up in exactly the wrong positions - your left finger naturally wants to sit on top of the pop-up flash, which means it'll often fail to pop up and you'll get an error requiring you to restart the camera. And your right finger naturally wants to sit on top of the power button, which is just to the right of the shutter button and looks and feels similar, so you'll often mistakenly turn off the camera when you are trying to take a photo.- There's no true panorama mode - just an assist mode that requires you to stitch photos together later using software on your PC. That's kind of silly at this point when even cheaper cameras from other brands have this feature.- Wi-fi is kind of clunky, it offers a lot of options and it works, but setting it up for web services is tedious- requiring multiple steps on Canon's website and with Canon's CameraWindow software on your PC.The rest of this review goes into more detail about wi-fi....If you want to have the camera use wi-fi to send photos to Google Drive, Flickr, Twitter, etc. or Canon's own similar photo-sharing service, you first need to visit Canon's website to download software for your Mac or PC to register the camera and set up which services you'll want it to access. The process works but it's a bit confusing and some steps seem redundant.However, you can skip all of that if you just want the camera to wirelessly connect to your PC, smartphone, another camera, or a wi-fi printer.To start wi-fi whenever you want to transfer some photos, put the camera in playback mode, hit the "up" button and you'll get a menu showing the devices you can connect to (and any services you had set up, see above). Pick one, and the camera will then ask you choose which nearby wi-fi network to connect to.If it's a new network that requires a password, the camera will display a tiny on-screen keyboard that lets you peck out the password using the direction and OK buttons.Once you're connected, the camera will let you select photos to upload. You can send the current photo, or select up to 50 photos - one at a time (there's no way to select multiple photos in one step). You also can choose whether to send them at original size or resize them smaller (two choices), which will speed up the transfer.The transfer seems reasonably fast and once it's done the camera automatically disconnects from the wi-fi.If you want to transfer photos to your smartphone or tablet instead of an online service, then it's mostly the same process; before you start you need to have installed Canon's Camera Window app on your phone/tablet, and have it open.Once the camera is connected to your phone/tablet, you go through the same steps described above on the camera to transfer the photos to your device. The Camera Window app displays each photo as it's downloaded, and it copies them to your device's regular photos/gallery app.The Camera Window app is very basic; it doesn't let you zoom the photos, and it doesn't provide any way to preview and select photos on the camera (that has to be done on the camera as explained above). There's also no way to remotely control the camera to use it as a sort of wireless webcam for instance.Overall I found the wi-fi features to be reliable and functional, if a bit limited. There are some other wi-fi features I haven't used yet, such as printing or transferring to another camera.

Reviews.Title: A bit of a lemon
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This camera is a fantastic camera - when it works.  I bought this camera to replace my SX230, which was great for a long time.First SX280 worked well, and had the much discussed video low battery indicator issue, but I presumed that it just needed the firmware update, and hadn't got around to applying the fix.  And to be clear, it doesn't just flash the indicator, it turns itself off almost immediately after starting to record video.  I couldn't get more than 20 seconds of video.  Then the unit failed after 3 weeks; screen flickered with a bunch of fuzzy lines, turned off and would never turn on again.Back to Amazon (who blew my socks off by having a replacement to my house on Christmas eve, 1.5 days!)Second SX280 seems to work well, with the exception of the video shutdown.  I presumed that it just needed the firmware update, so I tried to apply it; but my camera doesn't need it, it has a serial number with the 6th digit of '3', meaning it ALREADY has the new firmware on it.Back to Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it for the video.
Reviews.Author: John Tytla
Reviews.Content: Same issue as stated in other reviews but I thought it had to be corrected already......wrong.  when you switch to video mode the battery drains like a sink.  The cannon battery lasts longer than the aftermarket brand I bought elsewhere but it still drains fast.  The zoom works great and really brings the action up close.  For the price it is a good camera but not for video.

Reviews.Title: Returned it
Reviews.Author: Ginny L.
Reviews.Content: This camera took great pictures but the battery problems described by other reviewers prompted me to return it and order the 260 which I'm totally pleased with.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pictures
Reviews.Author: edgar239
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera guru so my review will not give all kind of specs. I purchased this camera to take with me on a recent trip to China and the Philippines. I read all the other reviews and complaints about the camera shutting down when recording video. This camera had all the features I was looking for in a point and shoot camera. I was looking for something with decent megapixels, and with a powerful zoom. I was also looking for a camera that records video in HD. This camera fit the bill for everything I wanted. I was worried somewhat because I read the reviews from others speaking of the battery draining fast, and the camera shutting down when recording video. But I was hopping Canon had resolved that issue with the update. This camera STILL has the same issue. I don't know how Canon can even sell this product. It is flawed BIG TIME. If you use the zoom while recording video, the camera will shut down after hitting the zoom button 2 or more times, and tell you "charge battery." I thought "maybe the battery is the issue." I swapped the battery with 3 different fully charged batteries, and got the same results with each battery. The battery that comes with the camera is about the most decent one out of all the after market batteries being sold for this camera. The battery has the "Canon" imprint on it. I bought 2 other brands from Amazon, and the other 2 brands would shut down the camera as soon as you began recording video for about 5 minutes. The Canon battery worked a few times for about 1 hours worth of HD video, as long as you didn't touch the zoom. As soon as you hit the zoom button while recording video, the camera shut down and gave the message 'charge battery." I was lucky I had brought with me 4 batteries for my Asia trip because I had to swap batteries back and forth in order as not to miss many shots. I still managed to miss some good shots, while changing batteries. The pictures it took were amazing, and when it did work, without shutting down, the HD videos looked very good as well. I was so frustrated with this camera I couldn't wait to get back from Asia to return this camera. Buyer beware, this camera STILL has kinks that the manufacture needs to work out. Buy a different camera or be put through misery as I did as I lost golden moments to share with friends for missed`z shots

Reviews.Title: Brand Loyalty Broken
Reviews.Author: Chris Collins
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent point and shoot photo camera. If you're the kind of person that doesn't want to be troubled with settings and technical information, you just want a great shot of your kid playing soccer no matter where you are on the sideline, this camera will do that. Auto mode does an excellent job of choosing the appropriate settings regardless of conditions and it's hard not to get a decent shot (you know, unless you accidentally take a picture of your foot).That said, why the two stars? Video, that's why. IF you can manage to take a video, the quality is excellent. But don't count on being able to take one. The much publicized battery issues are perhaps undersold. With a fully charged battery, we often can't take a 10 second video before the camera tells us the battery needs to be changed and shuts off. It's effectively useless. Needless to say, we've missed some experiences that would've been nice to get a video of. At this point, we're resigned to having made a poor choice and not being able to take videos. Every digital camera I've owned in the last 12 years has been a Canon, but the next one may not be. Even with Canon's alleged fix via firmware update, the problem has not been resolved. So, we're intensely disappointed with our purchase, but the pictures are great. Canon, if you read this and would like to make it right, that would go a long way toward restoring my brand loyalty. I would say that if you ONLY intend to take pictures, this camera is not a bad option. If you have even the remotest desire to take video, get something else.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from the SX260
Reviews.Author: Kevin Edwards
Reviews.Content: I had the SX260 and loved it.  It was by far the best camera for concerts if you're not able to bring in a DSLR.  Most venues allow these Point and Shoot cameras.I haven't had a chance to use the SX280 in a concert, but will be soon.  The better image processing and speed should make this camera just that much further ahead of the competition.Unfortunately, the WiFi features on this camera aren't very well thought out, and as such, I'm still using an Eye-Fi card with it.The problem with the WiFi is that it seems to have been developed by a marketing group as opposed to engineers working with the camera in the field.  So sure, the WiFi does 3 buckets of tasks:1) Share photos via email and social networking sites like Facebook.2) Sync photos wirelessly with your computer and the Canon Cloud service.3) Transfer photos to your iOS or Android device.So ya, those buckets hit the buzzwords just fine, but unfortunately, very little thought was given to the workflow of the device as compared to the workflow of the Eye-Fi and how people will want to use it.It's unfortunate, because the one weak link in the Eye-Fi is that it's not integrated into the camera itself, and thus always feels in various ways like it's a bit of a hack. So I was really looking forward to the SX280 and the integration of WiFi into it.Unfortunately, Canon kind of blew it.  The biggest problem is that you have to choose between shooting mode and transfer/sync or mode.  When you're shooting, WiFi is completely off.  So unlike the Eye-Fi, you can't just sit there and shoot while your images get transferred to your mobile device.  So the process is shoot, stop shooting, fiddle with the camera, fiddle with your phone, select images to transfer, wait, go back into shooting mode and resume taking more pictures.  This compares to the Eye-Fi where you set everything up and shoot while pictures transfer automatically.Hopefully Canon chages this in a firmware upgrade.Until then, it's important to note that this camera still is best in class (super zoom compact P&S;).

Reviews.Title: DEPRESSING BATTERY
Reviews.Author: Swati Mishra
Reviews.Content: SAME EXACT ISSUE WITH THE BATTERY INDICATOR SHOWING LOW WITH A FULL BATTERY IN VIDEO MODE. I have been stuck with this camera, since it was gifted to me after it was purchased for a month already. When we contacted canon, they advised us to send it for servicing (since it was outside the return window). NO OUT FOR US. SHAME ON YOU CANON FOR NOT OWNING UP TO A MAJOR ISSUE LIKE THIS. RIDICULOUS!

Reviews.Title: Ongoing tragedy and terrific waste of time.
Reviews.Author: Tom Hannigan
Reviews.Content: I usually buy all of my cameras ( Canon and Panny addict here) through Amazon, and have not returned a single one out of the dozen or so purchased over the years. I wished I had done so with my current SX280, for I would have been able to return it and be done with this spawn of Satan.The features and pictures, design and build of the camera are fantastic. Lens is sharp. So what sucks?The video. If you've read any three reviews in a row here, you'll have noticed that the camera shuts down once the zoom button is engaged. The blinking red weak battery icon becomes ever present, and once the zoom button is touched, the camera shuts down after 30 seconds. BTW,  I purchased mine in November 2013, and it had one of the dreaded serial numbers.So I downloaded the firmware and upgraded. Did absolutely nothing.Then I called Canon. They were gracious and had me send the camera in free of charge as it is still under warranty. I got it back very quickly- within 2 weeks, along with a nice note explaining the problems with the camera and how they fixed it.Only they didn't. Same issues. Same red blinking light when the Record button is pushed. Same shut down- but now 5 minutes instead of 30 seconds later- unless you try it twice, and then it shuts down after 30 seconds. Really, Canon? Technicians?So this is why I've taken the time to write a review. Another reviewer mentioned that Canon was not repairing the SX280,, but replacing them with refurbs.  My guess is that so many have been returned they ran out of replacements and just send the camera back hoping you'll go away.  Well. I'm telling you- if you get this camera, put it into video mode with a fully charged battery and a class 10 SD card, and hit Record.  Let it go and see if the red battery icon appears, and also zoom in and out. Leave it recording for another minute, and move the zoom button to the right. If it doesn't shut down, I guess you're ok. Otherwise, you know you have a lemon.Update: I've contacted Canon again, and they are taking the camera in again to see what's up. I will update, as that would be the fair thing to do.2nd Update 3/14/14....Canon sent a refurbished model....that didn't work either. Can you believe it? A refurbished model with the dreaded serial #2 in the sixth number from the left. When I called again and finally got to a supervisor, he wanted me to send the camera back "for another try". I kid you not.. The response was so dry and indifferent that I insisted on a new camera this time.. I have two choices, he said. Send it back or wait to have a Canon Corporate Rep call me. "How long will that be?"  They will call you by later this afternoon. That was 2 days ago.I envy all of you folks who bought the camera with no problems. I would love to be one of you. But really- to send in a new camera- have them send it back as repaired when it is not- send it back again, and get a refurb that is broken as well-and then just say send it back again... I wished I had never had to find out how ineptly and indifferently the Canon service department operates.One more update 3/26/14- Canon made amends and gave me a new camera after I finally got to talk to someone in their corporate office. If you have this string of problems and they get to this point, insist on speaking with someone from corporate. The repair center has zero clout or options. And Canon Corporate WILL call you.

Reviews.Title: Let down by Canon !!!!!!!!!!!! do not buy this.!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy "tech"
Reviews.Content: The issue with the battery going out in the middle of a video recording is not fixed as canon claimed. I had a one with a newer serial number but the recording times were still dismal. Canon should recall this defective item. They don't seems to care about their customers any more. This will be my last Canon product. I have been a loyal Canon fan since the film camera "AE-1". I have bought canon products for the last 30 years over other brands. Not any more.

Reviews.Title: Loved it! and the firmware problem is not difficult to fix
Reviews.Author: Liu Jiahui
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is because the last camera I owned was 6 years old, this one feels extremely easy to use and the 20X zoom is just awesome. I downloaded the new firmware and fixed the battery error within 5 minutes

Reviews.Title: charge battery message all the time
Reviews.Author: Tom Ledbetter
Reviews.Content: Half the time I try to turn it on and the camara says charge battery.This can be right after placing a fully charged battery in it.This is my second Power shot SX that has done this.

Reviews.Title: Battery indicator still a problem with updated firmware
Reviews.Author: aes585
Reviews.Content: I was aware of the battery sensor/camera shutdown problem in video mode before purchasing, but was comfortable installing the firmware update from Canon to address the problem. Fortunately/unfortunately, the serial number of the camera that I got from amazon as of late August indicated that the firmware was updated/current before it left Canon. Had the problem immediately while shooting video or just in video mode (the full battery showed up as red/very low within 30 seconds, then the camera powered down; when restarted in photo mode, the battery showed as full again).After calling Canon, I tried updating the firmware anyway as suggested, but it was the same firmware that came pre-installed on the camera. I removed the battery and SD card from the camera for 20+ min (as recommended in forums/another review here), but no luck. Called Canon back and they're either fixing it or swapping it out for a new camera that's been tested for the issue - the only downside was that generally the customer pays shipping, but when I (nicely) pointed out that the camera never should have shipped as-is (it's a known issue with current firmware), they could make an exception to cover the shipping to their repair facility. It takes 5-7 business days to get the camera back once they receive it, which isn't bad provided they make sure the model they return isn't affected.Will update this review once we have the camera back. :-)FYI for others: Info on the update and affected serial numbers (basically, if the sixth digit from the left is a 0, 1, or 2, you need the update): [...]The firmware update itself can be found at [...] . The PDF instructions that download with the firmware explain the process well; you will need an SD card reader/writer, since you have to transfer the firmware update to an SD card to install on your camera. Download any photos on the card, then format the SD card (which erases any data already on it) before downloading the firmware update and after installing it. Other reviewers have found that the firmware update doesn't always solve the problem without first removing the SD card and battery for at least 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Power On Does Not Work Properly
Reviews.Author: Dobry
Reviews.Content: The camera, as far as I am concerned, takes excellent photos in all ranges, including macro.  However, when the camera arrived it sometimes would not power on immediately after turning it off.  The problem worsened over a few days.  Finally I needed to press the power-on button 5 or 10 or 15 times before it would work.  Conversely, power off always worked without a problem.

Reviews.Title: This was a replacement for defective sx280 - guess we got two bad ones?
Reviews.Author: DMH
Reviews.Content: I really need a pocketable point and shoot as a mom of three active boys.  We also keep a rugged lumix and a rebel in the house.  I liked the stats of this camera and we have had many Canons we have been happy with so I was excited to get the SX280.  With the first SX280 - we also experienced the known battery warning but we didn't get the 30 minutes of video.  I had a 2nd grade play, a high school choir performance, a boy scout court of honor, and some other stuff I wanted to tape.  We brought a spare battery - but we were lucky to get 15  minutes on either battery before the camera died (not just the light blinking).  After the first time this happened, we made sure both batteries were fully charged - same thing happened again.  Since everyone else was saying 30 minutes plus - we sent ours back as defective and received a replacement.  With the second SX280 - we didn't even get to the point of videotaping since within a few days of getting it (and it was not banged around or dropped) - the lens cover would only open about 1/3 the way leaving a diagonal slit to look through.  Part of me wants to try again because people have had good experiences with it and we might just have gotten duds.  A larger part of me thinks i have already lost out on a bunch of irreplaceable memories - which is why I got a point and shoot in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Really nice compact full featured camera
Reviews.Author: KenSoren "Ken"
Reviews.Content: Got this for fathers day so it will replace my Powershot S5 IS that is about 5 years old.  The compact size was important to me since I found myself grabbing my wife's Canon point and shoot to take on vacation and family things so I didn't have to carry the full size camera along.  Another factor is the ability to take HD video which will replace an 12 year old Panasonic video camera.  I read that video is the weak point of the camera but whatever it does will be better than the old bulky Panasonic.Good things that I found so far:- Controls are mostly the same as our other Canon cameras which makes for a shorter learning curve.- Pictures taken so far have been really good quality with the default large file setting.- Auto mode does a good job of selecting the proper mode to use for the photo, but you can select manual if you want to take full or partial control.- Videos are easy to take with the dedicated button on the back of the camera.  No settings to make - just point press the button and start filming.Drawbacks noticed so far:- Battery life appears to be short.  In my first day of goofing around with the camera I drained the battery down in a couple of hours to getting the red  flashing light warning.  Mostly took videos and indoor flash photos so there was probably good reason for the battery complaining but I made a point to order a backup battery in case of emergency. What's strange is that once the camera turned itself off I tried turning it back on a couple of minutes later and it showed a fully charged battery icon and took photos OK but video gave the red battery sign after 30 seconds or so.- The camera has a problem with focusing when in the higher telephoto setting.  I turned off the digital telephoto setting and found that the higher settings are really nice and will eventually focus but it does take a short period of time.- The pop up flash is going to be a problem until I learn how to hold the camera.  It is located at the top front where you left hand holds the camera.  If you finger is over it when it tries to come up it freezes the camera and you need to turn it off then back on to clear the problem which will slow you down a bit.Overall I gave it four stars simply because it is so compact and so feature packed with some minor drawbacks.  Hope it will give me as much trouble free service as my old Canon S5 IS has.

Reviews.Title: Good overall camera
Reviews.Author: Florin
Reviews.Content: So far I love it, great all purpose camera with HD video.Pictures and videos look great, zoom is good.Downsides:- the placement of the flash, where you normally hold the camera.- implementation of the wireless features: you have to go through a cumbersome setup to get Facebook etc configured, and at some point Facebook upload stopped working so I had to do this again.- the wireless range is not great (compared to an iPad for example),-if you want to transfer your pictures wirelessly it will take forever, since it first upload them to a Canon server. So you'll still have to use the cable.

Reviews.Title: SX280 HS battery
Reviews.Author: silversmith
Reviews.Content: Bought the SX280 in December 2014. Experienced the same short battery life well documented in the reviews.  One month later purchased Wasabi Power 3.7V 1300mAh 4.8Wh NB-6L batteries. The battery life is at least double and now adequate battery life. You still need to manage power draw such as WiFi & GPS. I only use WiFi when  in a pinch otherwise will remove the memory card and install in computer. I don't use the GPS.The camera replaced a Elph 210. This camera takes superior images and has simple manual controls to adjust to special situations. The zoom is not grainy like the 210. All and all a great camera,fairly portable and takes great images at a reasonable price.Four stars for shipping with a crummy battery.

Reviews.Title: Great in add-on features but bad in the areas where it matters most
Reviews.Author: Vikram Tatavarthi
Reviews.Content: I like the picture quality, the Wi-Fi feature, the video quality, the flash etc etc...But what's the use when the battery system is so bad that it doesn't allow you take any videos at all. I am having the same problem as the others have mentioned in this forum already.Having this camera is like owning a fully loaded car which asks to refill the gas for every mile. With such a pathetic battery drain experience when you try to take videos, and so many reviews and feedback in several forums from numerous customers I don't even understand why Canon hasn't begun to do damage control.There is no way I will ever trust the Canon brand blindly before purchasing a product from them. I really appreciate Amazon for agreeing to give a full refund even though I just missed the return period. Amazon is truly amazing !!!

Reviews.Title: Taking video with zoom turns camera off!!
Reviews.Author: BRANDON BREAUX
Reviews.Content: I really want to love this camera - It's pretty, compact, great features, good quality photos - but when taking video (with zoom) the camera will shut down automatically.  This is a deal breaker for me!  I even got the latest firmware and experimented with it on several occasions...  I tried taking video at a concert with the battery fully charged and had bad luck.  It will take the video for about a minute or so, but then once I zoomed in it just shut down.  I tried again, then 30 seconds it shut down.  If you don't use video, it's a great camera.  However, if you plan to use the video feature please don't buy.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Image, Compact Size, Battery problems in Video Mode
Reviews.Author: NJ Contributor "Eddie"
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the sharp pictures taken with this camera in all mode.I tried the Av, Tv and Auto Mode and pictures were crisp under different lighting conditions.The zoom is very effective and comes handy in situation where my dSRL can't reach.It's a cheaper alternative than buying an expensive lense for my dSRL and gets the job done.I highly recommend this camera for novice photographers using the Auto Mode and for semi-advanced photographers using the Av and Tv mode.While the pictures does not compare to a consumer grade dSRL, for social network postings it does the job quite well.The wifi features come handy for iPad/iPhone users. I'm able to connect to the camera from my mobile device and instantly upload the pictures to social network or a dropbox.If you are planning to use video features, this camera is not for you. The battery won't last.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Michelle Engeln
Reviews.Content: This camera had trouble with focusing. It was on the highest pixels and still was putting out a small, poor quality pictures. I usually love cannon but not this camera. It may have been a defective one. The reviews were all so great....I was hoping I would feel the same way.  : (

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: S. Mitchell "samintx"
Reviews.Content: I have been using Panasonics exclusively for several years now and on numberous vacations. I have been happy with them and the zoom (I have both 20 and 25 zoom cameras). I guess after what I had been using the Panasonics were so much better. I bought the Canon on a whim because I liked the pics a friend had sent me with his Canon PowerShot. Well, The ZOOM on the this little red Canon is head and shoulders above the zoom on the Panasonic Lumix. I could not believe the difference. My thoughts of Canon would difficulty to learn to use, but I'm finding I was wrong. Interesting setting "Fish-Eye" takes you to some Vivid color settings and some other interesting effects Toy, Miniature, Monochrome, Soft. Not sure I'll use any but the the Vivid Color but for someone these setting will be fun.This camera is only a 20 Zoom. I can't imagine what a higher zoom with Canon would be…X-ray! ;-)) I'm going to investigate more options with Canon.Oh, yes..the reason I gave it 4 stars…I had read the battery life on Video was bad but I noticed I need to put in a new battery after just shooting still pictures. My Panasonic is still a full charge and I have been taking the same comparison pics with each camera. So I think you might need 2 extra batteries if you use this camera out for a day in the woods.

Reviews.Title: Amazon is selling old units with a 1 in the 6th digit of the serial number
Reviews.Author: SiTa
Reviews.Content: I'm disappointed about the battery life issue. On Canon's website, they say if you have a serial number that has 3 or higher, you don't need the firmware upgrade that supposedly fixed the low battery life issue.I bought the camera on January 2014 from Amazon, log time after the issue were supposedly fixed, but I got a unit with a 1 on the 6th digit of the serial number, how is that Amazon is selling old units??I updated the firmware but the unit is STILL defective. Shame on Canon for selling such a lemon. As for Amazon, not sure because no doubt is losing money with all the returns that surely are requested (unless there is an agreement with Canon trying to dispose off the units still in stock)The battery problem occurs whenever using the zoom in video mode. Whenever I try and zoom, it shuts down and says "charge battery." You can turn it back on and you will have a full battery, but if you try and zoom with photo OR video, it immediately shuts down.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: The camera has been OK so far. Obviously takes good pictures with the high mega pixels, zoom, etc. A few things are awkward. When you take a picture that requires a flash, the flash pops up automatically near your left finger holding the camera. It also seems to take a while to focus and sometimes you miss the picture or its blurry because it;s still focussing. Hopefully get used too.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with one major flaw
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: This flaw is that you can hear the zoom while shooting videos. I don't know why Canon manages to keep the zoom silent on their cheaper models, but not on this one. I returned the camera for this reason. Otherwise, the pictures were good, but not as outstanding as others have claimed here.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problems Noted are a Problem
Reviews.Author: Mary Day
Reviews.Content: I like my Canon products but not this one.  So many pictures and opportunities missed because of battery/camera not functioning properly.  Can not recommend it.  I am sending the camera in for repairs but based on others reviews I am not hopeful.  If I have a different experience I will follow up, but wanted to get this information out there to save others from disappointments.

Reviews.Title: Human factors engineering
Reviews.Author: E "T"
Reviews.Content: Making the assumption that this camera was intended for use by humans, the design falls short in several ways.  The power button is immediately adjacent to the shutter button, and nearly the same size and shape.  You will turn the camera off when you think you are taking a photo.  I guarantee it.  Other controls are equally non-intuitive and you will miss pictures as you fumble around with the camera trying to figure out how to configure the flash or make an adjustment.  Your hands will obstruct a sensor or the flash - because you have to hold the camera somehow.They got the electronics right, but the human interface is a fail.

Reviews.Title: Good images, but ergonomics poor
Reviews.Author: Jim Dee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for an adult child, but have been testing it out before giving it.  Let me say that I use a DSLR and have not had a point & shoot for years, so some of my problems is simply inexperience with modern point & shoot bodies. The positives:  I've found the picture quality is very good and have not had the battery problems noted by others.  It's a very nice size and can easily be slipped into a pocket and carried.  I sometimes don't hold it very steady (see a "hate it" item below), but the image stabilization works well.  Now, the things I hate:  The video record button is located where my right thumb tends to rest as I hold the camera to take a shot.  So, many time now, I've started video accidently.... aarggg!,  Same issue with the flash.  My left index finger, while framing a picture, naturally rests on the top corner of the camera, on top of the flash. When it pops up into my thumb I have to start the framing process over.  If I anticipate the flash, holding the camera is not intuitive or comfortable.  Finally, I don't take photos with a phone, so keeping the camera steady at arms length is difficult.  The person receiving this (if I keep it) does take photos with an iphone, so that probably won't be an issue for him.  Overall, I would not keep this phone for my own use.  I will see if the adult child has the same problems I've noted.

Reviews.Title: Good but problems with the battery
Reviews.Author: PETR SIMECEK
Reviews.Content: The camera is pretty good and out images are way nicer since we buy it. The only thing that is driving me crazy is how often I need to charge the battery.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Isaacs "Entreprenuer & Author"
Reviews.Content: Has all the features we needed and takes great clear pics. Love the bigger viewer. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Christopher A. Moreno
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get something to bridge between my iPhone and DSLR that would also be portable. This fit the bill perfectly, esp seeing that it was on sale. I'm still getting used to the features, but have been able to get extensive use so far. I will suggest buying an extra battery as it can eat up power quick depending on settings. Also, some of the batteries out there will actually hold more of a charge. I got the Wasabi brand with a car charger for real cheap and love it.My only gripe is that the flash will get you the first few times if you're not used to it. It happens to be right where I put one of my fingers to hold the camera. So for the first few days It would get stuck on it trying to come up. I'm fairly used to it now and doesn't bother me really.* UpdateJust wanted to make sure that if you get the camera you apply the latest firmware. That fixes all the video battery problems that you read about in older reviews.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: jessie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it takes great pictures.  By far one of the best camera's I've bought in a long time.  Well worth every penny!  I highly recommend this cannon power shot.  Shipping was quick and the camera packaging was quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera....
Reviews.Author: Donald Dixon
Reviews.Content: Delivery of the order was as expected with no damage found.  Camera performs good.  Battery capacity is satisfactory for me.  Great photos.....

Reviews.Title: Potential serious battery problem
Reviews.Author: W. Mao "mwx74"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera simply because of trust. However, the battery problem other reviewers mentioned is real. A few minutes of video, then the camera died. No more shots after turning back on. So disappointed. How could such a problem exist.Lucky to buy from Amazon with great return policy. Will always buy from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life really bad.
Reviews.Author: Puccagirl "Puccagirl"
Reviews.Content: Battery Life is unacceptable for video recording.Prior to purchasing this camera, I checked reviews online and noticed the high rating for this camera so I purchased it.After receiving it, I noticed so many issues... and started to wonder how authentic the reviews were...First I'll do the CON's of this camera:Battery Life:  The battery indicator can show 100% charge, but as soon as you record video, it immediately flashes red saying you're out of battery.Zoom:  Zoom is so noisy when its recording... so bad, its embarrasing.Wifi:  Has limited uses.. just uses more battery, and can't turn it off.Video Quality:  Worse that the camera I upgraded from even though this one is 1080p and my last one was 720p.PROS: Short Lag Time, Zoom At 20x, USB Connector On Camera (not proprietary) , 20X Zoom, Easy To UseNow, after having issues with the battery alerts when recording video, I googled this more in-depth and found SCORES of SX280 users who have the exact same problem with the battery life and complained about it on Canon's online forum.  Canon actually admitted to the problem after being in denial for so long.. and had a firmware update. However, the update did not fix the problem for everyone.After googling further about the SX280 camera, I've completely lost confidence in online reviews. I can't return this camera over this issue, because it was done online and internationally.  I'd recommend that people really check before trusting reviews they see before the purchase.I would NOT recommend this to a friendI replaced a Panasonic ZS7 with this SX280.Noticed right off that the battery life (especially using video) is really bad. My Panasonic battery life seemed to last forever.I'm really disappointed.. and would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Battery drains fully after about 5 minutes of being full
Reviews.Author: MyPenName
Reviews.Content: I had a SX260 but upgraded to the 280.  The battery problem is significant.  The camera identifies that the battery is fully drained very quickly after the battery is charged.  We bought a new battery, and the same thing happens.  We've had this for well under a year.  Many other reviewers have posted the same thing.  Unfortunately disappointed

Reviews.Title: Canon needs to stop selling this camera
Reviews.Author: russ
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this camera before buying and knew about the firmware update.  As soon as I got the camera, I upgraded the firmware that is supposed to fix the battery issue.  As soon as I start using video the low battery indicater comes on and the camera shuts down.  Also the video it records is saved as mp4 file which even the canon software does not recognize.  None of my video editing software recognizes the files and you cannot save it any other way.The camera does take good pictures and is quick, but the battery issue kills all the positives for me.  I will be sending the camera back.  Canon should stop selling this camera due to its issues.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, good pictures, but glitchy
Reviews.Author: Anil K. Taneja
Reviews.Content: The camera is a very good size considering it has a 20x optical zoom. The pictures turn out fantastic since you can disable the digital zoom and still get up close pictures. What I will say is that the software on the camera is pretty glitchy. It will say it needs to be charged periodically for no apparent reason. If you shut it down for a couple of minutes and turn it back on it's fine, but I don't understand why this happens. If it were not for this issue I would definitely give it a 5 star review...but this is very important and must be fixed!

Reviews.Title: Trip Camera with quality distant pics.
Reviews.Author: KRS
Reviews.Content: Seems like an upgrade to SX260 with better picture quality and Wi-Fi connectivity in bonus.  Bettter picture quality in literal sense! Took some pictures of fall foliage and the image resolutions were crisp. HIGHLY recommended for trips.Reserving one star for the battery life. CANON: PLEASE DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE BATTERY LIFE ON THIS CAMERA. It dies off quick enough to upset your partner.Only meant for Point-and-Shoot, videos will kill the batteries in no time.

Reviews.Title: Poor Flash design
Reviews.Author: R. Howells
Reviews.Content: The pop up flash is right where you need to put your finger on such a small, thin camera and the flash is very weak.  Can't take pictures with moving subjects in low light.  The delay between pressing and picture is seconds and the focus doesn't work under this condition in either program or smart modes.  Tryed to take pictures of people dancing with absolutely no success.  Negative comments on battery life and indicator were true in my experience.  When flash is not needed it is a good product.  The auto macro is a nice feature and the zoom is good.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: KOPA "Kopa"
Reviews.Content: SX280 has a known problem with battery indicator on this camera, when switching over to video the indicator flashes and then the camera shuts off, I'm only getting 10 seconds of video on a full charge.  Canon says it's fixed but it's not, it still does it with the firmware update.  If you do buy one and it has this problem, return it immediately, don't wait until the return period is up, I got stuck with it because I didn't test the video until after the return period was over and now I have a sucky camera that cannot be repaired, I believe they have forgotten about all of these and washed their hands of the problem by telling everyone it's fixed, check the Canon Forums, nobody has had theirs repaired, thanks Canon I'll shop elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I will tell everyone I know how I love this little camera!  I grabbed it quickly as we were leaving for a trip and I wanted a small camera with a quicker shutter speed.  I thought I would use the "other" settings but I ended up only using the camera on automatic.  My pictures are wonderful with clear, crisp color, the zoom is outstanding, the detail is great... everyone thought I had used a more extensive camera.  One problem is the placement of the flash, it is where I usually hold my finger to steady the camera so I had to relearn where to place my fingers when holding it.

Reviews.Title: Great megazoom camera!
Reviews.Author: J Box
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Canon camera just before my recent vacation trip to Hawaii.  Generally just the auto setting with point and shoot resulted in excellent pictures.  The mega zoom shots always worked well with good compensation for the distance without blur or loss of picture quality. I purchased a 32mb memory card that easily held the over 800 plus pictures and video from the trip. A good compact case size; just need to mindful of the position of the pop-up flash when holding the camera. The display screen protector I also purchased was definitely a good idea too.  I am very pleased with this camera and it's superb performance.

Reviews.Title: Positives by far outweigh the negatives
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: I do not know much about cameras, but this one is by far the best point and shoot I have owned.  The images I was able to capture on a recent vacation were stunning.  Like many have mentioned the battery light issue can cause issues if you try to shoot video with an already low battery.  With a fresh battery I was able to shoot about 4 minutes worth of video and take about 100 pictures.  I purchased a second battery as a back-up and never found myself in trouble.  The video I took was at night and was very impressive.  The stabilization worked very well.  Night pictures were a breeze and came out very well.  One setting I really liked with this camera was available when using flash in Aperture Priority Mode.  The flash mode is called Slow-Synchro and it slows the shutter speed to brighten the background, I found it was best used if you were taking a photo of something in the shade that required flash while still capturing the scenery in the background.  The time it takes to take a picture from the power being off is very quick.  The only negative thing I can say about this camera is the location of the flash.  I found I rested my left index finger in the same spot the flash pops up from.  Once I condition myself to its location it shouldn't be an issue.  I posted a few pictures this camera took from the vacation.

Reviews.Title: Battery Issues
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a 2 week Baltic Sea cruise.  I had read the reviews about battery life, but I still thought I would be ok as long as I updated to the latest firmware.  I was wrong.  It is a nice camera, and the pictures from the trip turned out great.  However, the battery required constant attention and I had to turn off the GPS (which was a feature I really wanted) to conserve as much power as possible.  The mysterious flashing battery when filming was very annoying.  When I did try to use GPS, I was disappointed with how long it took to find the satellites.  I'm most disappointed that there were several evenings when the camera ran out of juice and we had to resort to camera phone pictures.Some of it is my fault, my previous point and shoot cameras had much much longer battery life.  I should have known that new cameras with all these new features need a lot more power.  I should have purchased an extra battery for the trip.That being said, I did use the WiFi feature to post a few pictures at every port and it was nice to have such a compact form factor.  I like the camera, but I posted my review to warn others that are going on a long vacation to consider buying an extra battery.One other note: I updated the camera to the latest firmware available in July 2013, I cannot attest to whether or not the battery issues have been fixed in later firmware updates.

Reviews.Title: Quite good for compact zoom.
Reviews.Author: Petar Sivenov
Reviews.Content: I have ordered this camera before actually read that some people have a serious battery issues. So I was nearly ready to cancel my order. Now I am glad that I didn't. I still had to upgrade the firmware, and battery still does not last quite long when recording 1080p@60p (thus 4 stars instead of five), but I think they all are over reacting. I received what I needed - It performs decently for the price, both optically and noise levels, has both nice auto and manual controls, 20x zoom is quite versatile feature to have. Plus it has a really decent video stabilization - very pleasing indeed.

Reviews.Title: Great for photos, terrible for video
Reviews.Author: C. Augustyniak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera before a two week vacation to Europe.  I have had three previous models of Canon PowerShot cameras, but wanted to take advantage of the 20x zoom, Wi-Fi and GPS features.  I read dozens of reviews on Amazon describing the low battery indicator issue while taking videos and heard there was a firmware update so I decided to give it a shot anyway.  The short review is that the camera is great, the wi-fi feature made it easy to transfer photos to my tablet and device while I was without my computer and the GPS worked fine if I gave it time to get a good signal.  On a fully charged battery, the camera would show the low battery indicator after 30-60 seconds of video.  I later applied the firmware update and saw the same results.  It may have extended the battery indicator issue to 2 minutes, but in any case, it's a real issue.  I had three fully charged batteries on my trip and was able to survive.  I was taking a video of the sunset one evening and if you could believe it, the camera shutdown a second or two before the sun went down.  Powering the camera back  on and using photo mode you'll see the battery is either fully charged or two thirds charged.I would recommend this camera to anyone who has used Canon PowerShot cameras in the past and does not use the movie mode.  If you are a new customer or frequently take videos I would recommend that you look elsewhere or wait for a subsequent firmware update since the current one doesn't help.

Reviews.Title: Battery Time
Reviews.Author: lofon
Reviews.Content: This camera will only record for approximately 12 to 18 minutes.  I have downloaded the firm ware and it did not improve the recording time.  It does take OK photos. This is just an ordinary camera. Mediocre at best.  So If you want a nice camera phone with more bang. Look elsewhere.....

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY: unusable video feature
Reviews.Author: Vinny
Reviews.Content: This camera is a fundamentally flawed ripoff. I exchanged it twice before realizing I should never do business with Canon ever again. You can't use the video function do to a battery issue, and the firmware update won't fix it. Canon should be ashamed for letting this lemon leave their factory.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Seamus
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great photos.  I use it a lot for outdoor and wildlife photography.  The zoom makes it easy to get great shots of birds and animals without spooking them.  Have also used the video feature, and it has excellent image and sound quality. The flash pop-up is a little awkward sometimes, if you have your finger in the wrong spot.  Overall, very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Quiet Life "Quiet Life"
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, I don't use my camera to take videos so I have not run into the issue with the battery indicator.  I did update the firmware anyway... and will do so again if they have more updates.  I took about 300 photos on one battery and that was when using the zoom extensively... so maybe the firmware update did help a bit.I used the camera for the first time this weekend at the "Tough Mudder" as a spectator.  The zoom on this camera was phenomenal and I used it extensively.  I had no idea how the pics would turn out because I did not have a tripod and was concerned the zoomed pics would be blurry.  I was pleasantly surprised when I downloaded them today and they came out perfectly... all of the pictures did!!!  I had some very weird lighting conditions because of being in the mountains on a sunny day and not being able to choose the angle of where I took the pic from... and even those turned out excellent.  I took a few pics indoors in low light... and again, the pictures were turned out great.I am pretty much a casual photographer, and this camera is, hands down, the best camera I have ever owned.  Absolutely LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot Just Got Even Better!
Reviews.Author: David White
Reviews.Content: I have owned a number of Canon digicams and have come to truly appreciate their consistent quality and dependability.  I like everything about this camera - size, performance, quality, & feature set. The two key features that sold me were the speed and the added wireless connectivity.  With the improved speed, you never get the impression this camera is lagging about doing anything,  The wireless makes is super easy to transfer pictures to my smartphone.  So, I get the quality, mega zoom, and feature set of a great point and shoot camera and the easy sharing capabiities with my phone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point-and-Click
Reviews.Author: J. Brutto "~ RevOf11"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently and have been amazed with it so far.  The thee things I love the most are the 20x zoom that is clear Canon quality, the great shutter speed and the lightning fast save to memory card.  The only downside is that the battery life is horrible.Previously I had a Nikon Coolpix S3100.  It was such miserable experience that I just stopped snapping pictures.  It was slower than I could have ever imagined (saving & start-up), the picture quality was horrible, the versatility wasn't there, etc.  Great battery life, though.I needed a camera to make my next vacation a little more pleasant to film and tried this camera in the store.  Needing to carry around an extra battery doesn't bother me thanks to the quality and speed of this little monster of a camera.  I absolutely love it.Based on the hardware specifications (which you can grab online) it looks like a firmware upgrade might be all that is needed to fix the battery life if they ever publish it (I work with similar hardware problems).Easy to use and absolutely great for someone who knows nothing about photography.  I've snapped more memorable, printable pictures with this in under a month than I did in 2 years with the Nikon S3100.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX280HS review
Reviews.Author: Bruce Koldys
Reviews.Content: This is a camera that takes great pictures, indoors and outdoors. The zoom is great. The WiFi implementation is usable with the Canon app for smartphone. The camera takes great looking video, but herein lies the problem. There is a flaw in which shooting video results in a premature shutdown of the camera preceeded by a low battery warning after 10-15 minutes of shooting. Using the zoom intensifies this issue. The recent firmware "fix" is not a fix, but a very very minor improvement. The problem persists.This camera comes nowhere close to the median or acceptable standard for battery life, in particular concerning video shooting.

Reviews.Title: do not buy this camera from amazon of anyone!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera and went on a weekend fall trip and were unable to do any videos!!!  when we started to record a video the battery would flash empty and when we would try to zoom,  the camera automatically shut down.  very disappointing.  so I called cannon to ask about the problem. they told me that all we had to do was go on there website and download some firmware and this would remedy the software glitch.  I asked why these cameras were still being sold with this problem and not being recalled.  no explanation.  so we went to the cannon website and to update the software we have to purchase a SIm card reader cord for 14 dollars.  The cannon representative some how failed to mention this part of the process to us.  If you want days of frustration and spend more money to update your camera by this one.  I am disappointed in amazon and cannon for continuing to send customers this camera.  Both companies know if it has a particular serial number that those cameras have this problem.  We are amazon prime members and will think about this the next time we go to buy something.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Douglass
Reviews.Content: This camera has a major glitch that undermines its otherwise fine features. The battery indicator is misleading about the actual state of charge of the battery, both in still shooting and video. More than once the camera has shut down when the battery indicator showed 2/3 full charge. This has happened after installing the most recent firmware. This glitch effectively significantly shortens the useful life of a battery charge, such that I have found it necessary to carry extra batteries for almost all shooting situations. Even so, I find myself missing shots because the camera begins acting up prematurely. I have contacted Canon and they have dodged my questions about this issue.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update does not improve battery life!!!
Reviews.Author: lilber23
Reviews.Content: I took a chance after reading the poor reviews on the battery life issues with this camera.  I uploaded the firmware update correctly to my camera, and it did not solve the problem.  I am returning it!

Reviews.Title: Movie recording doesn't work
Reviews.Author: S. Jain
Reviews.Content: Same battery issue. Updated firmware but that did not fix the issue. Returned and ordered the older version sx260 hs

Reviews.Title: Great camera, buy batteries.
Reviews.Author: Bryan Z. Wagstaff
Reviews.Content: I have owned cameras in the PowerShot line as well as DSLRs.  I purchased this camera to replace an aging PowerShot for everyday use for my family.Relative to other point-and-shoot cameras I have owned it is amazing. It is on par with my old DSLR from seven years ago. If you just want to point and shoot it does a great job of that.The camera is in the SX family meaning extended zoom, which it does very well. It has a maximum zoom of 500mm equivalent @ f/6.8. That is a pretty reasonable f-stop at deep zoom, especially when comparing the costs. For comparison, the off-brand Sigma DSLR lens for Canon cameras that reaches 500mm @ f/6.3 costs just over $1000, or much more for on-brand lenses. The picture quality isn't as good as a much more expensive DSLR+Lens set up for deep telephoto, but the results are still more than adequate for using on the web professionally.The camera is full featured.  The GPS and auto-tagging is nice for camping and backpacking, or whatever form of travel you are in to. My teens love some of the features like auto-detecting when everyone is smiling and automatically taking a picture, the wink-to-self-timer, and the miniatures mode.  Sunsets and flowers look incredible when 'extra vivid' is turned on.Now the down side.Canon chose a tiny battery to fit in the tiny case. From an aesthetic viewpoint this makes sense. They want it small, lightweight, travel size. They want it to fit in a pocket.However, considering the primary use as a travel and camping camera this makes much less sense.  Yes, the camera must be conveniently small, but not by sacrificing usability.  Recording video goes from a fully charged fresh battery to the camera powering off in about 30 minutes. Leaving the camera on while you walk a trail and take photos gives you slightly more than one hour of battery life.If you are going camping or backpacking or traveling without a battery charger, plan on going through at least one battery pack per day, possibly more. The battery packs are not very expensive (relatively) which is a good thing because you'll need them.

Reviews.Title: HECK ??? Second one was worse ?  -maybe better keep your SX260 or ZS20..........
Reviews.Author: Bears Fan Jim "qm2-703"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 1-31-2014:Just tried another SX280 (tried Best Buy this time), as it has been a couple of months since the first one went back. This camera came with the firmware updated, evidently by Canon themselves. but the news is not good - I got the dreaded battery/video problem. It may be that on my first camera, I was able to shoot a 10min video because I never tried to zoom....as soon as I zoomed on this second unit, even with a battery charged 8 hous, the indicator went red and blinking on me.  A few photos and another attempt at a video, and the camera shut down. It would not even restart. Canon, what have you done to what was a very nice travel cam...???However, I fully charged again overnight, and I can now zoom w/o the problem (???). Will come back here in a couple of days with another update.Latest update 2-4-14:Bad...the video red indicator was back the very next day, and although it is not shutting down as quickly afterwards as the first day, I would not trust it past the city limits, much less on an important event or vacation.Everything else is about 4 stars. A great $189 travel cam, with zero video ability. Some engineering team should be cleaned out, lock, stock, and barrel. To say nothing of the non-existent Chinese quality control dept.ORIG REVIEW :==============My list of top requirements for an everyday camera, or for the lightest possible travel zoom, goes like this:Good to Very Good overall outdoor stillsHighest zoom that fits in a pants pocketVery Good outdoor videoFull manual controlsEasy access to ISO, WB, ev, multiple/continuous shootingGood indoor no-flash performance for restaurants, outings, and indoor travel scenarios.Good enough indoors thru maybe 5-power zoom video for concerts and kids plays.----------------------------------------------------------------------------The SX280 does all the above, but.I just returned the SX280 because:Video seems no better, which surprised me. However, my unit had no battery issue when I ran a 10 minute test on my tripod outdoors. Are other buyers fully charging, discharging, and recharging a couple of times before they run a demanding app like constant video ? Just wondering. Digicams are to me for video clips more like 3-5 minutes. Camcorders are for movies, where you set up a tripod and walk away.Flash performance may actually be 15% stronger on the older SX260.Stills thru ISO 1600 seem equal, but the SX280 ISO 3200 more usable in a must-have-a shot situation, ( I rarely would use either one at 3200 except to raise shutter speed and stop action).... Past that, ISO 6400 available on the new 280 is such a stretch that I'm not sure I would even try it for Facebook photos.Outside my house, GPS seems to require same time to acquire coordinates. I thought I would have more frequent use of GPS for vacation travel, to note exactly where shots were made, but I tend to forget to use it since it's not on all the time.PROS: A./ There is a noticeable improvement in shot-to-shot time.  Continuous shooting is very much improved, maybe doubled in single focus mode, and about 40% better in continuous focus. This is quite remarkable. However, continuous focus is not that well maintained when panning and shooting continuous shots.  B.1/ Still shots side by side indoors showed almost no changes in aperture, shutter speed, or ISO from what was chosen by the older SX260, but many times they did appear better rendered. It was not apparent on a 21" LCD monitor that the improvement was constant in all scenes. Canon engineers are perfectly willing to sacrifice detail for overall noise reduction, that's a known fact. Maybe a good sized HDTV would show Canon's Digic 6 to truly be better in side by side against the SX260's Digic 5, but not my monitor.  B.2/ Now the good news: still shots outdoors are approached in a really different way: the new 280 will shoot low-ISO of 80 or 100, when the 260 model is shooting Iso 320 or 400.... The expected great improvement does not happen, but there is visible improvement in better shadow detail rendered. Why the improvement is not more, given the ISO difference, must be the processing, trying to maintain standard "Canon" color saturation.Didn't try to set up WiFi. I just can't see myself using camera wifi, when I carry a cellphone that will send photos and videos over WhatsApp so easily, and those are not bragging photos, anyway, most of the time just dinner and grandchild pics. Plenty of time later for SD card removal and manipulation to get the REAL bragging level quality of the kids' sports, candid street shots, macros, etc...CONCLUSION:The small physical size, quality of stills thru 3200, perfectly acceptable video, and nice detail in zoom to 20 or 30X, plus the improvement in shot time performance compared to the SX260.....All these make a very usable camera for travel.Particularly, if you do not already have the SX260 or maybe a Panasonic ZS20, or if you have the SX260 or the ZS15 and you want that WiFi and continuous shooting, this new Canon SX280 is certainly worth a very serious look. Short of a much bulkier FZ150 or SX40/50, this is the top game in town right now....

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Yazneiry Reyes
Reviews.Content: Love my camera has lots of features the price was great you can down load the cannon app to your phone and transfer the photo directly to your computer or phone with wifi love it

Reviews.Title: Major problem: power button where shutter release should be.
Reviews.Author: RheumDoc
Reviews.Content: Ergonomically poor design. I frequently turned the camera off when trying to push the shutter release. Very frustrating, especially when you want to take a "quick grab" photo. Hard to grip. Flash pops up where I would normally put my left index finger.

Reviews.Title: battery and software issues
Reviews.Author: Stephen Smith
Reviews.Content: Takes great still pictures. really like the wide angle lens.  Wish it was more reliableBattery drains almost instantly when trying to take videos.Camera give an error message and shuts itself off if left on more then 30 seconds.Amazon won't return or replace it.

Reviews.Title: Great travel zoom camera (if you don't need to take videos)
Reviews.Author: David Barratt
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.We decided to replace on older, very inexpensive, point and shoot so that we could better capture pictures and videos of our kids as they grow. Our older camera could never capture the frantic movements of our kids in focus.The images you can capture with this camera are amazing. The clarity, contrast, and depth of colour have been a serious step up from our last camera, but a fatal flaw makes this camera useless to me.With the battery freshly charged, I took several minutes of video while zooming in and out to see if I could replicate the battery problem that everyone else has been discussing for the last year. At first, I though I may have gotten a keeper, but with anything other than a 100% fully charged battery, I can not get more than a few seconds of video before the battery indicator flashes red and the unit shuts down. Upon powering the camera back up, the indicator will display a full battery charge, but will die within seconds of attempting to film video.If you can get this camera cheaply, and do not expect to film any video, it may be worthwhile to you.I chose to return this camera and purchased the SX700HS instead.

Reviews.Title: Totally recommend this camera as the Best Point & Shoot available.
Reviews.Author: Pete Orlins
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the Best one I have owned. I use to have the PowerShot SX110 then went to a Nikon Coolpix S9100. Was not impressed with the Nikon. It took some good pictures but did not have the versatility and quality of the SX280. The image stabilizer in the Canon is superior to the Nikon and the Image Processor is way better also. The DIGIC 6 Image Processor captures your picture with Stunning and True color. With the Nikon I was always adjusting for brightness, not so with the Canon. This camera also has the capability to take time exposed photos. Making for great night shots. Also the program capabilities allow you to adjust for a particular settings, such as Vivid  Red for sunsets or Vivid to make the color of your picture stand out. Truly a Superior Camera for the price and capabilities. If you wish to spend a little more the PowerShot SX700 is identical to this camera but has a 30X zoom. Also a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but for the location of the flash. Be warned!
Reviews.Author: Oregana
Reviews.Content: This compact camera takes great snapshots. I love the zoom. Overall I am happy with the camera - except for the location of the flash. The flash pops up in the exact spot where I am inclined to place my index finger when holding the camera ready to shoot. The flash pops up and even pinched my finger (and wouldn't let go) one time so far. Well, that's one way to remember to hold the camera without placing your finger in that spot! Ouch! The manual is very clear about explaining how to position your hands for picture-taking. Can't blame the camera or the manual, just the design.Update (6 weeks later): I was taking pictures of my little grandchildren last night and stopped to chat. The camera was still on and in my hand. The camera had then turned itself off - without warning - and in the process, retracted the flash and pinched my index finger which apparently was in the wrong place at the wrong time! I had to yank my finger free - with quite a bit of pain.I am in the market for a new camera!  :(

Reviews.Title: Buy extra batteries!
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: The camera performs very well in all but one critical area. It EATS batteries! I recommend getting backup batteries. Also you can get a more powerful battery than the one that Canon sells. Check out the Vivitar 1700 mAh  NB-6LH replacements. Much more bang for your buck. Otherwise camera itself is excellent.

Reviews.Title: It is a good product
Reviews.Author: Dagomar Hneriques Lima
Reviews.Content: It is a good product. I am adapting to the flash light device, which is of the pop-up type. Pictures have a very good definition.

Reviews.Title: great zoom
Reviews.Author: nassim mir mozaffari
Reviews.Content: incredible capability to zoom. I did have an issue with the battery running out of juice quickly. I have not tried all the functions yet but looking forward to exploring them

Reviews.Title: Be careful if you want if for video! Otherwise excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Rodo
Reviews.Content: If you plan to shoot video with the SX280, be aware of a nasty design glitch that will start flashing the low-bat icon just seconds after starting to shoot video. A full battery will last about 15 minutes before the camera shuts down. Canon didn't solve this with firmware 1.0.2.0, unfortunately.Now with that said, the SX280 is an excellent camera for pictures. I chose it because of the GPS, the Wifi, the 20x zoon and the Digic6 processor. The camera supports A-GPS: through WiFi you update a satellite position database from a server @ Canon, which speed up the satellite detection process. A nice bonus feature is the GPS logger, that will record your location even with the camera turned off. You can download the log and map your track on Google Earth.One sad surpise: no Panorama mode: no sweep and not even the old manual mode of the old 720is to stitch the photos on the PC.Another sad one: no HDR modeI miss these two features that are there on the Sonys HXxxVs compact models.

Reviews.Title: Bought it despite not great reviews
Reviews.Author: Renae
Reviews.Content: I did my research on this camera and while many consumer reviews weren't favorable, various known professional reviews were.  I admit that the zoom does make it slightly more difficult to get an excellent photo in lower light but really its not bad in comparison to many point and shoot cameras (plus you have the zoom when you need it).  I particularly was interested in a camera that I could take with me and get shots of my kids and not have to lug around my Canon Rebel.  This is definitely fitting the bill and I already have gotten excellent shots.Quite honestly I haven't tested out the camera.  That's not why I bought the camera at all.  I did buy the extra battery as recommended but haven't needed it yet.  I would say if videotaping isn't really what you need this camera for then don't be scared to buy it based on previous reviews.  Its a great investment at this price range with great options other than literally just pointing and shooting it!

Reviews.Title: Not up to old faithfuls standard
Reviews.Author: Mrs A.
Reviews.Content: Have a Power Shot SX200 IS 12x zoom which I have had for a few years and love. It lost its capacity to zoom so decided to get a replacement. The camera is much lighter in weight and has a faster zoom which at high magnification is quite unstable this makes it difficult when photographing wild life

Reviews.Title: Battery life is lousy
Reviews.Author: Curious Cook
Reviews.Content: But the camera itself is quite satisfactory. I have an older version of this, and the video on the SX280 is noticeably better. Nice zoom for a compact body, but it really isn't usable beyond 20x, at least without a tripod, so beware. I got it with the Square Trade warranty just in case since the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Takes decent photos but the battery life is awful
Reviews.Author: Darla Eisemann
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift, but am returning it.  This camera sucks battery life terribly!  I charged the battery, took about 50 photos and the next day when I turned the camera on, it told me the battery needed to be charged.  Since I got the gift pack with an extra battery, I did the same thing and got the same result.  I'm buying a camera that doesn't need a daily battery charge.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Grandma Mary
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  I really like how well it takes pictures in gyms. My granddaughter plays basketball and indoor soccer and previously the pictures would be too dark (even though it seems like there's plenty of light).  I was able to get some great pictures at her last game.Setup for WiFi was a bit tricky and I still do not have it set up to upload to facebook. That may have to do with my firewall at home.  I have not had a chance to call Canon and see what I may be doing wrong. So I can't speak to any of the wifi functions of this camera.We went to a TSO concert in December and were able to get some really great pictures.I did buy a spare battery - but the battery life seems to be acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Poor design
Reviews.Author: Elaine Reed
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good, but the design of the camera is bad.  The on/off button and the button to take your picture are side by side, I have missed many photos because I set up the shot and hit the off button by mistake.  When using the flash, I find that the pop up hits my fingers and disturbs my shot. It is awkward to hold the camera when the flash is in operation..  I have had many Canon camera, including my main camera the 60D, but this camera is awkward, I still haven't found a good way to hold it while taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good photos, bad design
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: Yes, the flash, but also trying to open the battery/SDCard door is a pain.  You have to have just the right touch, which I just can't get without trying for 5 min.  As I am trying, I keep hitting the power button.  Very awkward.  I also wish they would have provided a more detailed manual about the features.Quite frankly, I miss my little Sony Cybershot which was much more user friendly and did great artistic things in camera, very easily.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA...But Buy Extra Batteries!
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: So...yes....despite many reviews about the battery not lasting as long, being a long and loyal Canon fan, I didn't think it would be all that bad. But YES....it is that bad, especially if you're videotaping anything longer than 5 minutes straight! It was a good thing I purchased 2 extra batteries...and yes I had to use all 3 that day.So that is the only CON: low battery life if using video feature.Otherwise, the camera is awesome!! The picture quality (as well as the video quality), is superb! And I love the fact that it has such a high zoom for a compact built. Even when zoomed maxed out, the picture quality is clear and superb!Now only if Canon can fix the battery usage during video, I would give it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my families summer vacation to Disneyland and Las Vegas. It takes great pictures and I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: Randy Wirick
Reviews.Content: this camera takes great pictures and the software program was easy to install. I really like the zoom on this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera so far
Reviews.Author: Thomas Gaal
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to replace an older Canon for a big trip and the pictures are awesome.  Zoom is great and low light is excellent with the new Digic 6.
