I used the flash twice in 800+ pictures and usually left it manually off because the pics without even in very low light were that good.

Reviews.Title: Love my Cannon!
Reviews.Author: E. Calero
Reviews.Content: I love Cannon cameras!  I have been a faithful fan since my college days and Cannon does not disappoint with the Powershot SX280.  It is easy to use and the picture quality is excellent.  In addition, you are able to have HD videos with this camera.  It is great for moms who want a little bit of both (picture and video).  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Camera is packed with features
Reviews.Author: pbfl1
Reviews.Content: Great optical zoom in a lightweight, compact package. Photos look great. This camera has more settings and features than most novice and intermediate photographers will ever use. The GPS feature is great for remembering exactly where you were when you took your photo. The Canon software and iPhoto will both show your locations on a map. The Wi-Fi function works incredibly well. I have used it with an Android tablet, an iPhone, a Macbook, and Canon Image Gateway and it makes transferring and uploading photos a snap. When you are traveling and want to be able to quickly share your pictures with friends and family, you will love the Wi-Fi feature. This camera is small enough and light enough to slip in your pocket and go. You will want to keep this camera with you all the time for that can't miss photo op. It is so easy to upload and share photos from this camera that you will say goodbye to your cell phone camera.

Reviews.Title: Cannot say enough about this camera, works incredibly well and super small
Reviews.Author: Jose Inigo
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about this camera, works incredibly well and super small size. It's so compact that it fits in my pocket. The zoom on this is unreal for a camera so small. The low-light shots are great and the quality overall far exceeds expectations for a camera this low in price!

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: helshi lockwood
Reviews.Content: love the camera...one should not have to write a lot of wordsmakes one not want to fill your survey out

Reviews.Title: HAVING FUN WITH MY NEW CANON!!
Reviews.Author: Maria Di Stefano
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun using my new Canon!!  It's light weight and the zoom on it is so fantastic!!  I just love it!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX280
Reviews.Author: David Ryan
Reviews.Content: Order processed, sent and received timely. I bought this for my wife as it is easy to use, easy to take with us, and the 20x zoom works remarkably well. I am pleased with the photos it takes. I want one for myself, but hopefully Canon will bring one out that has 30x zoom.

Reviews.Title: Convenient and easy!
Reviews.Author: History loving Granny
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my son has the same one and he recommended it to me as easy to use. I have not taken photos for quite some time and wanted something I could ease into. I do like this camera and have no issues with it so far. It takes really good photos, is easy to use and honestly, I'm still learning. I can recommend it for anyone who wants a small and convenient camera to take good photos the easy way.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 -great camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce Kaiser
Reviews.Content: We've only had this camera a short while, but love it so far. I have a12 year old Canon G2 that still works great. We wanted a camera that was simple to use and had better video. Always impressed with the Canon build quality.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality photos.
Reviews.Author: William N. Copeland
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with my SX280.  It is compact enough to carry everywhere and easy to use.  The pictures I have taken have come out very well.

Reviews.Title: Shame on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Jon Benfer
Reviews.Content: Shame on Amazon for continuing to sell this camera that Canon knows does not work. Software battery problem, even after returning the first. Don't buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Battery drain with use of video feature
Reviews.Author: elena
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Camera battery immediately drains if I use the video feature. Called Canon directly after checking online and seeing that this was a common issue - figured no point in just getting another one from Amazon. Shame on Canon for continuing to sell this given how common this issue is - only option is to send camera back and hope that canon can repair issue, but it sounds like that isn't likely. Steer clear of this model.

Reviews.Title: Battery Issue Still Exists (As of 2/2014)
Reviews.Author: Rothemon
Reviews.Content: While the specifications and photographic performance of this camera are amazing, the well-reported battery issue still exists, at least on my copy.After researching this camera extensively, I decided to give it a try as most reports of a battery indicator issue were dated from summer to fall of 2013.  A couple of recent reviews indicated that the problem may no longer exist.  I purchased the camera on 2/16/2014 and fully charged the battery before using.  For the first hour or so, I had no issues - frequently cycling between various photo modes and video.  However, then the issues began.  Just like other reviewers have described, the issue is not so much battery life, but the discrepancy of the battery life indication between photo mode and video mode.  The charge indicator can show nearly a full charge in photo mode but when you start recording a video it will drop to below half and turn red.  The camera did turn off on a couple of occasions due to low battery, but when powered up again, the battery indicator showed a healthy charge.Based on about one day of testing I concluded the camera simply could not be trusted and returned it.  This would have been my fourth Canon camera, after enjoyable experiences with an S400, an SD900, and a Rebel T1i.

Reviews.Title: Get past the bad press
Reviews.Author: Mike Mitchell
Reviews.Content: First - I'm not an expert.  I'm just a novice using a camera.  I usually pick it up, turn it on, point and shoot.  In my opinion, this is a great camera.  The wifi is cool - nice to be able to upload images as desired.  The GPS is cool either for posting photos to sites like Google Earth or just for your own organization. The battery life isn't a great as cameras without those features because, frankly, just like anything else the more bells you ring the more juice it takes.  Still, it seems adequate for most needs and it's pretty darn easy to carry an extra battery.Things I particularly like: With a good SD card, the camera is very fast.  I have some older cameras that require you to anticipate and time the shot.  This may not be like the best SLR cameras in terms of speed, but in most cases, it's very quick.  It has a great zoom and produces amazingly clear photographs even when shooting handheld at maximum optical zoom.  I was very impressed.  It also handles low light shots better than anything I know of in it's price range.  I had bought the SX260 last Christmas and was very impressed with it.  This one does just as well, slightly better in low light and the extra features (GPS/wifi) make it a winner.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, very battery consuming.
Reviews.Author: Franklin Caceres Freyre
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is wonderful. But it consumes batteries in such a ridiculous way. I even bought a replacement battery, but is not enough.

Reviews.Title: Zoom is Awesome for a Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Buddy
Reviews.Content: Incredible zoom!  The best i've seen in a compact camera. Quality pictures.  The only down side is battery life is a bit short apparently due to the zooming in and out so have a spare charged battery with you!  And your finger tends to be on top of the flash that wants to pop up so it take a little getting used to having your finger moved over so it doesn't stop the flash from popping up.  I'd buy it in a heartbeat and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous detail with digital zoom
Reviews.Author: Alane Harkin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to keep handy in my car and for kayaking and hiking.  I tested the zoom feature and got great detail on leaves at about 100 yards.  I like the small size in a camera that still lets me shoot in aperture or shutter priority.  My favorite camera is my Canon 60d, a digital SLR, so I want the same quality and similar controls in a compact camera.  I read a review that complained about the flash popping the photographer's fingers off the camera, but I was not bothered by the flash.  It is on the extreme right (photographer's left side when shooting) of the camera and only takes up about half of the depth of the body.  So far, I think this camera is great!

Reviews.Title: After a month it has been working great - video battery life however should be improved
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Let me first state my use of this camera first. I have been documenting our life in the past 13 years with digital photography. I only keep pics that are decent quality/sharpness and I am nearing 15,000 pics. I have gone through a good set of Sony/Panasonic/Canon cameras. I refuse to work cameras that will not fit into my packet.I have owned the SX260 right before this. I love these Canon zoom pocket cameras, they are hard to beat at the current price point. I miss the auto panorama feature most other cameras have in this category. This should be an automatic feature instead of me stitching them together on the computer. I do have loaded the latest firmware, but video battery life is still way to short. I ended up buying a 1,600 mAh extra battery, this way I can manage not running out of battery for my needs. Picture/video quality and ease of use are truly as outstanding as DPReview states it. It starts up fast and I always use the GPS tagging feature. The zoom is so powerful that I am having difficulty not blurring my fully zoomed pics by my shaking hands. I recommend this camera for the family documentary photographers like myself.

Reviews.Title: Almost love it
Reviews.Author: Megan Brown
Reviews.Content: The only thing I have found so far that makes not be be able to "love" this .. the flash pops up on the top corner of the camera. Which sounds fine.. until you ask someone to take a photo for you and they are holding there finger right there. Otherwise this camera is really awesome. its small, easily portable, holds a charge amazingly and takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Great and compact camera
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: The camara is really up to the expectations if you used to have one of these. I used to own the SX230, and upgraded to this one and I can say that I have no complain thanks god.I really like Canon compact cameras, and the versatility that the optic zoom that I get for this price great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: kenw
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something more controllable than the ordinary point and shoot, but still easy to carry around. It  fits easily into a trouser pocket, but it is on the heavy side.The camera allows you to set the shutter speed or the aperture or the "film" speed and even manually focus, or just go for fully automatic. I think the highest ISO speed is 6400, which is very sensitive.Thankfully there is no touch screen, just the normal Canon set of buttons + a knurled ring that is pretty easy to use with a bit of practice.You can turn on or off  the GPS function. Fun to play with sometimes, but probably eats up battery time.Because of the amazing image stabilization the X20 zoom can be used simply hand held.I read a lot of comments about the poor battery life of this camera. I found that there is an ECO function which switches off the display after a second or two of non operation, and switch the display on if you touch any of the controls - I got used to this very quickly, and it should extend battery  time, but I have not had any problems so far anyway.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Meeks
Reviews.Content: Got this for my dad and he loves it! He had a Panasonic and we got this one since it had good reviews. H said it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, but the flash is problematic
Reviews.Author: mysteriouscloaks
Reviews.Content: This is our third Canon PowerShot since 2004 - needless to say, we love these cameras. Lightweight, easy to use, and  they produce great photos outdoors - hubby likes to take close-ups of animals and plants, and this model's incredible zooming capabilities and better focus in low-light situations (shade, for example) have really helped improve the quality of those pictures without having to carry a large camera with a telephoto lens while hiking or backpacking.Our last one was the SD1400 IS, and it lasted us about three years and well over 20,000 shots - until it took an accidental bath in a river. I just ordered a PowerShot 100 HS to have as a backup. Since technology has advanced since we bought the SD1400, we thought we'd try the new CMOS sensor; and who could resist that much more zoom for only 90 grams more? Part of this extra-weight is from the built-in GPS, which we do not use, but some people might find it handy - same thing for the built-in WiFi.As a side note, I  have read quite a few reviews where people complain about short battery life; this was never great with any of the Canons we have had (especially in cold weather), but we always bought extra batteries and a car charger and worked around it. But for all the use this one gets (lots of zooming back and forth, multiple shots in a short time in temperature ranges from freezing to 100 degrees), battery life seems no worse than for the other Canons when we have the GPS turned off and take the pictures off the camera without the WiFi. And so far, we have not had the sudden battery depletion/ battery meter issue that also seems common for this model.So why only the three stars? We have had this camera for only three months, and I'm sending it in for repair because the flash gave up. This is the only model we've had with a pop-up flash, and I'm sure it will be the last one - it is on the top left corner of the camera, right where it's usually nice to stabilize it with the left hand.This one is fairly heavy to hold with just the right hand while zooming ... so to get a good grip, one either  has to hold it on top the GPS plate in the middle (which is somewhat awkward and partially obscures the display if you have short fingers), or hold it in the bottom corner with the left thumb making nice fingerprints on the display in the back. This might seem trivial, but if you have it set to Auto, the flash pops up without warning depending on the lighting (often, it will end up not even going off when taking the picture), so you have to make sure your fingers are out of the way.That said, even though we have done so meticulously, the flash gave up after only 3,000 pictures total - right now, the camera only works when the flash is turned off.The bottom line: The camera takes great photos, and the zoom is wonderful - but I would much prefer if Canon took out that GPS and put a built-in flash in their next model instead of a pop-up, like they have with a lot of their other compact digitals. This one is a bit too fiddly and I'm worried that we'll have continuous mechanical issues or drop the camera one day because of that awkward positioning.

Reviews.Title: Very Good P&S;
Reviews.Author: Liscia
Reviews.Content: A gift for my wife which she finds very attractive in red. Performanceis as expected and images are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Super Camera and GREAT vendor.
Reviews.Author: Timothy Kolber "TimmyK"
Reviews.Content: Quick delivery and exactly what I wanted. Vendor tops and kept me in the loop.  Used in Rome and Termiloi Italy. What a great camera. 99% of my shots were great and the ones I thought would be bad, came out great. Great for outdoor and indoor shooting. When they say automatic, they mean it. You can shoot super fast and I have a couple shots that birds were caught in flight in shots I didn't even know about till I viewed on my computer. OMG.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality and nice features
Reviews.Author: DB "DB"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera just before a trip to Ireland, because we knew we would be hiking in areas that weren't on maps and we thought the GPS feature would be useful for identifying where our photos were taken. I was pleasantly surprised by the picture quality--for a compact point-and-shoot, it does a great job.  Some of the built-in effects are fun to play around with, as well. The 'miniature effect' can make landscape shots look like part of a model train set. It's also possible to set discreet mode to continuously take photos while the shutter button is depressed, which is a useful feature (and more versatile than the built-in 'sport' shot mode)Pros:--Great picture quality--Wifi and GPS--Lots of versatility with modes, burst shots, miniature effect, etc.Cons:--*very* limited battery life when shooting videos, even after their recent (May/June 2012) software update. If you plan to shoot videos frequently, or videos over 5 minutes long, don't buy this model. Just don't.--clunky software for connection between camera and computer over wifi--GPS takes a while to connect when shooting pictures, even when GPS logger is on

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase this camera because it has some nice advanced features yet is simple to use.  My wife and I have been using the camera for several weeks now and are very happy with the quality of the pictures.  Since we have two young children the sports mode and multi-shot feature work great to get those shots when we are trying to get multiple children to look at the camera and smile at the same time.The camera is a bit more bulky than most point and shots but the quality of the images and the extra features make up for it.  The camera is definitely more than just a step up from using a smart phone camera.  The low light shooting mode works great.  The display is large and it is easy to preview pictures using it.  I also like that the body is easy to hold and on the front there is a protruding piece that helps your grip.  The 20x zoom is a nice feature.  The stabilization feature is fantastic; so far I haven't messed up a photo due to a shaky hand.I do agree with other reviews that the pop-up flash can sometimes surprise you as it pops up just under your fingers.  I have learned to keep my fingers behind it so when it does pop-up I don't need to change how I am holding the camera.  To avoid the battery longevity issue, we purchased two extra batteries.One last note, this is the third Canon digital camera I've purchased.  I have not had experience with other cameras but have helped family members copy images from their cameras to their PCs.  From what I have seen, the software and cable Canon ships with their cameras make it easier for the average computer user to copy and to organize images on their PC.

Reviews.Title: She can take pictures again!
Reviews.Author: dz
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my mother-in-law before an Alaska trip. She is very happy with the wireless feature that connects to her tablet and that it takes nice fast, crisp pictures. She was also happy that her camera was taking better photos than DLSRs from the competition that easily cost two to three times as much.This camera lives up to the Canon name and the Digic6 processor does an amazing job. The 20x optical zoom is fast and clear in all conditions. My mother-in-law is a true left handed person, so many cameras would have sensors and the flash covered by her left hand when she holds the camera. This is not an issue with this camera as nothing is in the way of her left hand.Although a concern before purchasing, the battery life turns out to be fine (100 photos and 10 minutes of video), for her use.

Reviews.Title: Video - low battery warning - 60 Minutes Possible
Reviews.Author: ButterflyGuy
Reviews.Content: I'd advise everyone to stay away from this camera until Canon comes up with a fix for its video issues. Even after doing a firmware update, the camera will show a low battery warning when shooting video and zooming in some cases. I've done some tests - here's what I found.Test 1 - Dial at Movie mode - 1280x720 - Full Charge (FC) -record for 5 minutes - zooming - No Problems.Test 2 - Dial at Movie mode - 1280x720 - FC - recorded for 30 minutes before shutting off. I did not try zooming - note 30 minutes is maximum.Test 3 - Dial at Movie mode - 1280x720 - FC - 26 minutes and Zooming - no problem.Test 4 - Dial at Movie mode - 1280x720 - 2 bars - this is just after Test 3. - around 20 minutes I got Red Low Battery Warning, but it continued recording to 30 minutes. Changing back to picture mode battery shows two bars.Test 5 - Dial at Movie Mode - 1920 x 1080 - FC - seemed fine until I started zooming around 20 minutes and got the RED Low Battery Warning. I'm wondering if using the higher HD settings needs more power - When I turned the camera off and on, it went back to 3 bars on the battery.Test 6 - Dial at Movie Mode - 1920 x 1080 - charge is less as this is right after Test #5. Zooming at one minute and I get the RED Low Battery Warning. Recorded to 24 minutes - so it appears that the Red flashing LightCamera and video setting-up feature that needs a little work is the ability to take a picture followed by a 4 second half video. What I don't like is that it won't take a flash picture in this mode and you can't see the screen during the 4 second video.doesn't mean much when recording video. When I move back to picture mode, I'm getting the Red Flashing Low Battery.Test 7 - Dial at Program mode - automatically changes to 1920 x 1080 for some reason - At 5 minutes - RED Low Battery Warning"  - but it keeps recording to 4 GB limit - 23:51 minutes.Conclusion - even though you will be getting a Red Flashing Low Battery Warning, the camera will shoot 48 to 60 minutes of video depending on your HD settings.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and features combined
Reviews.Author: Alison B Cromer
Reviews.Content: The zoom sold me but I also loved using the multiple shot (sport) feature to catch fast moving scenes.  This is the first time every that I've actually captures whales on film vs just the bubbles in their wake!  My only regret is that it doesn't have a view-finder thus it was sometimes hard to frame the shot in bright sun, or to quickly find the subject of the picture without backing off the zoom.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong!
Reviews.Author: Day
Reviews.Content: First let me say I am an occasional photographer - family gettogethers, grandchildren birthdays and occasional trips. I had 2 criteria that were "musts". 1. I wanted the best camera I could afford that would FIT IN MY POCKET. 2. I wanted lots of zoom (20x). My 7 year old Sony still takes good pics but only 3x. I was blown away when I got the camera a few weeks ago. 1 page of detailed instructions is enough for me....the sx280 has about 200 ! This camera has features I hardly comprehend! Doubt if I'll ever use the GPS or Wifi features.I have taken action shots in burst mode and have some good pics. Recent trip provided some excellent pics at the full 20x mode however best to use a tripod. Hint: I purchased an accessory package that includes a small tripod you can use almost anywhere. Will never go without it! I left it attached to the camera and would hold the tripod in my left hand which kept the camera steadier while shooting. Overall I'm very satisfied with the camera and look forward to using more of the shooting modes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Blackwood
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to alaska only 3 of the 320 pics I took had to be deleted for having soft edges target focus from close to far and far to close was great. Video is really good I have a 32Gb class 10 memory card in it and the vids turned out clear and audio was accpetable.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!!
Reviews.Author: Macman
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is superb, the speed is fantastic. Nothing negative to say about this camera. I am a professional photographer & own many DSLRs but prefer these Canons for traveling. I've owned 6 Elphs, & other series of smaller Canons & this one is phenomenal - gives you the flexibility of aperture priority, shutter priority or just a simple point & shoot auto. Very, very impressed so far but have owned it for only a few days. Wifi is easy to figure out, although not quite as flexible as I would like in my dreams. Would have preferred to post directly from the camera, but it works fine when linked to my iPhone. I have small Canons with16 mp's that just don't cut it in high ISO situations, this one seems to overcome that issue & still delivers excellent resolution at 12.1 Mp's. Lower light shots seem to have far less noise. Overall easy to use, particularly for users upgrading from other Canon point n shoots. Some nice new features that I'm dying to use, but haven't had time yet to try The video I took was striking in its clarity, almost 3D! Oh yeah, the red body is cool too. Just beautiful all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Ultra sharp pictures - fantastic zoom
Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: Really satisfied with our new camera.  Even faraway persons will become sharp on the pictures. And the size of the camera is perfect... Fit into even a small clutch.

Reviews.Title: Best point & shoot I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Deborah Griffith
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! Focus is great, zoom is phenominal and "dark shots" without a flash are gorgeous! It has a solid feel but is light. Best camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: my new camera
Reviews.Author: princess
Reviews.Content: i chose this camera because it was rated very well and it is just what i was looking for. i wish the battery would last longer that is why i gave it four stars instead of five..

Reviews.Title: Super-Shot is a super camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Dimino
Reviews.Content: The short of it is this is a great  compact, point and shoot camera. It's so loaded with features it took quite a bit of time to sort it all out. But it was worth it. I have only taken very few pix and have owned the camera for only two weeks, but I am very satisfied with the results. The build quality of the camera is superb. The controls all work smoothly and battery  charged fully in just three to four hours.I am most impressed with the quality of pictures taken in low light with no flash. The detail is well defined, colors balanced, skin tones are natural, all good signs of a top quality lens and light sensing system. One reminder: THIS CAMERA DOES  NOT COME WITH ANY INTERNAL MEMORY. YOU MUST BUY A SEPARATE SD MEMORY CARD IN ORDER TO USE THE CAMERA AND TAKE PICTURES. I found this out AFTER I purchased the camera. The Amazon site does not make this clear or the Canon site. So be prepared to buy an SD card if you purchase the SX280. Not a deal breaker, however. Buy the card and enjoy your camera. Well worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Larry Barnhouse
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera.. it takes great pictures .. the focus is fast.. you don't miss your shots... I got the camera for my wife so she could take pictures of the grandkids etc. she can throw it in her purse and takes it with her. Other camera I have had like this would never focus fast enough.  This one is quick.. it is fast turning on.People in there reviews were complaining about the battery life.. I don't know what they were complaining about.. I have taken hundreds of shots and it doesn't even show that is down. I get the feeling that maybe they didn't read the directions and make sure that you fully charge the battery before you start using it.. Not sure.. but I haven't had this problem at all.I did use it for taking pictures at a LAX game got amazing pics.. although using the view finder is not suited for sports but it does work.Would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: scadu
Reviews.Content: excellent camera.  quick response, fast focus.  very clear photos.  the performance was excellent.  the size is easy to handle yet small enough to put in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Love Canon products!
Reviews.Author: Randi Case "Randi Case"
Reviews.Content: This pocket size camera is amazing.  20x zoom is awesome.  Can use it in automatic point & shoot or utilize full manual setting like a DSLR.  Both provide the reliability and quality pictures that Canon is well known for.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: Yaritza Serrano Gomez
Reviews.Content: great picture quality!!!! ...good zoom , video and wifi ..canon fix the problem with the battery and now this camera is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great  Photos
Reviews.Author: MarjB "MarjB"
Reviews.Content: This camera was very easy to use.  It provided great versatility; handled all lighting; fantastic photos.  And I LOVE that zoom!

Reviews.Title: Unfortunate location of the popup flash makes this camera a non-starter
Reviews.Author: Bob Allen "fastduke"
Reviews.Content: Location of the popup flash ruins this camera, on the front left side, *exactly* where your place your left hand fingers while using the camera. You'll inadvertently block the flash from popping up.Loved the IQ of the photos from this camera.It's just too bad about the unfortunate location of the popup flash.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - larger than you might think
Reviews.Author: G. Sideman "GS"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from a previous generation s100 - and this review is therefore focused on the differences vs. my expectationsfirst - excellent super detailed sharp pictures, even in low light without flash!It clicks very rapid shots - meaning it takes no time at all to recuperate from a shot before being ready to shoot another, (*if* you are not using the flash).This was one of my major gripes with my previous camera, which I otherwise loved. By the time you were ready to take another shot the moment has passed. This is not the case hereThe long distance zoom is incredible - hard to believe how far it goes - and really lets you bring to the game massive firepower in your pocket.The location of the flash, which bothered so many other reviewers does not bother me at all. It is kind of helpful actually to "feel" the flash protruding against your finger - so you can't help knowing it is being deployed.Also - I have not yet noticed any of the power issues described by some - I'm just back from a 10 day trip to the middle east and did not need to charge it once. Should be noted that I don't shoot video though.My main gripe against this camera, is really not its fault, but misaligned expectations on my part.It is unexpectedly big and heavy - when compared with any other point and shoot "pocket" camera. This is not at all evident from the online photos. Coming from the s100 I was used to the camera being not much larger than an iPhone - and in fact I often carried it in the same jeans pocket as the iphone.This is not the case here. The sx280 is hefty - and with the lens closed is easily 50% larger in depth than my previous camera. It is also probably about double the weight. It still technically fits into a jeans or jacket pocket - but whereas before I would put the camera in my pocket without thinking - this camera requires consideration. It is really more of a purse item than a pocket item - which takes away some of the spontaneity of having a camera just anywhere.So there you have it - I like this camera a lot, and not at all sorry that I got it, but I suppose there is no free lunch, and all this power does have a price - you should be aware.

Reviews.Title: Great features - Battery sensor issue
Reviews.Author: Hatem Sabry
Reviews.Content: This camera has a ton of features, and the the 20x zoom in that compact form is just magnificent. yet the only issue with is is the battery issue.The battery runs out very fast if you leave the GPS logging on, but there is a warning for that.The other issue is that it would give warning of low battery even when fully charged if you record video and use the zoom lens. Once you turn of the camera and back on, it will read the battery correctly again. So it is kind of false alarm.Canon acknowledged this glitch and they published a firmware update to fix it, which was easy to install, yet it didn't fix the problem, the error  reoccured after the firmware update.I wouldn't return the camera for this glitch.

Reviews.Title: Good in some regards, but overall disappointed
Reviews.Author: Limmie
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these and used it pretty heavily for 2 weeks on vacation in July 2013.  I was specifically looking to: 1) Upgrade my video from my 4 year old Powershot; 2) Improve on the 3x zoom of my current camera.  There's hundreds of reviews already so I won't cover everything, just what stuck with me.The good:- Great stills for the most part.  Great movies too, even in low light.  I got excellent footage at full 20x zoom (on a tripod) of a deer browsing at dusk.- A solid feel to the camera.- Batteries charge externally. I have multiple batteries and I can have one charging while using the camera rather than tying up the camera as a battery charger.  Most comparable cameras at best only permit external charging if you buy a special charger.- The camera is still small enough to fit into your pocket (it may cause a shirt pocket to sag a bit).- I totally love the 20x zoom.  Strong enough to really get close while anything more might be tricky to stabilize.The bad:- The movie start button is right next to the mode dial.  Even though my hands are small, I would not infrequently accidentally start a movie and at the end of the day would have to purge half a dozen movies of my shoes from the camera.  The movie quick start button is handy but not right next to the mode dial.- The mode dial is somewhat small, even for my small hands.  Just about all my photos are taken in auto mode or program mode.  It would have been nice if these were next to each other on the dial.- Even with the firmware update the camera still has power display issues. After using the camera for about 10 minutes for general photos I would start a movie and not long after I would get a low battery warning. With the firmware upgrade you can still use the camera but you have no idea how much battery is really left.  Even if you switch back to taking photos the camera will still flash low battery.  I would then turn the camera off and back on and it would say I had a full battery.  You can work with it this way but it can get tiresome, and then when the end really comes you have little warning.  Frankly I did buy the camera also to upgrade my video capability and this issue really messes with that feature even if you can still take movies (kind of like driving ignoring the check engine light).- For me the lack of a panorama mode is a real downcheck.  I was in southern Utah and the Grand Canyon where panorama is a must. Canon does include Photostitch software for you to try to create panorama photos on your computer, but the results I had were satisfactory despite having learned last year after a trip to S. Dakota Badlands that Photostitch is finicky to use.  You really need to switch to fully manual metering mode so your different shots don't get metered differently, otherwise you end up with lines in the sky.  Even though this year I tried to get a lot of overlap between photos I still get a lot of distortion at the edges making it hard to get a good match between photos, and ending up with curved panoramas.  There may be a way to take panorama photos using short movies (especially using the 280's "hybrid" mode), then extract the frames and try stitching a large number of those together (I think other cameras do just that in panorama mode), but my older computer won't run the new Canon software.  Anyway, it just doesn't compare to a true panorama mode.- I never got used to the flash trying to pop up under my left hand.  In the end I just turned off flash mode (see exception below) but of course then I had to turn it back on when needed and turn it off again.  If they had put it in the center of the camera it wouldn't be so bad.- I like taking night photos, and they all tend to be large, distant things such as buildings.  Unfortunately the nighttime mode default is to try to use flash which is no good for a building 100 feet away.  You can turn off the flash, but if you powercycle the camera it will come back on.  Of course then you aren't expecting the flash to pop up and you get a warning message to shut down the camera because of a problem with the flash, etc.- I would get through about 1.5 batteries per day.  Of course battery life will depend upon how and how much you use your camera, but that was how I wanted to use it.  I was a bit disappointed they didn't last longer and was very glad I had 2 spares.  Initially my plan was to go a battery per day while camping and recharge all in motels between tent camping stints.  I ended up daily using my battery charger that plugs into the car cigarette lighter (I still have an old car) and doing it that way, though I didn't like using the car battery.  I was fortunate that the SX280 still uses the same battery as my other Canon Powershot.The So-so:- I don't need wireless so I didn't even try it.- It has GPS but I almost never used it.  GPS uses battery power.  Then too, I usually know where I am when I take a photograph.  There's times I want it and it can't or should not work (won't work in a car, I am not allowed to turn in on in an airplane).  I used it once on a back-country hike, but even then I knew where I was when taking a photo.I ended up returning the camera. I just wasn't happy enough with it to feel that was where I wanted to invest my camera money for the next couple of years.  I still have my old Powershot which definitely is not the same camera but at least takes basic photos.  Basically I was pretty disappointed on arriving home to have to resort to using the web to get decent panoramas to substitute for the ones I had tried to take.  I could live with the short battery life, but the persistent unreliable power indication is simply shabby work on the part of the manufacturer and I feel I should send them a message with a returned product.  It certainly crimps the video capability of the camera, one of my main reasons for upgrading. The flash position and the movie buttons were still an issue after 1000 photos.  There were a few other small things that I don't even remember fully.  Basically I felt I should be happy with the camera, but I wasn't, so back it went.  But... I do miss that 20x zoom!

Reviews.Title: Great shirt pocket  pocket camera (with battery life issues)
Reviews.Author: Jim Doty, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I concur with the other reviews on the quality of this camera and its biggest current flaw, the battery life issues. Most of the time when I head out the door I have a DSLR and two or more lenses with me, but there are times I want to travel light (I rarely need a DSLR when I am at the grocery store) and as nice as the camera in my iPhone is, there are times the iPhone just can't do the job.  So I started looking I for a true "shirt pocket" sized camera with a long zoom range and good image quality for its sensor size. I also wanted to have easy to use exposure controls as an alternative to full auto-exposure (usually aperture priority with exposure compensation or full manual mode). This camera was I chose with all of the features that I wanted.It GPS tags the images it takes (provided you let it find the satellites before you start pushing the shutter button) which is very handy. I can use the GPS tag from a photo and transfer the GPS location to images I take at the same location with a DSLR (the iPhone will do the same thing). Adobe Lightroom makes it easy to do this.This camera has Wi-Fi which I haven't needed or used. But it is there if I should ever want it.I miss not having RAW files that I can convert with Adobe Camera Raw, but a point & shoot with RAW files, and a 25-500mm zoom lens (35mm equivalent) would be too big for my pocket. Faced with a choice between a shirt pocket size camera with a long zoom lens and bigger camera with RAW files and a long zoom lens, I chose the shirt pocket size. If I want a bigger camera with RAW files, I will take a DSLR. In fact, 80% of the time when I head out the door, I have a DSLR with me.The flash works fine but the location takes a little bit of getting used to. It pops up where I want to be holding the top left side of the camera. This is far from a deal breaker and you soon become accustomed to the location of the flash.So this is my "just in case" camera when I think it is unlikely I will be doing any serious photography. The image quality is very good when compared to other camera with a sensor this size.As other reviews have pointed out, battery life is an issue. I carry a couple of spare batteries. Canon is supposed to fix this with a firmware update. Unlike my other cameras, I rarely find myself taking more than a hundred photos in a day with this camera. And if I do, I have the spare batteries just in case.I like this camera a lot and it is a fun to use. It is often with me even when I am carrying a DSLR. If it had RAW files and a longer battery life I would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: beautifull ,perfect
Reviews.Author: zhao zhen
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX280 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image...beautifull ,perfect,very good ,the photo is so good

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera.
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for travel purposes.I took the camera on a recent trip to central america and was very impressed with the pictures I was able to capture. The zooming capabilities are great and you get great shots in different conditions once you play around with the different modes and options. Overall a great camera for the price and size.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Brad R Croft
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear photos, loaded with extras!!! I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for one that is easy to use that takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power shot
Reviews.Author: Susan Grosso
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. WiFi is a bit hard to figure out but I think I finally got it. I was under the impression that the camera could send pics directly to Face Book using the gateway but apparently not. Still it is much better than the other choices on the market. Would help the average person if you had some video tutorials.

Reviews.Title: Firmware Update to Fix Battery Issue
Reviews.Author: Paul L. Peltz Jr.
Reviews.Content: It looks like Canon finally updated the firmware of the SX280 to fix the battery issue!  Hopefully people that are unhappy with the battery issue will see this since it was just released on June 7, 2013.http://www.photographyblog.com/news/canon_powershot_sx280_hs_firmware_update_1.0.2.0/

Reviews.Title: canon sx280
Reviews.Author: Len
Reviews.Content: so far, great performance, This camera takes exceptional pictures, has very good ergonomics, easy to navigate.After comparing pictures taken by Canon sx280 and Lumix zs25, had to return Lumix. These cameras are of the same price, and at the same level, but Lumix has very cheap, plastic feel with poor performance, especially in low light. Now, I think, Canon sx280 is the best in that class of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Still best in its class and improved
Reviews.Author: M. D. Shaw
Reviews.Content: The SX260 was rated best in the travel zoom class.  The SX280 is the first Canon camera with the new Digic 6 processor which increases the low light capability, the AF speed and the frames per second by about 50%.  It also adds WiFi.  The image quality is the best in its class.  That is why I buy Canon cameras, for the image quality.  The image stabilization is also the best. I am glad I waited for the improvements on the SX280 over the SX260 before I made the purchase.  This camera is the perfect size to always take with you.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera with great image quality
Reviews.Author: M. Good "Movie Junkie"
Reviews.Content: This is my first, what I would consider good quality camera, that I actually did alot of research on the web for. I did not want to break the bank but wanted to spend enough money to get good quality photos. This camera is great. It is definately worth taking the time to read the PDF document that is available when you install the software that comes on the CD. When I got the camera I spent an hour taking pics and they looked good but once I actually read the manual and knew what I was doing and what the different features/settings/etc were the pictures looked super. The main reason I got this camera was because it got high marks for low light pictures and it definately does do great shooting in low light, I have been impressed with the shots in low light both with the flash and without. The built in effects are fun too (fisheye, toy, monochrome), I really like the toy camera effect it makes the pictures look pretty cool. So far everything is as I expected, the pictures look really, really, good, the zoom is amazing, the stabile feature works perfect, and the slow motion video is fun. The flash location does take time to get used to since my finger wants to be in that spot but it really is not an issue once you know where the flash is going to pop up from. I had to read the instructions a few times to get the facebook and wifi setup (probably my fault since I was multitasking) but once I got the wifi setup, the cannon app on my droid phone, and the facebook app configured it was definately awesome. I can't tell you how convenient it is to be able to view the pictures stored on your camera from your phone (using wifi and the canon app) and being able to upload to facebook (there is a twitter option as well as a cannon service but I am just using facebook since that is the only social media I really use for pictures). I really like this camera and think it was a good choice for me, and for you if you are looking for a fun camera that takes super quality photos. I spent some time researching megapixels as my first thought was to get the highest number megapixel camera I could afford, the truth is you don't really need anything greater than 12 unless you are going to print posters or crop tiny areas and blow them up (i do neither). What I read is that the higher the megapixel the more noise you can get in the picture which would affect quality, I'm no expert but I do know that the pictures I get with this camera are amazing! Not sure my wife enjoys me zooming in on her face, you can see every pore and every little wrinkle or fine hair.....its amazing!!! Whatever you choose make sure you research online at a few different sites and pay attention to the pros and cons. Most of the cons for this camera had to do with an old firmware which affected the battery indicator, the cameras released now have the latest software so that is not an issue. Another con was that this camera could not be managed via wifi like some other phones (remote shoot and such) I just needed to be able to view photos and upload them so this was not an issue for me. Another con was no touchscreen but since none of my cameras have ever had a touchscreen this was not something I would miss and not an issue. Below is a compilation of what I found after looking at reviews on about 20 different sites.Good points Slightly superior image quality to peer group Broad 20x optical zoom covers every situation in pocket body 1080p video with zooming, stereo sound and continuous AF Built-in GPS and Wifi Fast continuous shooting up to 14fpsBad points No touch-screen No ability to move the single AF area mode No remote control over Wifi, only image transfer Can't recharge battery over USB. Need to use mains charger

Reviews.Title: Already broken?!?
Reviews.Author: Ross Sanford
Reviews.Content: Flash already doesn't work. Canon product support it terrible. Missed the Amazon.com return cutoff by 1 day.  Even the Canon operator said that there were lots of returns/problems with the flash. Do not buy...

Reviews.Title: One Cool Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: The firmware upgrade addresses 99% of the negative reviews here. The rest are just the silly complaints of Amazon's perennial malcontents who like to find fault with everything. The combination of GPS and WiFi make this camera a knockout in its class. And the ONE thing I care the most about, image quality, puts this PowerShot camera in a class all its own. Buy it and explore its many wonderful features. You won't be disappointed. And BTW, I DON"T work for Canon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Joey Bergin
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to be what it is, a very good pocket camera.The quality of the pictures from this camera is very impressive.  I find that just leaving it on Auto, this camera handles the white balance better than I ever expected.  I have never seen a camera this size take pictures that look this good this easily.I am using a Sandisk Extreme 32 gb card (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007M54E1M/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1) in this camera.A few notes for those looking to buy this camera:1) The wi-fi is very easy to set up and use2) The picture quality is as good as if not better than anything else this size.3) The flash is a little awkward as it pops up from right where you want to put your finger when taking pictures, so be careful about that.4) There is a manual mode, but it is restricted.  For instance, I was trying to shoot 1/250 with f3.5 at 1600 ISO so I could get a full zoom shot of a moving target where my flash was blocked from reaching the subject. The f stop was blocked from going below 5.6 at 1/250, so I had to boost the ISO to get the shot I wanted which ends up not looking as clean. I will also say this, remember this is a pocket camera and not an SLR, so this might have been asking a bit much for its size.5) Video quality is excellent.6) Battery life is decent and I bought these >(http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008TX4I6W/ref=oh_details_o03_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1)< batteries as backups and they have worked well for me so far.If you want a great POCKET camera, this is the way to go.  If you want the camera to do a little more and don't care if it fits in your pocket, I'd recommend the SX40.

Reviews.Title: Another winner from Canon
Reviews.Author: MomofGirls "MOG"
Reviews.Content: I love Canon cameras. I upgraded from another canon point and shoot to this one and I'm very happy I did. I wanted a P&S; with higher megapixels and HD video and wireless capability and higher zoom, and this camera meets all those points. I LOVE the 20x zoom! It works awesome. The picture quality is wonderful. The wireless is a bit time consuming but once I got it all figured out I was able to transfer photos to my iphone and I love that quality.I have yet to test the video.I even got some shots of the moon with this camera! Zoomed in 20x and then enlarged the photo to see craters on the moon! For a point and shoot I was super impressed with that!Get and try it I dont think you'll be disappointed! Now I want to upgrade my Canon DSLR :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Point & Shoot with great optical zoom.
Reviews.Author: Neil Sethi
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  I was at an event where we all took pictures, and then combined them with everyone else's pictures to create a large album.  You can clearly pick out every single picture taken by Canon camera's versus everything else.  Also the 20x optical zoom works like a champ.  I would have liked a little longer battery life, but I just went ahead and ordered a couple of spare battery's to compensate.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: 5th and last canon camera I will buy
Reviews.Author: AndyK
Reviews.Content: It's pains me to write this review as a long time canon user. After my previous canon started to go downhill I decided to step it up and get something that would really be a powerhouse for my mountain adventures. No brainer right? I'll just get another Canon!Huge mistake this time... I'm plagued by battery issues. Nothing worse than whipping out the camera to capture something with a full battery and have the camera tell me the battery is dead. Even better is getting 3 photos into a shoot with a full battery and having it shut off on me.Of course the battery isn't really dead but it's a huge hastle never knowing if your camera is going to work when you need it to. This purchase gets 1 star, although I'll be sure to update if my return goes through and the issue is fixed. I have the newest firmware installed for what it's worth!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - bad/better service
Reviews.Author: Glen R. Graham
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on 4/30/2013.  I own three other Canon digital cameras all the way from a digital rebel to an elph.  I have owned many other digital cameras as well from other manufacturers.  The bottom line on this camera is that it does take nice pictures.  However, it is not a quick point and shoot. You must allow time for the lens to focus. If you are using the zoom function, you do have to be careful to hold very still.  The wi-fi function is virtually useless because the battery life of the camera is so short.  The face recognition is very difficult to set-up.  The pop-up flash does get in the way, but I don't see this as a big problem.  The menu is not user friendly and you really need to study the manual to learn how to use all the different functions.  I really do like the images produced by this camera and have used it as my main working (I take pictures every day for work) camera since its purchase.  Now comes the problem.  I went on vacation to Europe several weeks ago.  I was so happy with this camera that I left by SLR behind.  After two days, the camera began to freeze.  It would take one, two or three photos and then just stop.  I had to press the review photos button to get the lens to retract.  Then it wouldn't work at all for a while.  This continued the rest of the trip and when I returned home.  I have owned the camera less than six months.  I returned the camera to Canon for repair.  They now have indicated that my repair bill will be $258.72 for a camera under warranty. Every time I have called to speak to someone about this information, they refuse to do anything until I resubmit all the details, receipt, address, serial #, etc.  All I can think is that they must be getting a ton of these cameras returned and they are not happy about it.  My last return was with a Kodak digital camera.  Kodak sent me a refurbished camera overnight.  That is the kind of service we should expect from Canon!  So, to re-cap, the camera is not easy to use, does take good pictures, but pray it doesn't break while under warranty (or after, if it lasts that long).UPDATE 9/18/2013:  After four e-mails and one phone call, Canon has replaced my camera at no charge.  I have revised my review from one to three stars.  For picture quality alone, I would give this camera a five star rating for the price and size.  However, other functional issues previously mentioned still warrant consideration.  All that said, I am glad that I have a working camera and I am looking forward to years of use (with my fingers crossed).

Reviews.Title: An almost great camera
Reviews.Author: Clutterless
Reviews.Content: I have had several small auto focus cameras and this one is by far the best. The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is that it does not come with a User Manual. It comes with a CD that contains the user manual and you can download a PDF but it's 197 pages - not something you want to be dragging around with you. I called the company to find out if there is such a thing as a printed manual and they said no and were not terribly apologetic. So if you just want to use the camera in Auto mode which is pretty good most of the time or if you have a very good memory and can memorize the ins and out of all the features in the Camera User Guide that comes on the CD, you'll love this camera. In my opinion, it would be worth a few extra dollars to have a small users guide you can carry with you.

Reviews.Title: Big improvement over older models
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: After a trip in 2013 decided I needed a new automatic digital camera that was good in low light environments.C-Net had a positive review.  Amazon also had many positive reviews.Recently used on a trip.  Completely satisfied.  Works well in low light situations.Prior to my trip, I called customer support since I wanted shots to be at hd quality.  Suggested using the p setting.  Good advice.BTW the battery was not an issue.  However, I did not shoot video or use the GPS function.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Bill Troutman
Reviews.Content: I needed a small camera that had telescopic feature for a summer cruise this year.  Searched the market for the product that fit my needs and this came out the winner. Love all the features and especially like the fact that I can put in my pants pocket.  Amazon had the price and package deal.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy Kruse
Reviews.Content: Easy to use camera, takes good pictures. A nice size to carry in my purse. Easy to load battery and card.

Reviews.Title: Great Pix! Batteries are an issue.
Reviews.Author: ProfHarryHill "Nathan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera despite having read all of the reviews, some scathing, that complained about short battery life in the movie mode. I have to say that I don't take a lot of movies, but the few times I tried this I did find that it would shut down if the battery was not at full charge. So...having extra batteries handy is a neccesity. My theory is that there is so much functionality crammed into this small camera that there is little room for a battery of sufficient size to power it for very long in movie mode. If taking movies is your intention, then this is not the camera for you.That being said...the still photographs from this little camera are stunning. The CMOS sensor is very much better at shooting in low light conditions. It's a very feature rich little camera so I expect to have to update this review when I've had a chance to better familiarize myself with it's many capabilities.The need for extra batteries can't be overstressed though. There is a cheap two-pack of Wasabi batteries for this camera with an extra charger for under $20 available here on Amazon. I highly recommend getting this.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0049XV5LM/ref=oh_details_o06_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1

Reviews.Title: Complaint - it is working real bad
Reviews.Author: Jørgen Larsen
Reviews.Content: Great zoom.However the camera was a big disappointment.It has been taken some 100 photos. But now it will only take a single photo on a fully charged battery.I have bought a new battery -to no avail. I have downloaded the firmeware and reinstalled - to no avail.Now the camera is shipped back for replacement.

Reviews.Title: did I get a previously  returned camera?
Reviews.Author: Sally A. Cruikshank
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious when I opened the new in box camera and saw there were fingerprints all over the viewfinder. But since there were no scratches, I thought I'd just keep it. But now it cannot detect my Sony Vaio computer via wifi, although it detects my husband's same model of laptop across the room. When I turn his computer off it can't find any computer by wifi. We use the same anti-virus programs.The software is on my computer. Canon tech support is closed. Will call them tomorrow but if they can't solve it I'm sending it back. Maybe they sent me a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Ignore the negative reviews and buy a couple extra batteries!!!
Reviews.Author: Beagle Mom
Reviews.Content: I currently own SX40HS and a SX200IS, which this camera is replacing.  The most important thing to me is picture quality and the SX280 really produces nice pictures.  I only use a camera for occasional videos, which I why I bought the extra batteries.  It is small and yes the flash is in an awkward position, but you can move your hand away from it!  Once again my major concern is picture quality.  I also bought a SanDisk Extreme class 10 sd card, and on continuous shooting this camera is faster than any point and shoot I have tried.  The zoom is very nice and the camera does well in low light.  For the price, this is a hell of a deal!

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever.
Reviews.Author: PatC
Reviews.Content: Great in low light; had a Nikon before this and returned it, it was terrible. This takes great low light pics but have not put it thru a lot of other situations yet.

Reviews.Title: great camera, beautiful stills and video
Reviews.Author: Cindy Duran
Reviews.Content: SX280 review:I had the Canon sx230, I liked it's performance but the lens protector got bent and would not always close and open all the way without my finger helping.  So I looked for a replacement.  I shoot a lot of action videos (Karate Tournaments) but I want a camera that can fit in my shirt pocket and the sx230 did a great job.  I shot video in over a dozen events, beautiful results.  This time I wanted HD with 60fps for better stills that I could grab from the video as well as even better video.  I looked at Sony, Nikon and Canon.  I bought the Canon SX280.  It's faster on the stills (turning ON and shutter button reaction time) the 30fps video is great.Problem is no one tells you that using HD 60fps video must have extremely bright lighting and that your SD card will get used up in half the recording time.  The card is no big problem I bought a 32GH class 10, but the lighting is a factor.  I was indoors at hotel ballroom for a tournament and there was not enough light for 60fps, it was quite noticeable in the LED screen.  I shot in 30fps.  I have a feeling that only in the Outdoors will I get enough light for 60 fps.  All in all, I still needed a new camera and the SX280 was the right choice for me.

Reviews.Title: I don't understand the "best in class" hype around this camera.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Bullock
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the "best in class" hype around this camera. Unless iso is set at 80 and aperture at 3.5, the SX280HS takes soft pictures. In low light (a seasonal problem here in the northwest) the SX280HS uses such low shutter speeds that any movement at all is blurred. Noise is noticeable at 200 iso and becomes unacceptable at 400 iso or higher. I'm skeptical about the high sensitivity of the backlit CMOS sensor. The SX280HS is also limited by its relatively slow lens (f3.5).

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: Great pictures....I love canon and when my old canon was no longer viable in its technology 10 years old I bought this one and am thrilled..

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Liam Wulf
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image Stabilized Zoom 25mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full-HD Video (Black)I've had one for about two years and not one complaint do I have.  Meets all my needs and then some.  I'd buy it again; and am thinking of buying a duplicate, just to have on hand.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for this size and price
Reviews.Author: GM
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty much the best camera in this segment that accomplishes a fine balance of image quality, video quality, features and size. I also own the Nikon D90 which I carry to all my adventures in national parks. However hauling a DSLR everywhere is no fun and that's where this camera steps in perfectly. Having researched a lot, I decided to give the SX280 a shot and took it as my solo camera on a trip to Vegas.The camera did a fantastic job of capturing images in varied lighting conditions inside casinos, outdoors in the night and places with mixed lighting. Having used a DSLR, I know the images were definitely not DSLR quality, but they far exceeded my expectations. The night scene mode especially took some exceptional photographs in the night. Yes, the camera still has the software bug which causes the camera to prematurely display a low battery warning. In my experience, this warning is displayed only when using the 'quick video capture' feature in on the the photography modes and not in the dedicated video capture mode. A firmware update is out there to fix it but I haven't updated my camera yet.When I checked out my pictures on my laptop, I felt that the camera could do with a slightly increased contrast and reduced brightness. The pictures appear more vivid on the camera screen than on computer screens. This is however very subjective and for most people, this might just be the best color calibration. I was happy to tweak the brightness & contrast on my pics on my laptop. I tried using the manual mode but found it a little cumbersome to use, maybe because I'm so used to using manual controls on a DSLR. Having said that, the automatic, programmed auto and scene modes did a great job on most pics and did not really make me miss the convenience of manual control. It also has inbuilt wifi which I used but was not impressed by. The execution is clunky and it is not a feature that I anticipate ever using. The battery life of this camera is pretty good. I was able to get through an entire day with the battery dropping by just 1 point.In summary,Pros: Great size-features-price balance, good scene modes, great start time and photo processing time, very good image quality, very good battery lifeCons: Pics have slightly lower contrast and more brightness than ideal, some pics in night scene mode are too 'yellowed', software bug that causes the 'low battery warning'P.S. Also mad props to Amazon! This camera was supposed to be a birthday gift for me but the shipping company messed it up. Their website said it was delivered but I never received it. Amazon stepped in immediately and sent me a replacement which I received a day after my birthday. 5 stars to Amazon and its customer service as well!

Reviews.Title: Great zoom lens and images, very sharp. Of course, the reported battery  problem is extant.
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: Great zoom images, stabilization works very well, fantastically sharp photos.Upon reflection the video requires more power than can be packed into such a small package, so the battery problem is real if you want to do seriously long videos. I have done some fine video with it. Also seems to be a function of the specific battery. If you want a small camera with great zoom and usable video this is it.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on my vacation. I felt the pictures were awesome and it was very easy to use, It probably helps that I had another Cannon before this one. It arrived in time to take on our trip and several people commented on it and asked where I purchased it. Of course I told them Amazon. One aspect that I did not care much about when I bought but paid more attention several moths later, that was the wireless piece. One day I wanted to post some pictures on FB and decided to look into the wireless piece. Connected to my internet and then installed the camera app on my iPad and viola! I had pictures it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT HESITATE- BUY THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: LionessVT
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am a huge fan of Canon.  I purchased this to replace an old Canon from 2005 with the long range zoom and have not been disappointed. My friends and coworkers are continually surprised with the quality of the pictures and the amazing zoom. It feels very sturdy and better built than lesser model powershots.  The image stabilization is amazing even when zooming in low light situations (like the moon) The wifi is tricky to set up, buy extra batteries (you'll need them) and watch the flash popping up (it is in the worse place-right under where you want your finger!)  This has made me enjoy taking pictures again!

Reviews.Title: Poor color in auto mode
Reviews.Author: cruzy42 "cruzy42"
Reviews.Content: Been using this camera for a short while now, including a trip to New York, and I was really looking for something that would have decent color, without having to jump through hoops. What I'm finding is that the camera consistently washes out, overexposes or otherwise produces bland images, particularly outdoors. New York looked like the least exciting city on the planet in my pictures. The color is quite flat on the JPEGs.  The zoom is fantastic, but even at its widest angle the color just doesn't do it for me. Tried fiddling with the settings, which are more limited than on some other cameras I've owned, but had no luck.Going to try to sell this one and switch back to the Panasonic Lumix line. Looks like you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Better than a Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great zoom lens and features that put it in a class that is better than a point and shoot and but maybe not as good as an SLR.  Great camera for when you don't want to carry around a big SLR.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: Only had camera couple of weeks....- pictures taken are very sharp- 20x zoom is good- like the small size of the camera- no negatives at this point, battery life is ok....no issues when taking movie yet ( battery )- forgot....the pop-up flash location is a pain, but soon get use to it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ieshia Robinson
Reviews.Content: Awesome travel camera...great pictures! Glad I purchased it for my trip to India. Love the 20x zoom...caught some wonderful moments.

Reviews.Title: Nice small camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Not as small as the elf line camera that I previously owned but small enough to carry along anywhere.  Takes great pictures and is a big step up from my last camera.  New software is impressive.

Reviews.Title: GR8 Product
Reviews.Author: Bob Black
Reviews.Content: Per the tech reviews this is a Great little camera.  It's easy to operate, has a ton of storage for pictures and HDTV video's.  I couldn't be happier

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Lesley Brook
Reviews.Content: I really appreciated the easy use of this camera.  My prior camera, even though a point and shoot, would disappoint and I would have to fiddle with different settings.  Each picture clear and focused.  My only criticism is that suddenly the battery failed and pictures for the day were over.  Granted, I was on vacation and taking multiple photos and reviewing them, but some warning may have been helpful in my conserving before I got back to recharge for the evening.

Reviews.Title: The Camera is Great
Reviews.Author: Glenn Henriksen
Reviews.Content: We took it on our trip to Turkey and it worked well and my wife and I are pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: amazing but
Reviews.Author: Graduate Student "MA_1978"
Reviews.Content: it is very good camera. good images quality and zoom. even in the indoors. but one thing I dislike is the battery while video recording. you can see some other reviews in the youtube also saying the same.the battery is fully charged but when I record a video and make a zoom while recording the low battery sign starts to flash, and some times turn off the camera. but once you restart the camera or just turn it on again, you'll see the battery indicator says it is fully charged. i think it is a bug in the software of this camera. and the bottom line is if your main usage is pictures I think it is a perfect camera at this price class. but if you want video recording and zooming, this camera will let you down several times.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Willis E. Robinson lll
Reviews.Content: bought this to replace older canon dig 10x zoom,excellent photo quality great zoom, slips easily in pocket,using now on vacation shooting 250-300 pics per day.when shooting shots using zoom at long range  use sport mode seem to get sharper image.i"m glad i bought extra batteries.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for my trip
Reviews.Author: Suzie Q Jones
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy camera for my first trip to Europe. I have a 35mm, but honestly I knew we'd be cramming in a lot of sights in a very short period of time, I really wanted a great point & shoot with no fussing with settings and the new convenience of wifi. I decided to stick to the $300+/- range for my needs, narrowing it down to a samsung, a Nikon (that didn't have wifi) and canon (which I had previously owned an elph). I even went into a big box store to touch and feel the cameras to help in me quest for the "right" camera. Reviews can be frustrating since basically technology may have evolved in some ways with new and exciting advances, but when it comes to the quality of manufacturing their seem to be many complaints. It becomes really confusing, and a bit frustrating.... But I finally picked the Canon, I'm back from my trip and this is what I think after using it for three weeks in 3 countries.First I bought the 2 pack of back up batteries with canvas camera case. The zippered case is a bit of a tight fit but did protect the camera in my purse. Though getting it in and out quickly became a drag, so during high use times I just wore the safety strap and carried the camera. Back up batteries though don't carry as long a life as the canon battery,  so I was glad to have two extra of the back-up brand to get me through my day(along with the Canon battery).The quality was what I expected for quick shooting, minimal adjusting. Good fairly clear pictures especially when lighting is at its best. The telephoto was impressive on this small camera, and I enjoyed this feature in my travels to London and Rome.I will say like others the flash when it decides it needs to pops up (an sometimes when I felt on the auto setting their was ample light) was annoying, especially because you'll probably have your finger there holding the camera.I also (and this was probably operator error) kept turning OFF the camera when I went to take a photo. The buttons are right next to each other, drove me crazy at first...again probably just me.I even unfortunately dropped my camera in the full telephoto open position at the Spanish Steps (on them �) and at first the camera was jammed an wouldn't close or turn off. I thought I had killed it. But my husband gently twisted the lens housing and got it to close and shut off. We were able to get it running and bend the big dent out of the front cover area. Though it's little shutter "eye" that is suppose to close and protect the lens stays a hair open....:-(But it kept up like a trooper through the rest of Rome and on to Dublin snapping away, so I'd say "a toughie".The wifi was a super handy feature while traveling, we had access to wifi pretty much at each destination. I was able to upload my photos to my iPad nightly, then email or use on Facebook and have my friends follow my travels. It was really a great feature to use with my iPad.I felt for the price and size (easily fits in your pocket) and decent quality photo to play tourist, without being one of those "giant cameras around your neck tourists". This really worked well for me.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: Enjoy this compact camera. Only issue is it is a tad difficult to hold the camera when flash is being used.

Reviews.Title: Best "little" camera
Reviews.Author: Alady51
Reviews.Content: I  bought this camera because my brother used and older version (SX260) during a recent trip. Got to admit I was jealous over the way he was able to bring in the far detail closer than I could with my current point and shot pocket camera. (don't get me wrong I still like my old one because it's great for landscapes!)It took some getting use to because the focus has to take a bit of time to settle on a close up.  AND the on/off button is in the WRONG place.  Right next to the shoot button.But I am having a fun time brining that deer across the way in closer and being able to count the points on it's rack!I would recommend this to someone seeking a camera that can definitely bring things closer in a good quality photo but do watch out for that on/off button.

Reviews.Title: SV280 HS with 20X optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Reginald Oka
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Purchased it to replace my Canon 870 IS to use on my first Alaska cruise.  The camera worked beautifully.  It does use battery life but anticipating short battery life (not really) I had a spare battery to pop in.  The only downside (why I rated it 4 Stars rather than 5) is due to the complicated (for me) wifi setup.  Maybe I need to read the manual more carefully.  However, the camera takes awesome shots and with the 20X optical Zoom, I had great shots of a brown bear and some golden eagles.  I am very happy with this camera.  Regarding the Canon 870 IS which I had for years, I liked that camera but the zoom was limited and it was an 8 megpixel vs. 12.1 f MPegfor the SX280 HS.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for what I wanted.!!!
Reviews.Author: K. A. Gilchrist
Reviews.Content: I wanted a relatively small camera with a good zoom, motion stabilizer, Wi-Fi or Blu tooth - and good ratings.  In searching Amazon I kept going back to this one.  After reading the ratings, the issue some people had with short battery life appeared to be a non-issue because the problem was actually the sensor, not the battery.  And newer cameras have already been fixed.  So, after taking a lot of pictures I love this camera!!  Zoom & stabilizer is far better than my expectations. Was visiting Campbell River, B.C., Canada, and took great pictures of cruise ships going down the inside passage and also the light house on Quadra Island several miles away.  The cruise ships were also a few miles off shore and I could fill the frame and still had more zoom left.  Also, I took quite a few action shots of my great-granddaughter pitching in a softball game.  This camera stopped the action in every picture! If you want the movement look in your picture, you can make your own settings.  I will probably always use my camera on Auto, but I did buy the $18 paper manual which covers everything the camera will do in 198 pages.  I have read a lot of the manual and got a lot of useful information even for "Auto" users like me.  I LOVE MY CANON POWERSHOT SX280HS.

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent camera
Reviews.Author: William A. Fuller "The Old Bald Dude"
Reviews.Content: Anti shake could be better. For a 20X zoom it's just not good enough. Auto focus is pretty good. Manual controls are excellent. Access to the features (and there are a lot of them) is very easy. Chromatic aberration is a bit of a problem in high contrast situations. Noise is very low even at medium high ISO. Overall, when this camera shoots a good picture (most of the time) it's a really good picture. I use this camera a lot, and I'm happy with the results about 90% of the time. An optical viewfinder would help a lot, but you just don't get those on compact pointy shoots any more. Tough to see what you are doing if you are shooting in bright sunlight. If you turn off the GPS, battery life is excellent.
