Like most pointy shoots it tends to blow out the highlights a lot, so cranking down the exposure compensation to -1/3 or -2/3 is generally necessary. Compared to the similarly featured Nikon that this camera replaced in my arsenal, this camera is a wonder. It gets most of the shots the Nikon can't. While this review may seem to emphasize the negatives, this really is a strong performer. Easy to use if you're a novice, lots of flexibility if you're not. I point out the negatives because they are there, but even so, they are not as bad as they could be, and are in the competitors I've looked at. I carry this camera in a pouch on my belt, so it is always with me and it sees a lot of action. Near as I can tell, it's as good as it gets for this kind of camera. Not perfect, but very good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Reviewer2012
Reviews.Content: Canon has a winner with the SX280! This camera takes amazing photos, even on full auto! The 20x zoom is one of the reasons I bought this camera. I have absolutely no regrets. Worth every penny I paid for it! I haven't shot many videos yet, but so far I haven't experienced any of the "low battery warning" issues that others have reported. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who wants a quality point & shoot that takes superb photos and videos!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera..Excellent Low Light Performance!
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: Bought this as the default travel camera to replace my aging Canon A590IS - though was a good camera at it's time it's poor low light photos let me down many times. I did my research before buying this so knew exactly what to expect.. but boy it still impressed me with the superb photo quality(for 12MP) and exceptional low light photo quality.I visited National Museum of USAF over the weekend and took nearly 500 photos where almost all of the exhibits are indoor and under artificial light. Shot only in Auto mode with no-flash and it produced great photos with low noise even at ISO 1600 and I'm really glad to see the results which exceeded my expectations.I ran with ECO mode on and battery held for nearly 300 shots(only less than 10 shots with flash thoug, and no GPS). I had my extra battery which came in handy anyway.On the down side as numerous reviewers indicated the battery indicator problem is there and I didn't have time for firmware update. Position of the flash is a little annoyance as I'm still not used to keep my finger away from it. Apart from that smart auto mode incorrectly set the scene to Macro mode for few items but I wouldn't call out it as problem.. as the camera does a good job detecting the scene most of the times.Overall this is a great camera for it's price with great photo quality and nice 20x optical zoom. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery indicator problem not fixed by firmware update...
Reviews.Author: be careful out there "careful listener"
Reviews.Content: ..We all know this.  Anybody purchase a 280 with a 3 in the 6th position of the serial number?  If so, does it still have the low battery indicator problem when taking videos?  I.e.: Has Canon really solved the problem in the newly manufactured units, or did they just incorporate the same faulty firmware update?****UPDATE****>> Canon Tech support says the "3 in the 6th position" cameras have been fixed completely.  I sure hope so!  They also may be getting out an advisory for how to handle cameras with "0,1,2" in the 6 position, such as send them to Canon for fixing.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: linda Zhou
Reviews.Content: good close imaging, and very convenient for wifi function. excellent! it save me a lots of times. I love it

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: I just got this but so far I loved it.  I took this with my to comiccon.  It took great pictures and the zoom was great.  Unfortunately, I was really able to test it at a low light setting since I was taking pictures mostly outdoors or a will lit panels.  The zoom was really great outside.  I saw a few of my favorite actors and I was able to zoom in and get good pictures.  I will try to update again on how it works on low light settings.I did have to upgrade the system but it wasnt too difficult if you just go on their website and download the program.  I wish my wifi was better to be able to send pictures but it was running so slow that even my phone was taking a while to update things.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal picture quality from a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Canon has found a great combination of quality optical components with smart software that in combination make the best out of your photo opportunities. Only noticeable downside is that the battery charge indicator can still be erratic and shut the camera down, especially after video usage, despite firmware upgrade. Definitely recommend the camera though to those who want to combine great picture quality with the compactness of a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Legit Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Runner
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, I mean it's no SLR. But for a point and shoot I have no complaints. The zoom is incredibly and clarity is above average for what I would expect from a point and shoot. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Giglio
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after returning the Canon SX50 for being too big. This camera is nice and compact and fits in my purse, so I'll bring it everywhere. The 20x zoom (digital up to 60x plus) is great. The image quality is really nice and there are a lot of ways to use this camera manually, scene choices, wifi, etc. So many fun options. I'll never get to use them all.I bought a backup battery after reading the reviews. I haven't upgraded my firmware, but with the backup, I haven't had an issue, I don't shoot much video anyway. I also had an issue with the software. It doesn't work on my XP 64bit computer, but luckily I have another computer that runs Windows 7 and I've used the software there.Overall a really fun camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Lens and Image processing.... but buggy!
Reviews.Author: Cosnumer80
Reviews.Content: The camera is amazing! However whenever I turn on the video mode the battery light flashes and the camera eventually shuts down. When I turn it back on again in photo mode there is plenty of battery life left. I had read this was a problem with this camera,  and I assumed it was a software bug, my camera was updated and I still have the problem. I will most likely return the item, if the problem persists.It's such a shame because I used this camera for a few days, and consider it the best point and shoot camera I have every owned. If they can fix the cinema mode bug, I would give this camera 5 stars. I give it 3.5 because of the issue.  you also have to have 3 or 4 extra batteries if you intend on shooting photos and videos all day.

Reviews.Title: Spiffy
Reviews.Author: Zergor
Reviews.Content: I'm not an expert on camera's. After doing a little research and reading reviews on this I decided to pick it up on sale. Got it the day the firmware to address video mode battery error was released. Applied firmware update and started playing. Thus far it has performed well. Still configuring many of the advanced options. Auto seams to work just fine. Pictures using optical zoom are impressive compared to my previous old cannon camera. Very happy thus far.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Shines
Reviews.Content: I'd gotten the SX260, the predecessor to this camera and was really impressed with how well this camera works in lower light situations.  This newer model is working great so far.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Smyth
Reviews.Content: I love this camera - it zooms better than models which cost four times as much.  I had a previous model which I dropped & broke (sadness) and loved the camera so much I bought the exact same one as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: wow!
Reviews.Author: chava freund
Reviews.Content: the camera is amazing! it zooms great and the pictures are so clear.i highly recommend the camera.but for those that are looking for sleek,thin cameras-this is not the one.

Reviews.Title: Good camera hampered by bugs and design
Reviews.Author: Scott Lee
Reviews.Content: I was super excited to get this camera as it has a fantastic zoom lens and Canon performance. These things lived up to my expectations. Unfortunately, several things about this camera take a lot of the fun out of using it.First, there is a persistent bug with zooming during shooting video. The camera tends to shut down if you do so and when you turn the camera back on it insists that it's out of battery. The camera will quickly shut down after much more use and won't revert to normal until the battery is removed. Sometimes this happens without even zooming but as soon as you switch to video mode or start the camera in video mode. After a firmware update this has gotten better but it still happens. I found a sort-of workaround by zooming in another mode and switching to video mode but this is silly considering Canon's reputation for quality cameras.Second, listed in the features is the ability to take high-speed video with your camera in lower resolutions. This is a big feature for me as I've wanted to experiment with this for a while. Sadly, the videos are limited to thirty seconds. This makes sense, given the demands on a camera to take such videos, but this limitation is expressed no where in the literature. I figured the drop in resolution would allow unlimited videos so it was a big disappointment to discover this limitation through usage. Additionally it should be known that the high-speed videos are quite noisy, even in well-lit situations, and lack detail. I figured this'd be the case (as I know a bit about cameras) but people without as much background should be warned.Finally, I'm a bigger guy with big hands and this camera can be a real pain to operate. It's quite easy to toggle auto-flash while using the scroll wheel and when you do so the flash pops up in response. Since it's natural to hold the camera by the corners the flash will likely be blocked by your fingers and cause an error needing a restart. This seems like it could eventually lead to a mechanical failure. In my first day of photography this happened to me ten or so times. Also, it's easy to accidentally turn the camera on while opening the door to the SD card and battery. These may be what we have to live with with these tiny devices.All that said, the camera has a great lens and takes pretty good pictures. Sadly, the drawbacks really sap the usability of this camera for me. I would have returned it except that on my first day using it the thing slipped out of my pocket and took a tumble on the rocks! The good news is that the camera survived with only blemishes to the finish. Totally my fault, now I get to keep it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband's birthday and we took it on our River Cruise through Holland and Belgium.  The colors on the photos are absolutely amazing and we are so impressed by the zoom.  I've never had a small point and shoot that does so well with the zoom feature.  Crystal clear!  Also, he took many pictures of the tulips and they are breathtaking!  Beautiful close ups.  Only one minor feature is that the pop up flash on it is where you usually hold the camera.  Just a small adjustment to get used to though.  Great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: it's just ok
Reviews.Author: M. Hartlein
Reviews.Content: Not very impressed with this camera. It still has the battery issue that I read about in the reviews before buying it. Plus a lot of the pictures we have taken have been blurry, especially with any movement. Consumer reports rated this camera pretty high but I am not so sure about this one.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Peanut
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  The pictures are great.  I'm used to a larger DSLR, so I'm having trouble getting used to a smaller camera in my hand.  I don't know how to hold it because your hand will either obstruct the view screen or prevent the flash from popping up.  As I use the camera more, I'll get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...
Reviews.Author: hai quach
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big techy, but I love this camera. Cannon's easy user friend set up helps makes taking pictures easy. I mostly put it on Auto and the pictures comes out great. Gave it to my sister for her trip to Paris and her pictures were amazing. Even in 20x zoom, the clarity was great.Haven't used it enough to tell you how it does at night or with rapid shots or in motion, but for a basic point and shoot, this thing is amongst the top.I would highly recommend a back up battery. When taking the HD videos, it does drain the battery relatively quick (no more than usual like my cell phone).

Reviews.Title: Finally no blurry pictures!
Reviews.Author: TinaRN "Redtinarn"
Reviews.Content: I've only used this camera once so far, but I'm pleased with the pictures. My biggest concern was not having blurry pictures. Lo and behold none of them are blurry! And I LOVE the zoom! It zooms so far, I could spy on my neighbors if I wanted to! My only complaint with this camera is the size. It's a little too big for my old camera case that held the Nikon cool pix and another compact camera. And besides that, it's very heavy. Oh well I still love it and will deal with the size to not have blurry pictures!

Reviews.Title: As expected, good camera, good supplier
Reviews.Author: A. Chandler ""geek manager""
Reviews.Content: Went with this camera as it rated high in Consumer Reports.  No disappointments so far.  Video is better than our older camcorder.  Wish the paper manual had info on the 12 (yes, 12!) mode settings.  Apparently that info is on the CD.

Reviews.Title: Using for work
Reviews.Author: Aaron Feigum
Reviews.Content: This is a great product with a good zoom for close ups of items. it is easy to load the pics on the computer

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: G. dyson "Likes to review"
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviewers, the camera will not take movies. As soon as you stet, it displays low battery and turns off. Trying power button 2 times will turn it back on, and camera displays full charge.  You can take pictures, but as soon as you try video it turns off. At times the mode selected for pictures gets "confused" and portrait begins to take sports pictures, etc. Returning it today

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera for the money, great bang for buck
Reviews.Author: ARI J COMET
Reviews.Content: To check out more photos taken with this device here in my mini-review:go to arijaycomet (dot) com and look for my Sony/Canon comparison/review!Though not a full-on review, my link above gives you some great outdoor shots taken with the Sony/Canon for your comparison and such-- enjoy!! - Ari(note that I only did a quick test of the unit-- if I keep this device longer I'll provide a more full review on here at a later date)

Reviews.Title: Battery life makes it a non starter.
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: I've have the battery die [shooting video] in about 15 minutes. Also most connection features relay on using Canon's very buggy software and major authentication problems makes this a do not buy. First bad Canon I've ever got.

Reviews.Title: I Love Cannon
Reviews.Author: Sidney W. Frost
Reviews.Content: PowerShot gets better and better. What I like about this one is the 20X optical zoom. I've used it to get photos of birds that are much better than the 10X I had before. The photo quality is better than a larger, more expensive camera I use. This one is a little heavier than other travel cameras I've had but so far it has been worth it

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the money with a few flaws
Reviews.Author: D. Calhoun "davemchine"
Reviews.Content: For the money this camera is packed full of features. What I like best is the 20x zoom and the compact size. What I don't like is the battery life and the interface with IOS devices.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!
Reviews.Author: StormyD
Reviews.Content: Okay... so I may not know how to fully take advantage of the awesomeness that this baby packs but I love it. The zoom is sick and the image quality is quite satisfying. Kinda awkward to have the power button and the shutter side by side, but other than that I really like this camera. Oh! the wifi capability is a super plus. I have the android app that communicates with the camera and I can review the pictures on my phone and share too. BTW.. I bought this one to replace another Canon PowerShot that got stolen which replaced an older model. You can say I have a thing for Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX280
Reviews.Author: Rod jarecki
Reviews.Content: Camera took great pictures on our recent vacation. A lot of people commented on how good the pictures were & wanted to know what kind of camera we had. The only drawback was that your fingers were in the way of the flasher poping up, which was a minor thing that you have to get used to. Other than that, we love the compact size of it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: C. L. Horn
Reviews.Content: The pictures are good but I have had a bit of a problem with the batteries.  I bought an extra one so I could carry a spare with me and am very glad I did since "low battery" seems to come up very often!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy Hicks
Reviews.Content: Camera broke while at Disney. Looked at Consumer Reports and bought this due to great ratings. It arrived in Orlando overnight. It takes fantastic pics from long distance. The sport feature is nearly as good as my SLR camera. I've taken great pics of my son jumping at track meet. My teens love the wifi so they can get the pics in real time for their social media. Best camera I've ever bought.

Reviews.Title: Good Photos. Useless for video
Reviews.Author: JoseLLL
Reviews.Content: I got this camera mainly to record videos with the awesome zoom it has.  However this camera has a BUG that once you start recording the battery drains immediately and eventually shuts down.  If you turn off and on, then battery level goes back to normal.There is a firmware for older versions that is supposed to fix this.  My camera is a newer version and wont install the firmware.Today I tried to record a video and I had to use 2 fully charged batteries and with both of them I had the same result.I can only use this for pictures now.

Reviews.Title: Flash is a problem
Reviews.Author: Dlighttexas
Reviews.Content: I love the camera - but not the pop-up flash. What a pain. The camera takes great shots and the zoom is the best I have ever had on a pocket size camera. Night flash shots take some work to get right, but having to reset the flash every time it pops up gets old. Real old...

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: wow, where do I start??  I love the quality of the photos, the ease of use, the way it fits in my hand, and the zoom is astounding.  All in all I am very pleased with this camera.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a Gift
Reviews.Author: Christopher S. Stewart
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a replacement for an S95 that had been stolen. It was a big hit as a gift.Ease of use. Excellent pictures. All the features I was looking for in a camera that she could carry in a purse or pocket.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT SX280
Reviews.Author: SouthOC "Ellie"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a short period but I love it.  I have always purchased the Canon PowerShots as they are so easy to use and carry.  Recently I also purchased a Canon Rebel SLR, the smaller SLR.  This camera is the smallest of the SLR camera and very easy to use but it is not a PowerShot.I just love the Canon SX280.  They take great pictures and the zoom is great.  I would recommend this camera to those who like to carry a small camera for quick pictures.  This one is a little bigger than my previous Canon PowerShot SD950IS.  Great camera

Reviews.Title: Great for taking pictures, not so reliable shooting videos
Reviews.Author: dwayne pagon
Reviews.Content: Takes good quality pictures, zoom is awesome, very easy to carry around. My only complaint is that when recording videos the low battery/change battery indicator comes on almost immediately even when you just put in a freshly charged battery.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Hariprasad Bekal
Reviews.Content: compact and portable. Very good for travelling with good image clarity. Canon has hit all the points in this camera

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Fred Brent
Reviews.Content: Solves problems for folks with shaky hands. Much smaller for travel than my D60' with almost as good pics. Thanks

Reviews.Title: defective
Reviews.Author: Greg Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera less than 5 months ago, along with the squaretrade warranty.lately, it keeps telling me that my battery needs charging, even when I know it is fully charged. I have to open the battery door and play with it, then it starts working again. A few pictures later...the camera again tells me the battery needs charging again. I open the battery door, play with it, and it starts working again. this happens every few pictures. I wanted to exchange it for a new one, but amazon won't take it back because the 30 day return time is over. the squaretrade warranty I bought, cancelled my warranty, and refunded the warranty price...even though I did not request it to be cancelled..nor refunded. my request was to replace my defective camera, but that hasen't happened..so now I am stuck with a defective camera

Reviews.Title: Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: Intruder
Reviews.Content: Camera is a true 5 Star. However, the soft ware is lacking. Customer service on the software was not helpful.The SX280HS is a super camera. I think it takes better photos than the 260. The zoom is impressive for a pocket camera. WiFi works as advertised. GPS can add to slide shows and of course is great for folks like Realtors, Engineers ...This camera reminds me of the advice "The Best Camera you own is the one you have with you".I have already written a review and recommendation for a friend to purchase the 280.

Reviews.Title: Love my CANON!
Reviews.Author: Vicky99
Reviews.Content: I have been buying CANON cameras as far as I can remember. I wanted to update as my last one had a much smaller screen. This one is just simply great. The zoom is awesome and everything is just like me old one but with more added features. I haven't tried out all the features as yet, but so far so good and I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Eva
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality and easy to use.The camera is slightly heavy, and holding it without covering the popup flash is somewhat uncomfortable.Other than that it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Teresa Krausel
Reviews.Content: I like to be able to carry it in my purse and be ready to take pictures where ever I am.  I especially like the 20x zoom. The pictures turn out beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory R. Schmidt "Greg S"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, I personally shoot a Canon 60D, but the range is good.  While overseas my girlfriend took a lot of actions shots with kids, as well as scenery photos.  The zoom is great, she enjoyed having the capability to get close when she was far away.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but for a video it wil not last more than 10 minutes
Reviews.Author: Ela
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, however if you make a video with the camera the battery will work maybe only for 10 minutes and you're done.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Toniatti
Reviews.Content: This camera works great for taking pictures but when taking movies it only work a short time before it need a battery replacement.

Reviews.Title: SX280 first report
Reviews.Author: Betty Oursler
Reviews.Content: HiGo and used today. Love it.Only drawback is you have to download and print the whole manual.  198 pages.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: cch
Reviews.Content: We’ve had this camera for 6 months and we love it.  We haven’t had any of the battery issues mentioned by other reviewers.  Indeed, we purchased extra batteries because of what other reviewers posted, but we haven’t needed to use them.  Having three grandchildren, we have taken many movies with the camera along with many photos.  Compared to the Canon Elph cameras we have had in the past, the picture quality is amazing with this camera.  We have also been impressed with the photos taken in poorly lit rooms; overall, we are delighted with the camera and we have recommended it to our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: Great casual use camera
Reviews.Author: Lance P.
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer, or even an avid picture taker, but for casual family use, this is a great, easy to use, versatile camera.  Lots of great features.  I really like the large screen display.

Reviews.Title: good camera, maybe too many features
Reviews.Author: K. ronald "Ron K"
Reviews.Content: the biggest problem is they are trying for a camera that does all, hate to inform them it won't work,  most of the negative reviews are about the battery, if you have any experience with the modern digital camera that is one of their biggest down falls, the other is all the batteries are unique, e.g. the sx230 had the nb5 the 260/280 have the nb6 surprise they use the same battery for both cameras. personally i didn't buy the camera to use it as a movie camera, nice additional feature but not primary. if you are going to buy this camera to use it as a movie camera don't.  i have a second camera that uses aa batteries, they don't last long but are easy to find.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: William Reimer
Reviews.Content: Great resolution and telephoto features. Only complaint is the popup flash that is located in the area where we are used to placing our left index finger.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, BUT!
Reviews.Author: Mary A Hatcher
Reviews.Content: The Flash is inconvenient for trying to hold the camera steadily with two hands and the battery doesn't last any length of time.  Need to have spares and they are costly.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Marianne Lowe
Reviews.Content: Although I haven't tried all of the features yet, I've found this camera is easy to operate and takes great pictures. I keep it in a pocket of my purse all the time since it is so light-weight and compact. It's perfect for everyday use and travel.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel McClure
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer by any means, so take this with a grain of salt. I use the camera primarily while out hiking or at social gatherings and so far it has taken nice crisp photos. For a photo dummy like me the auto function works great for point and click shooting. Performs much better than the Nikon Coolpix I had before.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures from a small camera
Reviews.Author: Robert W Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I haven't checked every feature but as of this date I'm satisfied with my purchase.It has performed well for me and I love the wifi feature for downloading pictures.

Reviews.Title: I really hate the camera flash location
Reviews.Author: Chris Kim
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great pictures. I also used Panasonic ZS20 and Canon was better and more accurate in picture quality.I take about 100 pictures a week and I was always a fan of Canon for clarity.This camera's pop up flash is annoying and you need to turn the camera off and on again if your hand accidently prevented the flash from coming up all the way.It's kind of heavy for point and shoot camera.One thing I noticed about Canon is that when I take about 20 pictures continuously shot after shot with flash on it will lag for 10 seconds before the next shot. If you take a shot every 1-2 minute it's not a problem.This was true for all my previous Canon point and shoot camera. I go through about 1 camera per year. When I called Canon they told me it was my sd card speed.I changed it to Sandisk extreme class 10 and it still caused the lag. I will not buy Canon again for this problem.I take many indoor pictures for work and this irritates me since I have to wait. If you turn the camera off and on it disappears.One thing I want to point out is that Canon customer service is excellent.  Panasonic SUCKS!!! They have no knowledge about the product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Willow
Reviews.Content: I have this camera myself, and love it! My grandson was impressed with its capabilities, so I got one for him for Christmas, he loves it as well. The wireless part is great, can send pics directly from camera to i-Pad, iPhone, computer or to any email. The pictures are outstanding and has an excellent zoom. My grandson uses it for taking action shots at sideline of pro football games. Some of his photos are most impressive, all action shots. I took my daughter's family pics for their Christmas cards this year, and they are as good as any photos they have had taken professionally. I carry it in my purse all the time, never know when I might have opportunity for a great shot. I recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awsome!!!
Reviews.Author: Khoa Dang
Reviews.Content: Im absolutely in love with this camera! I mean, Im still a beginner at cameras, but this is the perfect fit for me. I LOVE the special effects, there were varies of things to do on the camera. I love the zoom too, the camera says that it can only zoom up to 20, but actually it goes up to 40!!! I bought this on the 18th and the estimated shipping was on the 24th-27th, but it came on the 21th! Talk about fast delivery. I love this camera! YAY! I know I sound very unprofessional, but really the camera deserves some credit.  The only reason why I rated this camera a 4 star was because the box didn't come with a USB cable. Instead the box was only the camera, the strap, its battery, and its battery charger which was a letdown. On the other hand, I might not need a USB cable anyway so why complain. It was a great match for me, and it should be for you too! :)

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with it
Reviews.Author: Agricola
Reviews.Content: It does everything I would hope for as an alternative to my Nikon DX for photographing birds when I'm out and about. As with other comments the battery loses energy quickly. I carry two charged spares.

Reviews.Title: great zoom & compact/light-weight
Reviews.Author: Brandy M Bockhahn
Reviews.Content: Best compact digital camera! Digital zoom & optical zoom are beyond expectations. Love the manual focus, especially for macro shots. Perfect compact for travel, but has great zoom for surprise wildlife/birding experiences. Battery has good life, unfortunately it must be removed from camera to charge.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Takes great photo's. The camera's body is constructed very well. Nice red color and the cameras zoom is great. The small grip handle in the front of the camera is also a much needed feature for its solid handling.

Reviews.Title: great for its small size
Reviews.Author: Debra Moore
Reviews.Content: Pictures and capabilities are very good, Only down side I have is that it is not as user friendly as my Sony,  It takes longer to get to the right setting and just to perform other functions. And the position of the dial makes it harder to turn.  The 20x zoom is what is so great about this small camera. I don't think the battery life is as long as my Sony either, but it is okay and I got  a back-up battery.just in case.

Reviews.Title: Great semi-DSLR Canon
Reviews.Author: Kevin Kbc "-Kbc"
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Canon cameras, but I do find that with each new generation of camera the controls get a little dumbed down and a little more restrictive.  If you're looking to really get creative and control your shots, the SX280 can *probably* do it, but you'll want to read the owner's guide first.  Having owned several Canon PowerShots over the last 10 years, I expected to be able to use the controls with no guidance.  I guess I'm getting old, though, this wasn't intuitively obvious.I wanted the SX280 because of the 20x optical zoom and the WiFi GPS.  I enjoy shooting on my iPhone because those pictures get geotagged so I can display them on a map, and I missed this whenever I shot with a "real" camera. The GPS works for some but not all shots, and it most certainly kills your battery.  Definitely want to pick up one or two spares if you plan to go out shooting for more than an hour or two.When comparing pictures taken on the Canon to pictures taken on my iPhone, the Canon's pictures stand out for their clarity and vibrant colors, which I have always appreciated about Canon cameras.The fact that I can beam these pictures to my iPhone or iPad (or other Wifi-enabled device) was a surprise treat, but it's definitely nice to get pictures off the SD card quickly and easily, without having to lug a laptop computer around.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Charles R.
Reviews.Content: This will probably my last stand alone camera.(cell phone cameras get better) takes great pics and connects via wifi. SGreat video as well.

Reviews.Title: Some camera actions are hard to figure out
Reviews.Author: Grammy "Susieq"
Reviews.Content: I decided I need to print out the instruction manual. This "purse" camera backs up my DSLR so I am having a little trouble figuring out how to hold it and sharp photos. It really is a great camera though.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Randy Pettigrew
Reviews.Content: So small and compact.. Picture quality and controls easy to use.Like the zoom lens and large viewing screen. Had Cannon cameras before and had good luck with them. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: thancr
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present for my wife. She's wanted a compact camera that can take great pictures and also has a large zoom. This checked all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: Great compact zoom camera
Reviews.Author: Harvey Berger
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera.  We bought it for the 20X zoom and we are using it to take pictures of birds in Florida.  It works very smoothly. The size is great and fits my hand well.  While I haven't used many of the settings, it seems very straightforward to use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Raymond L. Culver
Reviews.Content: The access doors are pretty cheap, but it is a handy camera to use and carry.  The internet connection will eat up your battery quickly, but I just use the sd card to transfer photos.

Reviews.Title: excellent product from amazon llc
Reviews.Author: Douglas Ditty
Reviews.Content: great canon camera, I researched it prior by looking into a consumer rating magazine.it is fast and takes beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Sabine Aeberhard
Reviews.Content: I just like to shoot some pictures and this camera is great for it. Small, pictures come out great, especially the zommed in flowers that I love to shoot.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 12MP Digital Camera with 20x
Reviews.Author: Pinofris
Reviews.Content: One of the best cameras of this class.Allows for full automatic and manual selection of settings.Perfect for difficult pictures in high dynamic environment.Optical zoom range allows for high quality and high resolution pictures despite distance.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alejandra Bentley
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera it takes GREAT pictures for being a small camera! You cannot beat the price for the quality of the product! I dropped my 1st one and the screen got a big crack in the middle of it. It would great still and took great pictures. My son then knocked it over and fell in water so that is the main reason I had to get this one. But I replaced it the next day by buying this one because it is so worth buying and having if you don't want the big heavy Canon. I would really recommend this to anyone who loves taking pictures and wants good quality photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Tazia Middleton
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend got me this camera last Christmas and spent much of the year calling it "the camera" and snatching it from me, so I decided to get her one of her own. This upgraded version does about the same things as last year's but it comes in red which looks very cool. I'd definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jim Radloff
Reviews.Content: It works perfect for me as a teacher to capture the day at school for our Facebook page. I was surprised at the high quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: An awesome camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Dierberg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a Xmas gift for my mother and she loves it.  I love the clarity of the pictures and the zoom is awesome.  I will definitely be purchasing one for myself. For the money I don't think you can go wrong

Reviews.Title: Exceptional camera
Reviews.Author: MAV
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a cheap small camera to carry in her purse, she wanted to take pic on her way to work. I checked all the reviews at amazon and other review sites and finally decided on this camera. My wife has loved it. She has taken over 500 pictures in a short period and they all are fantastically clear. The pictures are as clear as some of the more expensive ones. If you get one you will be well satisfied

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Photos and is easy to Use
Reviews.Author: P. H. Yanoshik "paulaspics"
Reviews.Content: I love the feel of this point and shoot camera, and while I have mostly used the auto setting and the backlight, it just takes great pics. Low light photos turn out perfect. Lots of options and capabilities that I haven't even begun to discover yet. I need a tutorial to start using it to it's full capacity. But even just on Auto, it's wonderful. Battery use has been very adequate..not problems with running out of power. Easy to charge, fits in my pocket or purse. The software is intuitive and easy to use also. I use it for traveling, family events, and sometimes even real estate photos.  It's wide angle and my shots come out lovely.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Kircher
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I needed a new one and this is great buy for the money. I love the quality of the details the photos show.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew R Slaten
Reviews.Content: While I haven't explored all the features available on this camera, so far, it has more than met my expectations for a Canon  camera. It's easy to use.  Only minor negative was getting use to holding it correctly so that when the automatic flash popped up, I didn't have my fingers in the way! Otherwise, I would highly recommend this as a great camera that is easy to use and easy to take anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: David Puerta
Reviews.Content: The Camera has a great quality in images but there is a huge problem with the battery when recording videos, there is a lot of information about it on the web, but it is a great product though.

Reviews.Title: great pictures and simple to use
Reviews.Author: Karl R. Brobeil "Karl"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife to replace a broken olympus. GPS tagging location is neat but battery life suffers. WI-FI is useless. lot faster to pull the card and transfer to pc. Flash in a location you would naturally place your other hand.

Reviews.Title: Compact and Versatile
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: This very small camera has a 20 X zoom going from 25 to 500 35mm equivalent. This makes it the ideal camera to carry where ever you do not want a larger one or an outfit. Be careful not to block the flash but if you do all you have to do is turn the camera off and on again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Janusz Zurawski "jazu"
Reviews.Content: Simply excellent. Clear, sharp image, no need for tweaking. It will be a great addition to my bulky DSLR. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good! but it can be improved....
Reviews.Author: nataliaz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my canon SD850IS, which I still like a lot!, but the 4x zoom is frustrating. So I bought a super zoom compact camera.I miss the battery life of my old camera, really, weeks can pass and there's still battery to take quick pictures. That doesn't happen with the SX280. The camera drains out the battery. It works with regular photos, but as soons as you start playing with manual controls and video, you'll loose the battery.During my last trip, it happened to me many times that the camera suddenly shut down and sometimes it could't completely put away the lens, like if it was lacking power to do it.Picture quality in sunny situations is wonderful, I love it; but in dark ones, its not great. I just couldn't take what my eyes were seeing with the auto function.If you want to use the camera all day, buy a spare battery. Learn to use manual controls, and you'll get better results in dark situations.I'm between "it's ok" and "i like it" because, despite the issues above, I was able to take really great pictures.I haven't tried video in a concert, I'll update...

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: herb
Reviews.Content: Big improvement over my last camera, has a nice wide field of vision and good zoom, starts up quickly, and is easy to use

Reviews.Title: Palm size
Reviews.Author: Kim H. Zietz
Reviews.Content: I like the size of this camera and the zoom lens. It is easy to stick in your pocket and go. There are many features on this camera that I have not mastered as yet.  I will be going on vacation soon and can't wait to see what it can do with portraits and scenic views.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image...
Reviews.Author: Gweedo Murray
Reviews.Content: I gave it 4 stars even though I may eventually go 5.  I hold back as 5 means "ultimate perfection".  I have not had this long enough to give a solid review but am liking it so far.  It is the camera that the SX160 wishes it was.  I was dubious of the picture quality at first but have set it to superfine resolution.  With the 4 GB card in, I am not concerned with being miserly on the pixel/bit usage.  I didn't get this for video, but would use it if and when the need to learn it should strike.  Have yet to read the manual on this as it is fairly intuitive, based on previous experience with my old A2000is cam.  Thanks, experienced photo hounds, who go way deep on the camera reviews.

Reviews.Title: Compact size with telephoto lens.
Reviews.Author: Save vs Value
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for. A compact camera with a better lens, and I found it with this Canon Power Shot. I have another Canon camera, and find them reliable. This one really fulfilled my need. What would of been helpful, to have included a scan disk.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from SX210
Reviews.Author: Lily LaFollette
Reviews.Content: When my Canon SX210 died due to shutter error, I investigated the upgrades to lessen the learning curve and found the SX280 HS to be a good choice.  Better photos, faster speeds and familiarity of functions have made this choice a winner.  I haven't used the wifi or the gps yet and may not need them so at this point they are unusuable perks.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom lens and great features - Still has short battery life in video mode
Reviews.Author: Cal Stevens
Reviews.Content: This is the second SX series Canon camera I have owned.  I love the picture quality and low light capability.  The SX230 I owned previously (the viewer screen died after only a year) also took great high quality pictures but the SX280 has a much better, stronger zoom lens.  I do not like the flash arrangement on the 280 as well as my old 230.  I find that I have a hard time remembering to move my finger off the flash when it tries to raise and causes a camera fault.  I then have to shut the camera off and then back on to reset it.  The picture write speed and power on speed is much better with the 280 so you can make shots faster.  I do not like the placement of the on-off button as well as the one on the 230.  It is right under your fingers where you want to hold on to the camera when you are putting it into a case so it keeps getting turned on when you don't mean to do so.  I loaded the software update from canon to get rid of the low battery warning on video recording but it still occurs after only a short recording of video.  Canon still needs to work on this issue with this camera.  I mostly use my camera to shoot stills so that has not been a huge problem for me, I am still glad I purchased it in spite of it's shortcommings.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Christine Wynimko
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. No delay when taking pix and good quality.  The only thing that needs to be changed is the flash, when it pops up my finger seems to be always on it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Edison Fan "The Professor"
Reviews.Content: So far so good! Good photos indoors and outdoors. Very nice screen and is easy to use. Flash does come in the way when you hold the camera and creates some risk with dropping the camera when it pops up under your finger.It takes good photos taking into consideration the small size.

Reviews.Title: The camera is nice but I think it has a problem
Reviews.Author: Steve Abcarian
Reviews.Content: I like everything but the battery low indicator so far.  I think there is a problem with it.  Can you verify this?

Reviews.Title: Canon SX-280 Superzoom Compact Camera review by Dale (update 4 Dec 2013)
Reviews.Author: Dale Thorn
Reviews.Content: While the Canon SX-280 isn't usually described as a "Photographer's Camera" or using terms like "Prosumer" etc., it does have manual controls and they're very accessible from the main dial without having to hunt for them. Add to that an excellent 25 to 500 mm effective focal length lens, high quality low-noise images, and a compact size that fits into a shirt pocket easily, and I've just described what I think is the best bargain I've ever gotten in a camera that I can take anywhere. I nearly didn't get the SX-280, choosing another brand first, but when that camera broke after sustaining a minor bump, I took a chance on the SX-280 and I'm very happy that I did, since the SX-280 images are far better than the previous camera (when it was working).People who want to see what the SX-280 is capable of can do a Web search for my name, and then view the images on the website that's listed in the search results. There may be a few professionals out there who would not be highly impressed with the SX-280's images, but I had the $2000 Leica X1 for 3 years and currently have the $1100 Nikon Coolpix 'A', and the SX-280's images still amaze me - in some cases even better than what I got with the Leica X1. The image stabilization ('IS', a.k.a. vibration reduction) works very well, and most of the shots I take at full zoom come out sharp. But I don't take chances either - I have a 32 gb memory card and I always shoot in burst mode, so even when hand-shake is a factor, generally I lose only one or two images in a burst. The downside of burst shooting is the time required to compare the images in each burst on the computer, to select the sharpest and best from each burst and discard the rest.I haven't done much with video with the SX-280, but from what I have taken the video quality is excellent (inspecting each frame one-by-one in Quicktime), although there is enough internal background noise (or whatever it is) that you'll get best results with the sound if you're close to the action, or the sound you're recording is loud enough to give you a good dynamic range. I assume the SX-280 uses AGC (Automatic Gain Control) for sound recording, so if you're recording something that's very low in volume, the AGC will turn the SX-280's internal microphone amps all the way up to boost the sound, but that also boosts the microphone/amp internal electronic noise. So you'll want to get closer to the sound (if possible) if it's not loud, and also be aware that the mics are omni-directional and pick up sound from all over. So if you need to focus the sound better, you may want to shield the camera on whatever sides the sound you're trying to record isn't coming from.Physically, the SX-280 is very nicely made, with a metal case that looks durable and doesn't have any sharp edges. I bought the red version, and the red case with the black trim on 3 sides plus the black wrist strap looks stunning. My SX-280 says "Made in Japan" on the bottom of the case, which is a big plus in my book. It's certainly possible to get a high quality camera made by a Japanese company that's outsourced to a distant location for manufacture, but it didn't pan out with my previous pocket camera, which broke with just a slight bump. The SX-280 doesn't come with a carry case, but it does come with an external battery charger, so you don't have to have the camera plugged into anything to charge the battery. That's especially important when you have a second battery, so you can put the exhausted battery into the charger and a fresh battery into the camera and continue shooting.Pocket cameras with long zoom lenses like the SX-280 require very tiny sensors (typically the "1/2.3" size) to be able to focus light at all focal lengths onto the sensor in such a small camera body. If the sensor size were increased, the camera would have to be larger and heavier accordingly. Fortunately, the SX-280 uses what Canon calls the "Digic 6 engine" (internal computer code) to get the best possible quality from the small sensor, and based on the image quality I was getting with my 3 previous pocket cameras, the SX-280 is way better. I don't see any significant pixel smear, which was always a problem with my previous cameras. Noise in images is tricky - I have ISO 1600 images with very low noise, and ISO 400 images with significant noise, and the apparent noise in the final image seems to be more a function of the lighting than the ISO setting itself.Camera "On" time is about one second, and it takes about 2.5 seconds to zoom from minimum to maximum or vice-versa. The mechanism is very smooth, so I don't anticipate any trouble with it. I would suggest being very careful not to bump the lens barrel against anything when extended, and even though I've done that with some cameras without harm, it's the most sensitive part of the camera because of the mechanics needed to extend and retract the lens as much as it does. The SX-280 has a dedicated "Movie" button on the back, which to me is a very important feature. I've missed getting a video started in time with older cameras where the mode dial had to be rotated to the movie position in order to start a video. The SX-280's screen measures 3-3/16 inches diagonally, but the actual image area measures only 2-15/16 inches.The SX-280 has a built-in flash, but that flash is strictly for users who want snapshots for social forums or scrapbooks - even something as simple as a quick copy of a whiteboard needs a bounce-flash to mitigate hot spots and the like. The tripod socket is metal (some pocket cameras have plastic sockets) and it's close to the camera's center of gravity (near the lens), but when mounted on a tripod the battery and memory card door cannot be opened.Camera forums are rife with complaints about the price of replacement batteries, and I always recommend carrying at least a second battery so shooting can continue if the first battery runs down. Contrary to what many people suggest - saving money with third-party batteries, I consider the price difference and if it's huge, I need to know why. Before I could even consider a very cheap battery, I would need several independent reviews that affirm the quality of that particular battery as well as the reliability of the manufacturer of that battery. On top of that, I would need to know that if their battery damaged my camera, they would pay to replace my camera promptly. Lithium-ion batteries can be very dangerous. If the price difference were less than my expenses in replacing a defective battery (packaging, shipping, time wasted, loss of battery for a period of time), I would certainly get the camera manufacturer's battery.

Reviews.Title: Returning this one!
Reviews.Author: GFS Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Terrible camera. Poor auto focus results in soft focus shots at best. Battery dies after short use. Firmware update-  they should recall the product. not have the customer go through contortions to update it.  Shameful.

Reviews.Title: maybe if you're looking for a replacement to that instamatic 126
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this camera to use on a trip where I didn't want to carry a large camera (Canon 5D), and have used a Powershot S90 for times when I didn't want to carry a full body camera. For this trip we wanted a second pocket camera and I expected we could use this one with similiar results - but I was mistaken.On the plus side, it was compact as expected and the screen is easy to see in daylight.And the 20x zoom really gets you close, but hthe camera is so small and light, that hand giggle makes it difficult to hold the subject steady in the frame.But the detracters for me were:1) at first I didn'tice the images were set to include the date/time.  So all of the pictures from the first two days have the timestamp on the image - and it can't be removed without using photo editing software to brush it out - and it's well into the image, so cropping isn't really an option.2) only shoots in jpg format - no raw option available.3) burns through batteries.  If you use this camera, be sure and bring an extra battery.4) when shooting video with it, after about 10 seconds, it would stop recording with the message "low battery", even when the battery was fully charged.Only the Basic Manual is provided in print.  To access the full user manual, you need a pc.  So I couldn't reference it while out on the trip,I wouldn't buy this camera again.  I'll give it to our 6th grader for a fun camera.If all you take are snapshots, and need to replace your  instamatic 126, then this is probably an OK choice.  But if you're looking for

Reviews.Title: Top Rated Camera in Dec CR
Reviews.Author: Harlan Aliment
Reviews.Content: If you subscribe to Consumer's Reports, check out the December magazine to see how this camera was top rated in the superzoom category. Camera has some very good features and abilities. For best selection always download/read the manual and check out professional camera review sites. Majority of reviews posted here, while helpful, are done by well meaning photo amateurs. Read what the professionals say.

Reviews.Title: A Big Pproblem
Reviews.Author: Benny Gilad
Reviews.Content: When you shoot Video and use the Zoom ther camera just turn itself off !!!This is probably a known problem and I wonder why you keep selling this Model while the problem is not Fixed/

Reviews.Title: Amazon service is tops
Reviews.Author: Lotus Blossom "Janice"
Reviews.Content: I have owned numerous Canon cameras. My last one was a 220 SX. I liked the pictures and videos I took. However, it started acting flaky on indoor shots when the flash should have popped up. I figured this was a good excuse to get the latest model. I ordered and received the SX280. I was not happy with the pictures. When I fully zoomed out, the picture was very grainy. Also, pictures taken from about 20 feet away from the subject were not sharp. Finally, I got my act together and called Amazon to complain. They sent me a return UPS label, and said they would send a new replacement, and that I should send them the camera I was not happy with back. This was last Saturday. Today, which is Monday, I received it from UPS! I cannot believe the fast and efficient service. I tested the new camera with 20X zoom and other shots. They are all fine. It was a defective camera. I am a very happy customer. I was worried that I wouldn't get the replacement camera in time for the holidays. Thank you Amazon. I will certainly tell all my friends about your service.

Reviews.Title: Still being sold with video causing battery indicator / shutdown issue
Reviews.Author: cruiser732
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera knowing some of the camera's had the video causing the indicator to flash and camera to shut down. Thought the problem would have been worked out but it hasn't, not even with the firmware update. I sent it to Canon Technical Support and it came back "no trouble found". I tested some more and found a SLIGHTLY uncharged battery caused the shutdown. So I charged the battery and it lasted 15 minutes with a good amount of zooming before it shut down. Tried again immediately after and it was down to 7 minutes. Each time turning it back on in normal picture mode the battery indicator showed a full battery. But video time was substantially decreased. Even used different batteries with the same exact result.I've worked with electronics and computers all my life and this just smells of something that they knew about but shipped anyway. I sent it back and spent extra $ and got a Panasonic DMC-ZS30. MUCH better and no known problems.I normally don't rant but this was a waste of my time. Canon actually wanted me to send it back a second time but I just sent it back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Not As Good As Two Models Back
Reviews.Author: Mason Bane
Reviews.Content: I have the SX230 HS, two iterations back from this one. I was so excited to get it because I am going on a trip and I wanted even better pics than my SX230 takes. There is a problem with that. The pics on my old camera are better! Much better! I particularly enjoy taking pics on old churches and museums in low light. There is a candle symbol on the SX230 menu that takes awesome low light photos. That function is now GONE on the 280. Gone also is the color effects where you could choose only one color to show up in the photo and the rest be black and white. Also on the manual modes, the F stop only goes down to 3.5 and it used to go to 3.1 also for low light photos. And the 280 is BIGGER. All in all, a huge disappointment and downgrade from my old 230.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for travel
Reviews.Author: Product User
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon guy with two other--DSLR and compact housed in waterproof case for river rafting. My other camera's are dated with limited SD capacity and DSLR that is too big to carry on hikes.. Looked at a lot of compacts with long lens and manual controls. Picked this one because it was Canon and more important made of metal unlike some of many other very plastic camera. The size was nice also with reasonable access to manual controls unlike some of the others that felt just too small.After a month of shooting I'm happy with the results. The long lens is great, shoot some objects over a mile away on hike and came out very good. Images are mostly very good (at least on my Mac 21" screen). Controls are good and access to those is pretty fast.  Due to the size some of the control settings are tricky like the mode deal which somehow i seem to engage unwanted setting while making adjustments--got to work on finger skills I guess. Oh yeah, the battery issue--I purchased two extra battery (cheap) and after getting red light warning one day checked Canon site and found firmware update. Haven't had any battery issue since that update. All and all is good camera that fits my hands very well and feels quality like an Iphone 4..  Oh, does seem to focus slowly and I have got a couple of fuzzy pictures where it failed to focus quickly..

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Lediath
Reviews.Content: no complaints on this cameratakes very sharp photosautoadjust for all kinds of light conditionsvideos are also nice and crisp

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Bradford K. Bridge
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to learn how to use the camera, but so far the pictures I have taken look great.Brad Bridge

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Tria
Reviews.Content: I just bought this for my wife after a fellow camera club member told me she carried it around because it could always be with her, while I know her regular equipment filled a back pack and more. It is really great. The electronics provide a wide range of automatic point and shoot settings for my wife who can't be bothered, but would seem to give some real control if you want it. Playing around with it, I may buy one for myself just to keep in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Greg Shumate
Reviews.Content: Well it wont wash my car or paint my house but other than that....Great travel camera that fits in my pocket.Zoom is plenty

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Rafid Albahadili
Reviews.Content: This is my first canon camera, I have 2 cameras, nikon d90 and sony hx300, I'm not going to compair these but to least features of this canon one.Handy design, light weight, perfect size.Excellent zoom function when used with a tripod.Great manual control over the shooting setting with excellent result.Amazing wifi function permit awesome photo sharing with mobile devices.Good and powerful flash but bad position and when operated interfer with camera handling during shooting.Worst battery life ever seen in a mobile device especially for a great camera like this

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: barbara ariens "scrapmimi"
Reviews.Content: partly because my sweet husband surprised me for my birthday, but it is just the cutest camera. Very simple to use, easy directions,and I don't think I'll max out the capacity . the camera is so light and fits easily - any pouch that my purses have for my cell phone will hold the camera. it's very thin. Mine is red and I love it

Reviews.Title: Small, Excellent Zoom, Flexible Shooting Modes
Reviews.Author: S. M. Aubel
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very compact20x Zoom & Optical Image StabilizationFast Continuous Shot (14/sec)High Speed Video (240/fps @ 320x240)Full HD (1080P @ 60P) VideoHigh ISO range (80-6400)WiFi & GPSCons:No Optical ViewfinderHard to see in bright sunView freezes with shotNo Vari-Angle viewfinderNo filter attachmentThis camera was the replacement for a Canon Powershot A620 whose days were numbered when our phones matched its' megapixels. We wanted more zoom, more resolution, full HD video, small enough to always take along and preferred Canon for control familiarity. We still feel this camera was the best compromise.Overall we like this camera very much, but miss some of the features from our prior unit. The lack of filter capability *(specifically a polarizer) and an optical and/or Vari-Angle viewfinder impacts the scenic and bright sunlight shooting ability.Sports photography is compromised by this viewfinder lack and the camera freezing the action when the shot is taken, making tracking of your subject very difficult. The best work-around I've found is to use the high-speed continuous mode (@ 14/fps) which gives a more continuous viewfinder image. Just be prepared to toss a lot of shots to get to the good ones.While this camera doesn't win in the megapixels race (@12), it more than makes up for that in lens (20x + IS), high speed (6400 ISO, 1/3200 sec shutter, 14/fps), image quality (Digic 6, 1080P @ 60P, etc) and compact size. This camera goes when Canon T4i & lenses get too big, heavy and/or complicated.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for beginner and intermediate photographers
Reviews.Author: Nathan Kidd
Reviews.Content: I got this Camera for my birthday and I love it. The zoom is amazing for this size of a camera, I had a Nikon coolpix S6300 and I would recommend this camera over that one. I love the way it brings out the color in pictures of flowers and portrait pictures. I would recommend this camera for beginner and intermediate photographers.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Milo
Reviews.Content: Good portable camera, excellent zoom quality ... the main reason for purchase was the zoom, didn't want to carry extra lenses or camera bags, does the jobs. So so action pictures, sometimes the come out good tho. Never had a problem with Canon and still don't have a problem. Gave it 4 stars bcse thought the action pictures will come better, they're so so even using the fast motion feature.

Reviews.Title: Love everything but the flash location
Reviews.Author: Patricia A Stefanowicz
Reviews.Content: I have small hands and it doesn't bother me but my hubby hates the flash location, He can't work the camera without his finger getting in the way.  Bought the camera for a trip and it worked great, especially the video.  Great small P&S; camera.  I did have 3 batteries fully charged with me at all times.  This camera was the newer camera and didn't need the update but it still showed the battery low notice while filming.  If I had just put in a new battery I ignored it and it was fine. If I had a battery I had been using for a while then I swapped batteries before filming.  Often I didn't need to use more than 1 1/2 batteries per day taking lots of nighttime shots and video.  It is not the perfect camera but for a small pocket camera that takes great pics it is just right.  Only thing I missed was panaromic ability.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera if the Batteries Worked
Reviews.Author: jkhoekst
Reviews.Content: I like the camera and the quality of pictures, but if I try to use the video function which is what my husband bought it for me for the battery dies immediately.  I cannot get it to correct.  I shouldn't have to get it to correct by logging into their website or any other way.  I should work when I take it out of the package.  Now the batteries are hardly lasting either way.  Too bad.  I would like it if I could use it without worry.

Reviews.Title: Accumulator
Reviews.Author: User 123123
Reviews.Content: The problems with the accumulator aren't fixed till today.You can't make videos above 4:00 minutes with this camera. And canon don't fix this well known problem.

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pictures, but the design is horrible
Reviews.Author: Lauri Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera has great technical features!  It takes fantastic features, videos is great.  Especially at this price.  But the flash pops out of the far left top side and I always have my finger there.  I usually have to restart the camera because the flash gets stuck half open due to my finger being in the way.  So frustrating.  I would have bought a Canon Elph.

Reviews.Title: almost perfect
Reviews.Author: John Falconer
Reviews.Content: camera is exactly as described: small, light, well-built, pocket-able with long zoom lens. Great clarity in low light too. It's only drawback is it's speed from shot to shot, even with the fastest (10) SD card...it's slow. there's a delay of a couple of seconds between shots, very noticeable if you're coming off a DSL. so beware of that because it's the only 'fault' I can find with the camera outside of weak battery strength: get some extra batteries if you travel with it. One won't make it if you have GPS on, much less some of the other bells and whistles. Overall a wonderful camera and carry-able all day every day w/o hesitation.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: kelekai "jerry"
Reviews.Content: but the wi fi only works when it is in the mood the older model works well which i have owned. the zoom is amazing and the quality is great but do not buy it for it's wi fi!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Find
Reviews.Author: Morne Stephanus
Reviews.Content: We bought it for a trip to South Africa we wanted something small but good. We found this point and shoot to be the best. great camera, big viewing screen. You may want to get an extra set of batteries,the battery does not last very long.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture quality
Reviews.Author: B N Patel
Reviews.Content: like the camera... very good picture quality. Got it for my son as his first camera. best one for this price range...

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, was able to use right out of box
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Herppich "BobH"
Reviews.Content: Worked well right out of the box.  Pretty easy to use.  Haven't tackled the WI FI downloading of pics yet (a little more to this).

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Barber
Reviews.Content: Everything great except for the Flash.  The Button pops up exactly where it is most comfortable to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice!
Reviews.Author: JJS
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for more than a simple pocket camera but less than an SLR, this is it. Simplicity and unbelievable quality. Yet, has many features (manual mode) to allow you to engage with the camera in a serious way if you wish. Having the only red camera in the crowd has helped when taking group shots - "Look at the Red Camera"....Nicely done Canon!

Reviews.Title: perfect upgrade
Reviews.Author: Casey Landman
Reviews.Content: I had the previous version of this Canon camera without the wifi, but I messed up the lens, so I replaced it with this new version.  Takes great photos, love the long zoom - works great even in lower light situations.  A great little camera I have taken to concerts and gotten really great photos with.  Love the wifi - I can upload photos directly to my iPhone and iPad without any wires or adaptors, same to the the computer.  I love being able to share a better quality photo than my built in phone camera takes on social media quickly.Yes this is a bit larger than the Elph series, which I used to buy all the time because they were so small, but I will trade the smallness for this longer lens and better stability any day!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am going to use my camera to take family pictures and product photos for my home business.  I am thrilled with the quality and ease of use.  I am not a professional so I can't speak the tech but I need my photos to be in focus and bright and this camera delivers both.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Kinal
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures.  The only problem I have encountered is the IS. This feature does not live up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Very good Camera
Reviews.Author: M.A.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera from Amazon right before the holidays after an older canon camera was destroyed by my toddler.  It's a really great camera, easy to use & the picture quality is very very good.  I'm not using it for anything special, just family/social type pictures.  I haven't used the video feature so I don't know if the battery thing everyone talks about is true but from my experience, the battery works just fine.  The built-in WiFi hasn't gotten to really work for us but its not something we really cared much about.  The best feature that we really wanted with small kids is the rapid fire shooting mode.  You just hold the picture button down and it'll take 8-10 pictures in a row and really captures what you're trying to get.  Very cool feature if you have young children where you only have a split second to get a good shot.  Overall, I think it's a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Better than I thought
Reviews.Author: Vlad_t
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent camera. Very smart, quick and the pictures are of very good quality. It is easy to operate. I had many cameras from Canon. Clearly this one is the best though more expensive but it worth it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy customer
Reviews.Author: Claus
Reviews.Content: Compared to my Nikon which I enjoy, this is a great camera, love the video, which is crisp. As previously reported, a glitch with this camera is the battery indicator. While taking video at a wedding the battery indicator showed low, but in reality, the battery was full. So far, no other complaints with this camera, I am enjoying it, and took awesome photos of Christmas lights at night. They turned out great!

Reviews.Title: Canon PSSX 280 HS
Reviews.Author: Linkside
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Documentation not great. Wi-Fi is a pain in the but despite the assistance of great Tech Support. Great pictures and movies but importing movies is a problem. I have not tried the GPS thus, no comment.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great
Reviews.Author: John Purdum
Reviews.Content: Amazon's service was exceptional as usual and the camera is great as well.  If you want a small camera that takes great pictures this is the one.  This is our second Canon...  We also have a larger canon (Can't remember the model) which proved to be a great camera so we bought this to film our 10 month old.  You'll be happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera after reading many reviews. The size and picture quality are just what we needed. The 20x zoom is great

Reviews.Title: OK camera, Awful battery life
Reviews.Author: Mauro marquez
Reviews.Content: The battery life is awful even with the software update, for example it can't stand an entire day of tourism. I had read great reviews about the picture quality but I was not positively surprised, I expected better... Pictures indoors with lights were pretty bad in the auto mode. The HD recording is great as the slow motion recording, I also like the camera design.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Hondo
Reviews.Content: Good picture, good quality, easy to use.  Small battery for a camera this beefy.  If you get this camera, get an extra battery and carry it with you.

Reviews.Title: Try it you'll like it, if not love it.
Reviews.Author: Tampaman

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3K6CERIB8QM9PcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3K6CERIB8QM9PcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:46 MinsMy other Camera is a Canon 60D (pretty high end).BUT I LOVE THIS CAMERA! I Took it to Europe and got AWESOME pictures & Video. I dare say that the JPEG pictures were nearly as good as my Canon 60D. But without all the extra weight, hassle and "STEAL ME" appeal of the Cannon 60D.And to prevent the theft of this camera. I attached a necklace lanyard made out of 550 Paracord. I always wore the camera around my neck or looped around my belt. Needless to say it survived a very hectic non-stop month in Europe. And trust me the pickpockets did try!I'll leave the technical details to the others who have already done a marvelous job of drilling down through the nuances of the technical matter.This camera works works for me. It works really well. It takes fantastic pictures. And I use it on a regular basis for routine picture taking. But be warned that video drains the battery. So be prepared to take short videos or carry an extra battery or two (they're cheap so why not).Try it you'll like, it if not love it.___________________________Update: Just got back from Peru. Checkout the Video. Image is stable. Clear and bright with very good color. Very impressive for a little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!  Fabulous zoom!
Reviews.Author: lagniap
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a European trip.  I was not disappointed, the zoom was better than I hoped for, the pictures beautiful.  The reviews warn about short battery life, so, I carried an extra charged battery.  The only time I needed to use the extra battery was after recording video for an extended time.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SC280 HS
Reviews.Author: Heidi D
Reviews.Content: Received the product on time.  I bought it because 1. I needed a new camera, 2. We had a Florida trip planned.  This camera takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Very good all around compact travel zoom, but...
Reviews.Author: David W Gunder
Reviews.Content: I had an SX230 and loved it. It was perfect for trips where I wanted photos, but did not worry too much about trying to get the best shots. It was a great snapshot camera as is the SX280. I dropped the SX230 and was glad for the chance to "upgrade" to the newest model.One very nice improvement on my model is that the flash does not automatically deploy. Even in auto flash mode, the flash does not pop up until needed. This is great and makes handling at start up easier.The movie issue is still not resolved and it is disappointing Canon has not faced the problem head on. If the battery is not fully charged, then, when I push the red record button, the camera shuts off. When I received the camera in early September, I installed the firmware, but it does not correct the issue. A full battery will allow movie clips, but this should still be fixed.Also, once in a while, the camera shut down for no reason in the middle of shooting.Was not able to get WiFi to work, but do like GPS. Would like raw.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and great support
Reviews.Author: Craig Parker
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and Canon stood by and replaced one that I dropped from a high height and broke.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX280HS is about a 3.5 star point n shoot
Reviews.Author: P. Garcia "asuchemist"
Reviews.Content: I use this at work to take pictures of evidence.Pros:-Compact-A lot of different modes-1080P video with zoom (very nice video displayed on my 50" TV)-20X optical zoom-Digic 6-Wifi-GPS tagging-Bright LCD screen in direct sunlight-Optical stabilizer pretty goodCons:-No optical view finder-You cannot really use the 20X optical zoom without a tripod-Sometimes the battery flashes it is empty when it really isn't-The way I hold the camera (like anybody else would) sometimes blocks the pop up flash-In auto mode, indoor quality not the best-Pictures are somewhat soft-Color and skin tone a little off indoors-Battery like as specified (not good in my opinion, make sure you have spare)Overall, this is a nice step up from the 300HS we used to have.  I wish canon would implement the same naming convention as cell phone cameras:  YYYYDDMM_HHMMSS.  Very easy to organize files with that naming convention.  Have not used the wifi function yet.  Bluetooth might be better option being my laptop can easily sync with bluetooth.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: C. Carmo "CARMO"
Reviews.Content: Camera is great, easy to use.  My pictures in Alaska came out great. The telephoto was just enough.  This camera is perfect if you want a point and shoot, and easy to carry around not too big.

Reviews.Title: Performed better expected!
Reviews.Author: Frederik De Kroes
Reviews.Content: This little camera has performed more things that my EOS Rebel camera can't even dream of doing.  I am very happy with the picture quality and it fits comfortably in any of my pockets.  So it's always available to capture the moment.

Reviews.Title: Great Canon camera!
Reviews.Author: William B. Rose
