Reviews.Content: Great small pocket camera. Does all that I wanted. This is the second one I bought, one for my wife and now I have one. Don't have to borrow hers. Only inconvience is the location of the flash. Need to learn how to hold it so I do not interrupt the action of the pop up flash. I researched Nikon, Sony Fugi and Panasonic. This one came out on top for price and quality.Bill

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the nicest little point and shoot cameras out there. I bought an earlier model 2 years ago and loved it. This year I needed two for my yearbook staff at the school where I teach and I didn't hesitate but went straight for the Canon Sx series cameras. They give all sorts of special features in a camera with a very gentle learning curve in terms of usage! They are also quite durable and are easy to take anywhere you go in a pocket or a purse.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Took great pictures for the price point. But the highlight was video quality. Used it on a 6 country European tour this Summer (2013). The camera did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Good high end camera in a point and shoot model
Reviews.Author: Srinivasa SA
Reviews.Content: This is my third canon camera. After reading a lot of reviews I seem to go for Canon's for their picture quality and price point. This is an excellent camera, with quick focusing and quick photo taking. It has the latest (as of Aug 2013) DIGIC 6 processor and good at low light conditions.CONS: Need to carry a secondary battery, as the taking video drains the battery fast!Overall, excellent camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: J. Clarke
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and love it. If you are looking for a good point and shoot camera with lots of options, this is the one for you. Although the manufacturer has eliminated the stich option, it has given you the "continuous" photo option which makes it easy to stich pictures. It also comes with it's own stich program on a CD that you can install. Over all it's a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: kathylu
Reviews.Content: I used this Camera in Alaska and it was great.  It takes really good far away pictures.  Quality resolution is very good.  Only negative is that the battery only lasts about a day's worth of picture taking.  My solution was to buy two batteries.  One is always in my pocket so I don't run out during an exciting photo opportunity.  It's a great size to fit in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great product. Very satisfied, thus far. Cannot find a single negative thing to say about the product and the service.
Reviews.Author: Stan Ebanks
Reviews.Content: The product arrived precisely as expected. It has out-performed any of my 7 previous (similar) camera purchases in the past several years. GREAT PRODUCT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera and pictures
Reviews.Author: Lizzy Lizard "Liz"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and the pictures are great.  Being able to locate where pictures were taken within about 10 feet if he GPS featuer is turned on is pretty neat.

Reviews.Title: Best compact digital camera I have owned.
Reviews.Author: Guy Boyd
Reviews.Content: The camera I have used for years is the Canon 5D.  I needed something smaller when carrying around a bulky camera and lens was not convenient.  The SX280 has been great.  It takes great quality photos.  The autofocus is very fast and good.  Video is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, weird battery issue when recording video
Reviews.Author: Six_Fore
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Feels solid in my hand, zoom is incredible and the pictures are amazing.  The one thing I've found is when I start taking video, after 30 seconds or so, the battery indicator starts flashing low battery.  It'll flash like that forever, I've never had it die on me, so my guess is the camera has a bug where it thinks the battery is dying, but really isn't.  I turn it off and back on and it's fine, I can shoot pictures and video just fine.  It's a slight annoyance to shut if off and back on, but doesn't affect the performance, again it's never died on me, and I've shot 20 and 30 minute video with it flashing low battery in this 'buggy' state.Other than than, camera is amazing!  I'm betting Canon will release a firmware update that will fix this.

Reviews.Title: Low Battery during video
Reviews.Author: M. Gundy
Reviews.Content: Firmware updated to PSSX280HS.FI2 (1.0.2.0)After a few minutes of operation in video mode the camera shows battery is running out.  Camera is turned off and on and as soon a I start taking a video the low battery shows again.  I have purchased (2) of these cameras and I am frustrated with this issue. My understanding was that the firmware update would take care of this issue.  Problem still exists after firmware update.  Canon has been contated and I am waiting for a repsonse.

Reviews.Title: Very good, with one big drawback.
Reviews.Author: P. A. Hendricks
Reviews.Content: Very nice, except no Bluetooth for Mac, which is hard to fathom. Good optics, and easy to use menus. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wife is happy
Reviews.Author: Jay Jevne
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace the camera my wife had lost and was found, but broken. She loves it so I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Timothy Balsley
Reviews.Content: this product is above my expectations takes good photos and has all the bells and whistles required, would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: My personal camera
Reviews.Author: carol jones
Reviews.Content: Love the look of this camera and the size of the rear screen.  I also enjoy being able to put strap over wrist. Haven't had the camera for long and I'm far from an experienced photographer but the technical support at Canon is great. Used the camera at my grandson's superstars lacrosse tournament on the sport mode and got great pics. This camera probably  has more features than I need but the price was right!

Reviews.Title: Blurry photos and bad service
Reviews.Author: D. Brundage "Data Dude"
Reviews.Content: I've owned about 6 Powershots in the past.  This one was out of focus for about half the photos and videos from day one.  I pre-ordered it from Amazon because I wanted to have it for my vacation in Cancun.  But I had to throw away about halve the photos and videos because they were too blurry.I sent the camera in and they just sent me an E-mail that they were going to exchange my "new" hardly used camera with a used one.  I called them to complain, but they told me that that's they way they do things.  Also, the used camera has the same serial number sequence that has problems.  But I'm not supposed to worry because this camera has will have a 3 month warranty.What a rip off.  To top it off, the camera is $100 cheaper now, just a few months later.

Reviews.Title: the battery problem is real
Reviews.Author: Stephen C. Hampton
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera, loved it, read the reviews about the battery life, tested it, returned it.With a new freshly charged battery, I took a few pics and was about 90 seconds into my first video (medium quality setting) when the "low battery" signal started flashing.  WTF?!  I went with it and confirmed (twice) that you can actually video for about 20 minutes (with some stops and starts, but 20 min of footage) with the warning light going off the whole time.  Then after about 20 min of vid, it dies.  Without much real warning, of course, because the warning's been going on for 19 minutes.  Then if you switch back to pic mode, it says the battery is full!  WTF?!  I had this experience two separate days.  Given I anticipate traveling with long days of use and limited ability to charge, this is a deal-breaker.Another annoying thing is the auto-adjust of the audio level during video produced some bad results.  I was videoing a rock band.  When I zoomed in, the mic seemed to zoom in and gave me great sound.  When I panned out, the mic did too, dropping the volume in half (cutting the bass entirely) and giving me the noise of all the people around me.  Not sure if there's a way to shut off this "feature".I returned it and am going with the Sony WX300, which is known for long battery life (the manual says I can do 80 min of vid).

Reviews.Title: ** Beware **
Reviews.Author: Birk  Billingsley
Reviews.Content: I read through all of the negative reviews, but decided to give this camera a shot (haha).  Bad move.  This is the first review I have ever done on any product, on any website.  I wish that it were filled with unicorns and rainbows.  Alas.Before I leave my brief, pithy comments about the product itself, let me say that I have a degree in astronautical engineering and the owner's manual was more difficult to understand/use than coordinating a Martian landing in a foreign tongue.  Horrible.Spoiler Alert:  The issues with the zoom and video have NOT been resolved.  In fact, I had shutdowns just using the zoom in "still" mode.There's a reason it's on sale, folks.  Run.

Reviews.Title: Camera software not up to date.
Reviews.Author: okos-2
Reviews.Content: The camera AMAZON sold me had faulty low battery light issues.  When I researched it, it appears that this has been an issue with SX280 model for months.  Contacted Canon and they said that SOME retailers chose not to return the cameras for a software update I guess AMAZON was one.  Canon advised me that the update is relatively simple through their web site.  After I made an attempt to update I got stuck after the 4th or fifth step and had to call Canon for assistance.  Canon walked me thru the update, but it was anything but simple.So far I had not used the camera that much, but when I did I liked the results.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pix!
Reviews.Author: Rudy Garcia "RudyG"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures! Very easy to use. My previous 2 cameras were Panasonics and this Canon PowerShot blows them away.

Reviews.Title: Bad - and last - Canon
Reviews.Author: Toussaint
Reviews.Content: Great pictures - uh... sorry: great picture... and then the battery is dead. Thanks for your silence, Canon. Never more again. Just got a great Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Canon SCAM - Beware
Reviews.Author: BJK
Reviews.Content: Update March 11:I mailed my camera to have the firmware updated by Canon. This is as per the technical support. Upon receiving my camera, Canon offered to send to me a refurbished model with all the updates. You can imagine my reaction - as any one else's would be.  What!!! Clearly it is a Scam.  I demanded my original brand new one.  I am waiting for Canon to sort out things.BEWARE and don't take the route I did.February 23:It is not my first camera but this one is a winner. I love this camera for all the pros that other reviewers noted. I am a mom of 2 under 10 kids and having a camera for me to capture the precious moments in our lives is a MUST. Rating of 4 stars (and not 5) is for the problem that camera is known to cause and the time you need to spend to correct it.My first camera had a problem with battery indicator. As per Cannon technical support, only some cameras have the battery indicator/shutting down problem. Those that are affected are with the serial number listed on the bottom of the camera where the 6th digit from the left is 1 or 2. Well, I requested an exchange from the seller and a brand new camera was sent to me.  I was hoping I would receive a "problem free" replacement. However, the second camera has exactly the same problem and the digit is 3.I called Cannon directly since I did not want to deal with self repair - 1800 652 2666. Cannon is willing to repair its xs280 models for free. Don't forget to ask for a free shipping label which can be emailed to you. Cannon claims that turnaround time for a repair is 4-5 business days with paid 2 day fedex return.I placed my repair order with Cannon today and am waiting for email with a shipping label to be send.I am really set on keeping this camera so I will go trough the trouble. I bought the camera to capture my kids' precious moments. The camera works great in the low light settings during kids indoor school performances. My daughter is a swimmer and a gymnast - with the camera and this amazing zoom, for the first time in 8 years I am able to get close up shots of her in action during performances and swim races.

Reviews.Title: Definitely not the greatest point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Keepin it real!
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for a 1-week vacation and it is excellent in low light and daytime photos. I used the P setting 98% of the time. Has a nice zoom range.The battery is not that great once you use it for video recording. The low battery indicator comes on.It's very annoying if the camera is set on "flash" and the flash pops up but your finger is on top of it. The "restart camera" message comes on.Be careful to NEVER drop the camera! Ever since I dropped it (it had a small amount of cushion), the lens do not open/close properly.

Reviews.Title: Battery drain
Reviews.Author: William Kastern
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an earlier PowerShot model that gave excellent service, but finally died. This camera has excellent features and takes great still photos. I experienced the same problems with the battery when making videos that numerous others have complained about. However, I also experience battery drain when the camera is not in use. I suspect that the On/Off switch is the culprit since it is level with the camera body and easily bumped when the camera is off. This turns it on and the battery drains. I have to remove the battery whenever the camera is not in use just to insure that I'll have a fully charged battery when I need to turn the camera on. This adds to the annoyances that others have described.

Reviews.Title: Still needs a firmware fix for movie mode!
Reviews.Author: The tester "gt"
Reviews.Content: This camera is much better than the SX260 (sold to my sister/bought SX280), faster, more features, excellent still and low light photos, but perfection was snatch away by the movie mode battery issues and the poor battery life. Otherwise an excellent feature rich camera. I really love the WI-FI, instant transfer to my tablet(that works great). If you don't care about video too much, the stills photos are best in it's class, and I must say that although there are problems with video mode, the videos that are captured before the camera shuts down are really good, especially the 1080p 60fps, but until canon get their act together and fix the movie battery shut off issue, the excellent features of this camera will be pushed to the background. So Canon get on the ball and fix the problem with an updated firmware. Your last attempt v 1.2 failed miserably. So for now only 3 stars until the battery/movie problem is fixed. Email me when you get it done and I'll update this to 5 Stars :)!

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It
Reviews.Author: Korey
Reviews.Content: I've owned about 6 Powershots. This one was out of focus for about half the photos and videos from day one. I pre-ordered it because I wanted to have it for my vacation in Cancun. But I had to throw away about halve the photos and videos because they were too blurry.I sent the camera in and they just sent me an E-mail that they were going to exchange my "new" hardly used camera with a used one. I called them to complain, but they told me that that's they way they do things. Also, the used camera has the same serial number sequence that has problems. But I'm not supposed to worry because this camera has will have a 3 month warranty.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX280
Reviews.Author: Charles F. Tutt "Well Fed Gardener"
Reviews.Content: So far I love it! I haven't even begun to explore all of its features but the images I've produced so far are excellent. I bought the 128 GB SD and plan on taking hundreds of photos and videos with it when we cruise the Mediterranean and visit Spain and France this fall.

Reviews.Title: Another great product from Canon!
Reviews.Author: Arjeree C.
Reviews.Content: The pictures taken from Canon Powershot SX280 HS are stunningly crisp and clear! I just wish it had more pixel. Other than that, it's another great camera from Canon!

Reviews.Title: Should be RECALLED
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: The following review was rejected by the Canon Web Site for the Canon SX280 HS.The Canon SX280 HS Camera is sold new with a known firmware issue, requiring the customer to purchase and install an expensive 32GB SD card, which is not included. Anything new out of the box requiring a repair is a recall item. There are 4 pages of technical instructions to correct the firmware glitch in the camera which shuts the camera down when using the video feature. Canon is aware of this, yet they still have the camera on the market at full price. I bought it yesterday, looked it up last night, saw a list of serial numbers affected, mine was on the list. I looked up price of 32GB SD cards today. I will be returning my Canon SX280 HS to the store it was purchased from - a Big Box Store. Canon makes the best low light point and shoot cameras on the market, I own 3, but this one is going back. At the very least Canon should be mailing out, free of charge, a 32GB SD pre-loaded firmware update to anyone who purchased the Canon SX280 HS.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time...and money
Reviews.Author: The Wiz "The Wiz"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in the middle of July 2013 partially based on the reviews, even though there were a lot of low ratings.  The low ratings were, for the most part, about the short battery life and/or shutdown after using video for a few minutes.  Other reviews mentioned a firmware update to fix that problem, so we thought that eliminating the reviews based on that problem, it would have a very high rating.We received it on Friday and returned it on Saturday.  It would turn itself off randomly or the display went completely black, and it sometimes displayed the icon for a mode the dial wasn't set on.  We did not try the video because these problems were enough for us to return it.We opted to receive another SX280, thinking we'd just gotten a dud.  Wrong! The new one came on Wednesday, and took great pictures and performed well, except for the dead battery/shutdown problem.  Thinking the firmware update would fix that and I'd have a great camera, I downloaded and applied the update.  Wrong! Looks to me like this model is a dud.  If we weren't paying for the video feature, we'd keep the camera because it takes very good pictures (Canon, knock a hundred bucks off the price and we'll buy another). The second one is going back today (Thursday).

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Walter Moores
Reviews.Content: I am just a beginner with digital cameras and chose a Canon because I had used a Canon Rebel with Kodachrome for years and got wonderful pictures.  Maybe, it's because I am a novice with the new Canon PowerShot, but I have difficulty getting the battery and memory card out of the camera when I want to see my results.  I get some good pictures and some not so good.  It will take a little more experience with the camera before I can rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ray Nardella
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I want it to, it's a great camera, the 80X zoom is great for the long shots that I need.

Reviews.Title: Camera good but did not have memory card included
Reviews.Author: Steve Wendel
Reviews.Content: Read carefully, received everything except a memory card.  It was not included with the camera.  My mistake in assuming something that vital to the operation would be included even if it was only 12 gb... I am waiting another week to get the card.  Yes, camera is nice looking and has a nice feel but it was built for taking pictures.  No card no pictures.Buyer beware and order a card.

Reviews.Title: SX280=Class Action Lawsuit
Reviews.Author: Mr. GPS
Reviews.Content: The camera is likely going to result in a class action lawsuit against Canon.  The camera can take no more that a couple of minutes of video with a fresh battery before the low battery indicator comes on and the camera shuts off.  Even after the firmware update the camera is worthless.  It's like buying a car that needs to be filled up every 10 miles.  Do not buy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Pettit
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup and use. A gift for my wife who uses it for ebay pictures when we are not traveling.

Reviews.Title: Meets our high expectations for a small camera.
Reviews.Author: Peter A. Bonfanti "Hilltopman44"
Reviews.Content: We have returned to Canon cameras because you can actually understand their instruction manual. This model is a gem in every respect with the exception of battery life. This is easily resolved by buying a spare battery or two.If you photo expectation is to record life events, your travels and people(including movies of grandchildren) this is a great choice at a modest price.

Reviews.Title: SUPER Shot
Reviews.Author: Kim Bliss
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. I love the x20 zoom, but be careful of the stability when zoomed in. You might want to use a tripod. I bought it for my upcoming vacation and I'm very excited to use it. Pictures are very clear and the larger screen makes it easy to compose your photo. I haven't used all the features, like the WiFi transmissions, but so far I love it.

Reviews.Title: Personal Use!
Reviews.Author: Jann Farnsworth
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was quick and easy to operate.  I purchase this camera after reviewing Consumer Reports and glad I started there!  The camera does everything I want.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Bob N "Bob N"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my wife. It replaced an older version Canon camera of about the same size. She was able to use it right away and loves all of the updated features especially the 20X zoom. It takes great quality photos indoors and out with accurate color balance and very good exposure across the frame. Thinking about buying one for myself so I don't have to carry around my 50D with the lenses. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Wonder!
Reviews.Author: gr82fly
Reviews.Content: How they pack so much into such a small space is a miracle!  This little jewel does everything in a superb fashion.

Reviews.Title: Light and easy
Reviews.Author: V. Cook
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoy this new PowerShot with the 20x zoom. I slip it in my pocket on my walks and it is always on hand when that great shot comes up. I love to be able to zoom in on images that before I couldn't even see. Still working my way around all the features but so far I am happy with what I see.One thing I am not sure of it that sometimes it doesn't seem to focus on the area that I am trying to shoot. Still looking into why.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with the SX280's performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is my 4th Canon. It takes truly beautiful pictures with ease. The uploading to you phone is a snap! The short video setting is very fun for uploading to social media. Very Happy with it.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've ever owned. I've only owned 3 cameras in my life, all of which we're cheap considering I was young and broke. Only thing that bothers me is the flash that pops up which gets in the way of holding it properly.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX280 12MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Image Stabilized...
Reviews.Author: Larry Holmes
Reviews.Content: Superb...best easy to use camera I have ever had.  Easy to use...especially for quick transitions between photo mode and video mode by using shutter release button or record button without having to change anything.  Can easily focus both photo or video mode without any complicated maneuvering.  Honestly, such a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Su M
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and perfect for its size. This is my secondary camera since I do have one of those large DSLR. I wanted to have something which I can carry in my purse and can whip it out whenever I want. This serves the purpose. The other reason why I bought it is because I can transfer the pics directly from it without manually connecting the camera. And not to mention the color!

Reviews.Title: Excellent for stills, unsatisfactory for video
Reviews.Author: MGB Driver
Reviews.Content: This camera takes super still pictures.  The image stabilization is very good and combined with the long zoom gives the camera a really good reach.BUT, like other reviewers have found, do not buy it if you want to take a lot of videos.  Mine came with the latest firmware, yet after a short time when taking a video the battery low icon comes on and soon after that it shuts down.  One star off for that.I am a bit surprised how much I like the Wi-Fi for downloading pictures to my computer.  Easy to set up and works well.  More of a plus than I expected.The GPS is OK - it works - I just haven't found it much more than a gimmick at the moment.  Perhaps when I am taking pictures further from home...

Reviews.Title: Fine upgrade
Reviews.Author: D Miller
Reviews.Content: Amazon saved my vacation by being able to ship a new camera next day when my original camera was damaged. This camera takes very good pictures, like the SX260 I replaced it with. The redesigned on-off button on the top is easier to press, but also easier to accidentally press. Like others, I searched and searched for the panorama mode only to discover it wasn't implemented with the SX280. It was on the SX260.  I can still take manual pano series, but have to be more careful so the photos will match up when I get home.

Reviews.Title: I'm amazed at all it can do, but I needed service
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I was in New York and it stopped working. After some back and forth with technical support it was determined that they needed it to be repaired. They replaced it under warranty without question. It makes me feel good about Canon.I'm amazed at the stuff this camera can do. You can set it up to take a picture on its own when you join a group, when you blink or when you smile. I like the feel in my hand.

Reviews.Title: Another fine Canon
Reviews.Author: Emmy S.
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our trip to Kauai, fantastic little camera. For what it is, it does a great job, I point, it shoots, memory captured. A little power hungry compared to my other Canons, but super easy to use, right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: SX280HS complements a RX-100
Reviews.Author: J. Louie
Reviews.Content: I own a Sony RX-100 and wanted a superzoom for shooting long range in good lighting conditions.  I bought a display model of the SX280HS from Target at a clearance price of $108+tax.It has an older serial numberof 0 for the 6th # so I promptly updated the firmware which was easy from the Canon website.  Unfortunately, the battery status glitch during video recording was NOT fixed by the software update 1.0.0.2.  The problem must be a software glitch that is not reprogrammable or a hardware design error.  Fully charge batteries seem to delay the battery low warning for a few minutes during video recording.Since over 95% of my camera use are for stills, not videos, the indicator problem is only a minor inconvenience.  Video recording still works fine for my short clips.The camera performs well for a 1/2.3 sensor, maxing out at ISO 1600 for a decent image.  As with most small sensor high f stop cameras, the higher ISOs of 3200 and 6400 are very noisy, and even at ISO 1600 the pictures are marginal at times.  But that's why I've got the RX-100 to handle low light situations with a point and shoot size camera.The optional shutter priority setting is great when you having moving objects in your shot or are zoomed in.  GPS works fine and locks-in even inside the house but probably drains your battery.  The ergonomics is average. It is harder to hold than my RX-100. Button controls are much better than the flat RX-100 buttons though.  The software user interface is intuitive.Overall, the camera was a bargain at $108 but for it's going price now of $188, it's still a fair price if you don't shoot videos too often.  If you wait until Canon fixes the problem with a new model, the price will probably go back up to the original $279 and take another year to come back down to the $200 area.  I still give it 4 stars because it is better than average when compared with other small sensor superzooms out there in the $200 price range.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: I like this better than my iPhone camera, and better than my prior canon SD1100. The zoom is great. I picked up a Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case that goes on my belt. I do look like a tourist but it is very convenient. Nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! w/ Wi-Fi!
Reviews.Author: bikerX
Reviews.Content: This was the best rated pocket cam on Cnet. i wanted it for thw Wifi...so I could instantly post to Facebook. But...it turns out that thias cam has 20x OPTICAL ZOOM....really great quality lens. People are amazed at my photos....it IS about light though...Can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Roman Krugovykh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. I bought it for my boyfriend's birthday  and he is over the moon. He was really surprised by the flexibility of control offered by this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Hilary
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera for the price. I take it hiking or keep it in my purse to snap photos of the every day moments (better photo quality than a phone by far).

Reviews.Title: Canon SX280 Camera
Reviews.Author: Doris E. Williams
Reviews.Content: The Seller was very good...I didn't have to contact the Seller, but the overall experiencewas just grand.  Would do that again.  The Camera was purchased as a gift and therecipient of the Canon SX280 just can't get over how great it is....Color is out of this world!Just can't say enough about the overall Camera.  Has ease of operation.  and is lightenough to be a good pocket camera.......Go AHEAD folks, jump in and enjoy one too.

Reviews.Title: Did not experience any issues
Reviews.Author: C. Clough
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month and so far I'm perfectly happy with it and have not had any issues. I bought this to sub out for my T4i when I can't have such a big camera with me. The picture quality is great for the price point, and I like that it has the manual modes, which helps decrease the gap for me between the two cameras. I hardly ever use my cameras to shoot video and have not yet tested this feature on my SX280. If the video doesn't work I can always use my iPhone, and I always carry a spare battery for my cameras anyway.

Reviews.Title: Good for your vacation photos.
Reviews.Author: The KGB "The KGB"
Reviews.Content: I love photography and have a semi-pro setup for a DSLR which goes with me everywhere when I travel.  However, there are times that a camera like this XS280 is too convenient to pass up.  The photos it produces are all Canon with sharp details and good color reproduction.  The 20x optical lens is responsive and to the average user shows little distortion throughout its range.  This is not a DSLR, but in a pinch it can produce photos that the home user can hang on the wall.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Adam Buckman
Reviews.Content: This camera is so nice i love the zoom on it and how good the videos are on it. this feels like your holding somthing good and not just some cheap peace of crap. pictures are really nice as well but video is the best for me. The battery life issue can be fixed with an easy update on cannons website this is great for anyone who wants somthing better then a point and shoot but still cheap i give it 10 out of 5 stars its that good

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice!
Reviews.Author: Diego
Reviews.Content: It is the best choice you can have considering the price of this camera. Excellent!The only problem is when you do zoom while recording, the battery life get reduced really fast... It is need to have extra batteries in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: sabera
Reviews.Content: Anybody must love this camera. Perfect for high quality picture and perfect for pocket size. I must recommend for anybody. You can buy without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: Super-quality images
Reviews.Author: edosan3
Reviews.Content: As an owner of Canon, Panasonic and Sony cameras, I initially bought a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS25, because I think Panasonic's controls are a bit more intuitive.  But the quality of the images, especially in low light, turned out to be horrible.  I experimented at numerous settings in varied conditions and finally decided I would never be happy with the Lumix, so I returned it to the retail outlet and bought the Canon PowerShot SX280.  And am I glad I did!  For a pocket camera, the image quality is superb.  In low light, at night, during the day, at wide angle or 20x zoom, I have been thoroughly pleased.  In situations when I don't want to haul around my Canon 60D, the PowerShot SX280 is a great alternative.  And Amazon offered it for a price that was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: John C. Day "John Day"
Reviews.Content: So far, the camera meets all my expectations.  The quality of the still pictures is excellent.  Probably should get another battery to use as backup but not a problem as yet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: NorthTxRaider
Reviews.Content: Canon has always been my preferences in both SLRs and digital SLRs, and this lil digital camera competes in some ways with my Canon 60D. Image quality is excellent, the image stabilization is awesome and works very well when shooting from my motorcycle. The GPS aspect of it is one of the primary reasons for my purchase, and now it is very easy to remember just where I was when I took a particular shot. That is very handy, especially on my trips to Sturgis, where I may take 500+ photos in a week.The only improvement I could think of would be if it used AA batteries instead of the proprietary batter, but I imagine that it's a matter of voltage and amperage requirements.Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Love Cannon Camera's been my favorite for years..
Reviews.Author: Cindy  toomanyhorses6
Reviews.Content: I have been a long time Cannon camera person and love the pictures I have taken with this camera. Not real hard to use although I probably could do a  lot more with it if I read more.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power shot SX280 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kittie S. Stanger
Reviews.Content: So far this is ideal for my intended uses. Still learning all the parts and how to maximize its utility.

Reviews.Title: It is what it is
Reviews.Author: Ronnie Snipes
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows there is a problem with the camcorder part of the camera.  However if you use a fresh battery you can do some decent  cam cording.  Everything else works fine.  Good product for the money if you want a pocket size point and shoot.  As far as I can determine, the next step up in quality will double the price.  However, be aware that there is a considerable learning curve to use various aspects other than auto point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great camea
Reviews.Author: Jayme Wintle
Reviews.Content: Great camera at a great price. My boyfriend did a bunch of research and for the price this camera was the best. He loves it

Reviews.Title: First disappointment ever from Canon
Reviews.Author: MoonPye "Monica"
Reviews.Content: I have been using Canon products for 30+ years. I have loved every single one of them and they last forever. I was REALLY excited to get this one for the zoom feature. This is the first time I've ever been disappointed in Canon and I wonder if their quality control is slipping.First of all, I paid almost $300 for mine, and now I see it for under $200. Not happy about that at all.Only a couple of months after purchase I started having memory card problems... I formatted several times and still got errors. I lost many pictures... days and days worth of shots, gone. I tried several different memory cards from different manufacturers and still got errors. I believe the camera even rendered one of  my cards completely unusable at all anymore.After struggling with this for a couple of weeks, the memory card just stopped being accepted into the camera at all.I contacted Canon, they replaced the camera and were very quick about it, but the new one is still not perfect, and I am completely afraid to ever remove the memory card that's in there now because the new one also started having errors and issues with the card. I use the cord to get pictures off the camera now instead of removing the card, not my preferred way to handle my photos at all. I definitely miss the convenience of being able to just transfer the card to other devices.Just really super disappointed and I wonder if I'll buy Canon next time... after 30 years, it's going to be a bittersweet change if I decide to go with another company.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera.
Reviews.Author: C. Dietrich "Selleck fan"
Reviews.Content: This is just what I wanted.  I love all the features especially the sports mode so I don't get any blurry pictures.  Works great on low light and the extra batteries mean I will never miss a picture!

Reviews.Title: Great features for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: J. Freess "Newportquohog"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera a few weeks, and it has surpassed my already high expectations. It is small, yet has a powerful zoom. Has a bunch of nice features like image stabilization and wi-fi.  I've taken some truly beautiful pictures in auto mode, and the color and lighting came out perfect. This is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: "Industrial Strength"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures. I like the price and design.  This is the third one I have owned. I bought and lost the first one on a camping trip. Then I bought a second one out of the classifieds (turned out to be a mistake because there was a scratch on the lense I didn't find until later).  This one off Amazon was a perfect replacement and it has performed well this far.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Hey Hey Paula
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mom to use on her upcoming Alaska trip. The 20x optical zoom will allow her to capture shots far away without losing quality using digital zoom. Canon is easy to use and intuitive for noobies.

Reviews.Title: Good POWERSHOT
Reviews.Author: Liu Fang
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my mother. And I used it when I traveled. It worked well. The pictures are nice.

Reviews.Title: ove my new camera
Reviews.Author: June
Reviews.Content: Enjoying my camera very much, still have some featuries that I have to learn.  This also replace a CannonPowerShot that I had had for 4 or 5 years.  Loved it also, these camera make beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great WiFi Camera for a Great Price..
Reviews.Author: Edward A. Rutherford "Ed"
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera.. great image quality.. fast start up.. good battery life.. and Wifi uploads..wow what a deal at Amazon's low, low price..

Reviews.Title: great camera, no bag as advertised
Reviews.Author: Njox
Reviews.Content: Yeah the battery doesn't run long. When I purchased this camera, a bag was supposed to come with it. That did not come with the shipment. The camera is great though. Took it it out on safari in the Mara and it performed pretty damn well.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for features and cost
Reviews.Author: McCactus
Reviews.Content: Great size. Great battery life. GREAT zoom lens. Has shutter, aperture, manual mode plus many more. Very fast, great in low light, and video in 1080.

Reviews.Title: Pure joy
Reviews.Author: Librarygal "Librarygal"
Reviews.Content: A great camera for the price. You can count on Canon and this camera did the job for our trip to Italy. It fit in my purse and hung around my neck with a PACsafe camera lanyard and wasn't too heavy. The red is cute and easy to keep track of.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: Ian Amos Perreira
Reviews.Content: Well, the camera takes out great pictures, however, some of the features don't work in Trinidad and Tobago such as the WiFi feature to share images to other devices. That is the software, CameraImage, does not work in Trinidad and Tobago.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Marino
Reviews.Content: excellent camera small and lightweight .fits in my back pocket great pictures only draw back the on off button is to large and too close to the shutter button so instead of taking a picture you turn the camera offthe sx260 was better

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Penna Girl
Reviews.Content: Got a fabulous deal on this camera... Small but takes perfect pictures and love the red color so I can find it.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my new wireless!
Reviews.Author: Teresa B "ttchoups"
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable to use.  Pictures come out great.  But like most everyone else , watch your finger does not sit on top of the pop up flash.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love Canon Cameras. I wanted to buy the ELPH 330, but because of Amazon price deals, I ended up buying the SX280 HS camera. I am sure I would have loved this camera, it is highly rated, but I was replacing my Panasonic ZS7 for one reason only, I wanted a wifi camera, which this one is. But, when I went to set up the wifi, I learned much to my dismay that wifi was only supported on Windows 7 SP1 and Windows 8. I had Windows Vista on my laptop and my camera could not see my laptop. (PC Tech lingo) This dilemma ended up being quite upsetting. The conclusion is I have to replace my laptop with a Windows 8 laptop so that I can now buy the ELPH 330 or whatever new camera that will be released by Canon.Canon was very remiss in hiding the fact that their wifi did not support Vista or other earlier versions of windows. On the back of the box it is written in the smallest print that Canon could possibly print this statement in, right under the statement saying virtually all versions of windows was compatible with the camera. So do they really deserve 4 stars for being deceptive, I will leave that up to you in your buying choices.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Hart
Reviews.Content: I love digital SLR cameras, but often they are too big to carry around. Smart phone cameras are very convenient but lack manual controls. Good small cameras like the Canon PowerShots offer a great compromise. The SX280 has great reviews. I have not had much use of it yet, but to date I am quit pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Dong
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Hit some really good night s***s without flash and without tripod.  Only negative us that you have to make sure your finger doesn't prevent the flash from popping up.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Stan Jaros
Reviews.Content: I was on the market for a daily carry around camera.  I considered many, having owned Canon before I trust the product.I like this little camera, it takes good clear photos and zooms out to get close ups.

Reviews.Title: Zoom is amazing
Reviews.Author: Richard M Hawthorne
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon fan.  This camera came just the way all the previous reviews have said.  Brand new out of the box, FULLY charged battery and the low bat light started flashing about 15 seconds into its first video.  After reading about all this firmware update stuff I had hoped that Canon would have corrected the software issue.  I have non contacted them yet but I will.  The photos themselves are outstanding.  I have disabled GPS and the option for a small video with every photo I shoot.  I have only used AUTO and have put the lens right into a flower and saw the clear as could be.  I also shot some video just in the back yard to test and the telephoto is beyond belief.  I can tell you thought that even with auto stabilization it is really hard not to shake a fully 20X.  Puling back just a little though and the picture calms down.  Seriously, the camera is amazing, capabilities endless, size outstanding, but that damn low bat thing just makes me take this from 5 stars to 3.  It deserves 5, but Canon disappoints due to all the previous complaints without correcting it.  You can work around it and will love the camera.  Maybe Canon should supply anyone with this camera a second battery just in case the light actually is correct.  Otherwise your just guessing.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: Geo Fla "Running Lover"
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon with a 3X zoom and wanted something more.  When CNET spoke well of this model and I found it for a good price I went for it.  It delivers all that I expect from a Canon point and shoot but I am amazed how well the zoom works.  For me, the sharpness and contrast are great.  More than I thought they could do with such long zoom range.My only disappointment was the size of the CCD.  This camera has the most common size CCD, 1/1.7"  (see here for comparison:  [...]  Canon uses the next larger size for some of it's point and shoots, but I gave in on that for the zoom.  I am of the belief that larger CCD is better for picture quality than the number of megapixels ([...]

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: i haven't had the chance to use it much yet but so far so good. the iso is a lot better than the previous camera.

Reviews.Title: Three Stars- some great features and 1 crappy one!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B. Vellos
Reviews.Content: This Camera has a lot more features than my previous Powershot.  The main reason I gave this camera a 3 star rating is because of the location of the flash.  Despite Canon putting it there for seemingly better picture results; you have to have a really firm grip on the camera with both hands to turn the dial which requires some strength to turn to switch your shooting mode.  However when you change the mode sometimes the flash automatically pops up and at that time your finger is right on top of the the flash which may cause a malfunction!  Then you have to shut the camera down and power it back up to continue.  This is annoying!  So the design I have to give Canon an F in this respect.  The 20X zoom is excellent and the shooting modes are great. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Great zoom and features in such a small package.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Benham
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take trekking in some pretty remote places this year. I needed something high quality and versatile but also compact, and so far in smaller trial run backpacking trips, this camera is fitting that bill. Depending on your settings (GPS, which was really important to have, for me) the battery life can just be gone, so you have to have back-up batteries, and be careful how you have it set up, for what and when, and for how long, etc. Those tips and best practices are pretty well documented in their accompanying lit, if you bother to do your homework. But other then that, so far, so good!

Reviews.Title: Battery drain issue
Reviews.Author: GH "Ross"
Reviews.Content: Start to take a movie and instantly you get the warning light that the battery is drained.  Canon knows about this issue and just ignores it and lets us waste our time finding this out.  Amazon should stop selling this stuff until Canon does a recall.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX280HS battery issue in video mode
Reviews.Author: S. Huang
Reviews.Content: I just bought SX280 couple days ago. I had the same problem that everybody talked about here.[...]I can't believe this happened to Canon's cameras, which has been a reliable company for long time. This should have been found out during product test before it's on the market. Before Canon provides a solution, I can only return the camera.

Reviews.Title: The camera was failed. I returned it.
Reviews.Author: Ernesto Casanova
Reviews.Content: There was a problem with the battery when recording in full hd. I returned it and they gave me my money back.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Thaissa
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera without seeing many reviews or recommendations, but for  sre it  wasa great  deal!The 20x optical zoom is one of the hot features of the camera, and there's no doubt of the lenses quality (it's a Canon)The only concernm (even though I ratted it 5 star, it would be a 4,5 easily) is that the camera isn't the easiest I ever tried, but it isn't any rocket science eitherway.Bottom line: great camera, great price, great zoom and compact shape with good user interface. A must buy for the regular user

Reviews.Title: Exactly as expected
Reviews.Author: Mad-Gunner "Mad-Gunner"
Reviews.Content: Reliable, quick, simple.  Lightweight.  Pop-up flash.  Lots of features for tweakers, but we use this camera set everything to auto and it works just fine.  Great for stills and movies.Long-time user of Canon PowerShot cameras.  Great optical zoom on this model.  Compared to other models and competitor products, selected the SX280 as best-value for the wife to use.  Simple operation.  Image stabilization (e.g. anti-shake and blur) works better in this model then previous cameras we've used, and certainly better than the iPhone built-in camera.No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good price
Reviews.Author: Cary H. Nakamura
Reviews.Content: Good features, great price, must be the 7th or 8th Canon I've owned over the years.  I love the GPS tracking feature, even though it uses the battery, even when the rest of the camera is off.  I can see where I've been, even when the camera was in my pocket.  If you don't want to run down the battery, you can simply turn off the GPS tracking.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Hughes
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a smaller camera to travel with. We currently own a Nikon d3100. The Nikon has great photo quality but is bulky. After doing my research I chose to buy the sx280.The camera is a great size. Easy to store in my wife's purse or even in your coat pocket. The user interface is very easy to navigate. It has great features. The photo quality is great. I do like the rechargeable battery and the battery life seems to last as long as you would expect. It is a lot longer than some of the cameras we have owned that take AA batteries.All in all I am very impressed with this camera

Reviews.Title: Hard on batteries
Reviews.Author: Christine Hopf-Lovette
Reviews.Content: Seems to run through battery charge very quickly.  It's a good thing I brought three batteries with my on my trip.

Reviews.Title: It's Just OK
Reviews.Author: Larry Forrest
Reviews.Content: Two things, colors are a bit washed out on cloudy days and low light. The pop up flash is poorly located so it pops up right under your finger without warning, this happened so often that it made using the camera annoying. The zoom is the very best feature of this camera. The size and weight is just right.

Reviews.Title: A lot bigger than anticipated, concerned about the battery giving out on me
Reviews.Author: LisaMH
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after a lot of agonizing because all of the reviews (professional and Amazon-based) were great and said the quality was excellent.  My husband and I are having a baby in a week (eek!) and although we have a pro-sumer high-end digital camera for his use, I wanted something small to throw in the diaper bag and carry around easily to replace our older (small) camera.  Anyway, although hesitant about the battery based on all of the reviews, we decided to go with this model.I updated the firmware which supposedly fixes the battery issue and want to offer this tip: the memory card wasn't letting me copy the firmware update onto it for transfer to the camera using my Mac OS.  (That line may only make sense once you go to the Cannon site and follow their directions for updating.)  It took me a while going through tips online and find the solution: basically, some Macs have issues with the unlocked memory card so you need to move the Lock/Unlock tab on the card to the MIDDLE position and that somehow tricks the computer and solves the problem.  So, if you find yourself dealing with this same issue then move the tab and you shouldn't have any additional problems--I didn't!The quality of the photos seemed excellent (though we had it less than 24 hours)--the tracking was good, the photos were good, the low-light images were good.  However, it was extremely bulkier than anticipated.  The size and weight seems a lot different in the abstract online (and even seeing the camera in person at a local store) than it does when it's in your hands at home.  I felt like it would always be a chore to take the camera along when my main goal had been to get something small, small, small with good quality.  Plus, I remained concerned about how 100% of the professional reviews referred to a terrible battery life and didn't want to wind up out with our new baby and unable to take photos--the entire point of ordering this camera!We returned this and wound up ordering the Canon Elph 300 HS instead since it also has excellent reviews--I sincerely hope we didn't make a mistake but the size was the biggest deal-breaker in the end.

Reviews.Title: The zoom is amazing!
Reviews.Author: CA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera without my usual thorough research because I was leaving on a trip and needed a new camera fast.  I settled on this one because the price was right and I've always been impressed with my older Canon ELPH series cameras.The 20x zoom is incredible for a point and shoot camera.  What's even better is it has superb image stabilization features, so even with this high power zoom, you can capture close-ups from what might seem untenable situations.  I was able to nail and Osprey feeding her young high up in a nest.  I took the camera from a raft bobbing down the river at the highest zoom setting and the picture is crisp and clear... I was amazed.  The sport feature is nice too, capturing multiple frames rapid-fire.  I haven't been able to figure out the video feature, yet... not as straightforward... might need to read the manual.The downside... this camera burns through batteries.  Be sure to buy extras.  You will go through about 2.5 batteries on a 7 day trip of about 320 shots... did I say buy extra batteries?

Reviews.Title: Wifi not so good
Reviews.Author: jeanette Dubray
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for the wifi function. I am not impressed. Camera shuts off or looses connect to quickly. Pictues are great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Big, but works well
Reviews.Author: LeftCoast20
Reviews.Content: The camera itself works very well - very fast start-up, image quality is good and optical zoom is very good.  The two biggest issues:- it's rather big/bulky for a compact point and shoot (the price you have to pay for excellent optical zoom)- I wish it had a panorama setting like my iPhoneUnless you really need the zoom, go with an elph or a smaller point and shoot camera that you're more likely to carry around w/o hassle.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Davis
Reviews.Content: The off on button should have been placed to the inside of the shutter one as it's to easy to hit it when taking the picture.Also would be an improvement if the flash was over farther making the camera easier to hold when shooting.

Reviews.Title: Pictures & Video fantastic BUT Camera will NOT HOLD A CHARGE for very long.
Reviews.Author: Tyler Moore
Reviews.Content: The camera itself..pictures video are fantastic.  BUT something's wrong with the ability of the camera to hold a charge.  My daughter purchased this camera solely for taking it to a once in a lifetime trip to Europe.  Even with a fully charged camera she was only able to use the camera for the first part of the day and then the battery would be dead.

Reviews.Title: I wish I never bought this camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Cleary
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago, and was just checking about returning it and missed the deadline to return it without $$$ penalty by one day.  That sucks and so does this camera.  The zoom is great and it takes nice photos once it decides to focus.  So if you want to spend $300 for a camera that takes nice pictures go for it.  There is a lot of other camera at half that price that take great pictures thou.  If you want to take movies with this camera forget it!  They come out nice, BUT, you have like 3 minutes of battery life before it dies when you use the video function.  I bought an extra battery with this and it doesnt matter which one I use or which charger I use, they both die within 5 minutes of using the video function.  Huge flaw in this product.  I can't believe it. Its BS.  I've had 4 canon powershots before, and not a single one ever had battery life issues. Its not highly unlikely I will buy another Canon. I'm also mad at Amazon wanting to penalize my refund because of one day.  That's BS.  I ordered the camera before I actually needed it.  How was I supposed to know the battery life while making videos was going to be so horrible?  I DO NOT RECOMMEND YOU BUY THIS CAMERA.  Its not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Uselss browser, wont let you upload photos, great camera
Reviews.Author: NV
Reviews.Content: I have always used Cannon cameras and I cannot say enough good things about the company. So I bought this recently because of wifi and ability to upload to social media. The camera takes great pictures, the iPhone app works fine, although it uploads only one image at a time. But the browser was the biggest disaster. I installed it on my Mac. The launcher typically has an icon for a software. Cannon has many little apps within one folder I have to find the right icon that would open the browser. The first time I open, it quits. This happens every time I open it. I connect the camera, but do not see an image of my picture. I try to import it, but I cannot. This browser will not import any other picture already on my hard drive either. Needless to say, I have failed to use this camera for uploading photos anywhere. So don't buy it if you intend to use the browser. Just so everyone knows, I was reading the pdf manual before installing the browser. I wish Amazon would just take this product back so I can buy something other than cannon. On the Cannon web site the browser has one star from 11 reviewers. So I am not the only one with these views.There is a firmware issue that shows battery low in video mode. I was able to download and address this issue quickly. Not trying to ding Cannon, but the poor quality of browser is just shocking. I cannot believe that the brand I have so respected could let me down so completely.IGNORE WHAT I SAID ABOUT THE FIRMWARE. I TURNED ON THE MOVIE MODE AND THE LOW BATTRY LIGHT JUST CAME ON. WOW! I ALSO NOTICED THAT ANOTHER REVIEW HAD THE SAME PROBLEM AFTER UPDATING THE FIRMWARE. RETURNING THE CAMERA. JUST PRINTED THE RETURN SHIPPING LABEL.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Philip Sheau
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that produced sharp photos, easy to use, and could take telephoto shots. This was the answer.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Joao Luis C. Moraes "book"
Reviews.Content: This product is excellent and I would recomment it! I have been reading about similars products and I chose this one as it is better in terms of quality.

Reviews.Title: Wifi's Camera
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: I have a problem, I can't to configure the Wifi of my camera in Ecuador. Do you have a solution?S. Adrián Cedeño M.

Reviews.Title: The camera is very good, I like it
Reviews.Author: Erwin
Reviews.Content: It is a good camera, with a good zoom by the price, I think I made a good purchase, thanks

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Great camera! It does everything I hoped it would. Great pictures! Easy to use and very easy to carry on trips.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: This is a very high quality camera that is easy to use and take very high quality photos very fast.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Summer
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom for Christmas because it has a nice big screen for her. She loved it and it takes the most beautiful photos.

Reviews.Title: So glad I have a real camera again!!!
Reviews.Author: Janet L. Waller "grizwaller"
Reviews.Content: I bought this little gem on Amazon after getting sick and tired of taking lousy pictures with my iPhone 5. I had mistakenly sold a Nikkon thinking I could use my iPhone. Now, I am getting much better photos, a flash that fires immediately instead of taking three or four seconds to shoot (iPhone), and a nice zoom to boot.For me, I could care less about comments that the battery life is short. Most of these kinds of cameras have the same issue and extra batteries are CHEAP!Of course, something like this will never come close to a high DSLR but for the most part, only pro photographers will be able to tell the difference for most photos. I just want to take clear photos, have a nice little zoom and use some of the camera's features for special situations.All in all, best value for the buck! Thank you Canon!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ana Marma Aristizabal
Reviews.Content: Great camara. The image and quality of pictures are very good. Important to get the memory to make it faster.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Regina Giglio
Reviews.Content: Researched and compared many reviews of this and other Canon cameras.  For what I need the SX280 gave me the options I wanted.  Love the ease of usage , the quality of my pictures, handling of the camera, size of the view screen, but agree that the placement of the flash makes it awkward to hold.  I'm always putting my finger in the way!I have always used point and shoot Canon cameras and will continue to do so!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Red Hat Barb
Reviews.Content: It is all it says it is - however the free case you offered is much too small for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very simple camera.
Reviews.Author: bigfish4545
Reviews.Content: So far, this seems to be a very high quality and very compact digital camera. Easy to put in my pocket and take anywhere. Leave the setting on "auto" and results are perfect every time. Long battery life and good looks are a plus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for amateurs
Reviews.Author: Andrew Sedelkov
Reviews.Content: Overall Canon PowerShot SX280 HS is the good camera for amateurs that makes crisp, vivid pictures thanks to extremely intelligent new Digic VI image processor. Excellent zoom is another buying point.Downsides are a lack of features like: built-in HDR, panorama mode and bracketing.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershopt SX280
Reviews.Author: L. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I haven't really given the camera a good workout yet; but I am impressed with the amount of light which comes into the camera, the crispness of the photos and the speed of the shutter.  I still need to learn about the many features; but, all in all, I am impressed with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery is a problem, otherwise its good camera.
Reviews.Author: Alok Goyal
Reviews.Content: Feel bad to have a battery with so small backup. Picture quality of camera is good. I wish Cannon had a better battery backup.

Reviews.Title: Panorama gone? Pop-up flash motor error?
Reviews.Author: A. Shuler
Reviews.Content: Without covering ground other's have covered:1) The panorama stitch assist is GONE!?  This is backwards.  What is Canon thinking?  They are supposed to be the LEADER on this and yet they are the ONLY manufacturer out there without this feature? Then they take away the awkward 36-step stitch assist feature? Way to watch the market, Canon.2) You KNOW it's a huge issue with the SX260, so why include the SAME STUPID FLASH system that locks the camera up if you accidentally put your fingers where EVERYBODY puts their fingers from the left hand?It's going back.  Goodbye Canon SX280.  I'll keep the SX260... flawed though it is.

Reviews.Title: Mix feeling
Reviews.Author: TH "love Shopping"
Reviews.Content: The battery life is too short even I update the newer version of firmware, especial when taking a video clip. ( I would not want to mention when time to use GPS.)  I really like wifi function but it was not easy to setup this function. It requires the specific software in the CD which came with the camera. My CD Rom was out of service and tried to download this software from Canon website. Unfortunately, it doesn't offer this option for its customers to download after talking to its technician . So, I had to find another computer with a working CD rom to transfer this software to a portable hard drive, then installed into my computer. Quality Wise, my nephew's, who was 12 years old, panasonic Lumix was out of battery. I let him used my camera. He told me that my camera's quality was not good as his. So he would pass this offer.  (We visited Grand Canyon National Park. We zoomed in to take pictures of the California Condors at the same time. I saw the difference between these two cameras after I let him to take the photos of California Condors with my camera. That was why he rejected to use my camera in San Diego Safari Park. I hate to admit this truth.)  I used this camera for traveling 45 days with 9,000 miles driving on the road. Battery life is very important. It is really bad that I can't charge my battery through car charger with an usb cord. Canon wants you to buy an additional car charger. I dislike this idea and hope it would consider to make their products which can be charged with car charger without spending extra money. Pro: It is light and handy comparing to my canon 40D with extra battery compartment attached it . Its photo quality is not bad. Wifi connection is the best. 20X room is great. I was amazed and surprised by this function. I don't have to carry my 200-400mm telephoto lens to spot on someone playing in the water without clothes. It is kind of scary that how people loose their privacy.My original idea was to take birds' or wild animals' photos with this function.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Doug Britton
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping great value, packed very well, camera is a gift so I haven't used it yet, but I'm sure it'll be a great present

Reviews.Title: Wow. That is all.
Reviews.Author: KateNoules
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I've been playing with the settings and uploading and sending - all kinds of stuff!!  I found a webpage that has some beautiful photos of a gray fox baby and it's clear as day on 20X optical zoom (http://www.squidoo.com/how-to-take-really-foxy-photos) which I thought was awesome.  My own photos don't have such interesting characters :P But they are still as awesome! Thanks Canon and Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great pics but sent it back
Reviews.Author: UberPooch
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with high expectations but after nearly a month I sent it back. Like many others, mine has the defect where the low battery indicator flashes when zooming during video mode. Canon finally acknowledged it which will likely result in a firmware fix but no dates have been announced.Very impressed with the image quality. Wish the battery life was longer but it is what it is. Couldn't get teh wi-fi to work but it wasn't a big deal for me. GPS was never a consideration so I disabled it to extend the battery.One thing I really disliked was the placement of the flash. I've got big hands and it was natural for me to hold the camera where the flash is located. On more than one occasion I ended up taking photos while preventing the flash from popping up.In the end I returned the SX280 and bought the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS30. It did cost me some more money buy I love the flash location and the touch screen interface. I wish it came in a red body like the SX280 but oh well.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to use properly
Reviews.Author: john m.
Reviews.Content: The camera layout of controls is the poorest I have ever seen.  To hold it to take a pictureand your finger holds the flash down. Any adjustments will cause you to hit the movie button.  Viewing the photo you took with th live picture is awkward.  I returned the unit.  I just could noit use it comfortably and, I have been taking photos for many years.  I do not recommend it .Read CNET and Photography reviews  before you buy

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot 280 12 mp Camera 20x Optical Image Stabilizer Zoom
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot 280 was perfect in every way, I just really wanted more zoom. Perfect for my pocketbook! Very Happy.

Reviews.Title: GPS, WI-FI uploading and longer battery life make this a smart little camera for back packing
Reviews.Author: Sean Reilly
Reviews.Content: A very smart point and shoot camera that tries to automate everything for the perfect shot!  This camera will even independently detect up to 50 or so different possible shot situations and adjust itself for you to get clicking..This camera is great for shooting action shots with a burst of 14 photographs per second mode.In  HD video there are two stabilization modes to help sure that you get crisp, 60 frames per second HD recording.This camera is ideal for backpackers who wish to track their route.  The camera records local time and location through the inbuilt GPS so you'll always be able to pinpoint the memory.The integrated GPS logger function tracks the location of the camera at regular intervals on a journey, while A-GPS functionality uses Wi-Fi to quickly download additional Assisted GPS data, which greatly decreases the time to acquire a satellite signal.

Reviews.Title: awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Justin Nelson
Reviews.Content: excellent picture quality, easy to shoot.  I bought this for my and she loves it.  Miles above her Nikon Coolpix!

Reviews.Title: Great replacement camera
Reviews.Author: Coyote
Reviews.Content: This is another great Canon camera.  It is amazine the number of features that are available for such a small product.  I do wish they would build a better wrist strap on the camera so heavier duty (neck) straps could be used.

Reviews.Title: Don't expect Canon to stand behind their products
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Camera was defective. Canon declared it damaged, which I guess it was, but it was defective and the damage arose in frustration with the defect. Canon refused to do the right thing. Rudely.

Reviews.Title: ReVive Series Battery Charging Plates & Canon SX280 Camera
Reviews.Author: John Newsome
Reviews.Content: The page for ordering the ReVive Charging Plates is not clear, it (to me) is very confusing.  You put in the size plate you want for the battery you name, and they send the largest plate that will fit in the charger.  This happened to me several years ago when I was ordering ReVive Charging plates for a camera that used smaller batteries.  Finally I was able to communicate which plates were needed, then, and they were sent.  This time I just said - "Go away", and they will issue a refund.  I went with other battery chargers for my new camera that have a clear ordering page.The Canon PowerShot SX280 is super.  Better zoom, better image stabilization, better resolution.  Still could use better audio pickup on the highs from violins and the very lows from bass instruments.  It really eats batteries when taking long - i.e. five minute, videos.  So I have just ordered lots of batteries, like 30 - at great expense when you consider the multiple chargers so that ten or so batteries can be charged simultaneously.  Why don't they put out a gang battery, made up of 15 or so 1600 mAh NB-6L batteries?

Reviews.Title: Not as great as the review online
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: This camera is okay, but does not live up to its reviews of being a really good point and shoot camera.  I bought this camera based on the review online, but after using this camera I am not impressed and am looking for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Iphone 5 takes better pictures
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Some people might love this camera. Yes, it has a 20x zoom.I'm a somewhat experienced photographer. I have a Canon Rebel T2i and a Canon 5d mark iii. I'm about to take a trip to Europe and didn't feel like swinging a DSLR over my neck for 3 weeks. I wanted a small GOOD point and shoot camera that I could keep in my pocket or on my belt. Image quality didn't have to be DSLR quality, I just wanted good enough quality to do some selfies and pictures to post online, nothing to print or anything.However, my iphone 5 takes higher quality pictures. I did a test with the Iphone 5, the Powershot, and my Canon T2i. Obviously the T2i won, but the Iphone 5 was a close 2nd (for what I was doing). The Powershot had pretty low resolution in bright sunlight. So I didn't even attempt to see what it's like in low-light, but it didn't matter. So this Europe trip will have my T2i and my Iphone to take quick pictures. If you're already bringing along an Iphone 5, don't bother with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Bad review for Canon SX280.
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: Hi,Bad review for Canon SX280.I am a Canon point and shoot camera lover but sorry to give a very bad feedback for this camera. Canon SX280! I really do not know how people are giving good feedback for this camera. Pictures are not at all Canon standard. Not sharp, colours are not bright. I mean did not like it at all. I still possess a Canon Powershot SD1200 IS. The picture quality of SX280 is nowhere in comparison with SD1200. Even SX280 design is also bad. The flash is present in a location where most of the people hold the camera and land up blocking the flash from opening resulting in restart of the camera. I returned it immediately.Guys who are really looking for good camera with sharp, crisp, good, quality photo, just not think of buying this camera.-- DB

Reviews.Title: Flimsy camera
Reviews.Author: Roselyne "Ed"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because trusting Canon to be a great brand. My last canon camera lasted 6 year without a single problem. Unfortunately this one DID NOT last 2 months. First the flash got stock and then the lens started to display error messages.We spend a lot of time outdoors and I noticed that sand and hay were getting in the cracks. Maybe because I put it on the ground a few times to help my 3 year old.It might be a good camera for museums and city only but definitely not for outdoors.I am looking now where to return it.

Reviews.Title: battery
Reviews.Author: Jose Maria Molina
Reviews.Content: th battery life is so bad. It only works less than 24 hours. I use normally, making photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: No support for WiFi
Reviews.Author: Curtis Wise
Reviews.Content: Canon does not support WiFi on this camera.  After call tech support, they said that it is not supported.  You must use the WEB site to set up WiFi and the Web site does not work.

Reviews.Title: Poor ergonomic design
Reviews.Author: erlyg
Reviews.Content: I really liked the zoom feature, although difficult to hold steady at 20x.  I pride myself on having steady hands. I felt that the controls were small but manageable and similar to my previous camera, also a canon.  Resolution of photos seemed to be excellent, the hd movies were jumpy but perhaps that was my error.  I like to use Picasa and I couldn't get Picasa to play the videos.  I had no problems with Picasa and videos on my older canon A710.  The deal breaker for me and the reason why I returned the camera was the flash location.  When I grab the camera to take a quick shot, my left index finger instinctively goes over the point where the flash pops up, the top left side of the camera.  For the length of time I intend to own my next camera, I am not going to continually do battle with the pop up flash.  I tried holding the camera as per the instructions and it seemed really awkward and unnatural.  I hated to send this camera back but the flash did me in.

Reviews.Title: Memory card NOT included
Reviews.Author: Carl F Weber
Reviews.Content: Beware! Memory card is not included with this camera and this is not made clear in the product description. It took me 20 minutes to try to locate the memory card so that I could operate the camera, thinking I had misplaced or something. Then I realized the memory card was actually not included. Product description should have made that clear. I have never bought a camera without a memory card included ever before. Annoyed that I now have to shop for a compatible memory card, spend more money AND pay for shipping. Had I known beforehand, at least I could have ordered both at the same time to take advantage of the free shipping promotion.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought
Reviews.Author: CoconutGirl1961 "CoconutGirl1961"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the sx260 and this one, the pictures were kind of yellow looking. I returned it and went back to the sx260 and so far had it two days and it is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Good features/bad features
Reviews.Author: momule
Reviews.Content: Haven't had it long enough to know for sure.  One really bad feature is the flash location.  Top left location makes it really clumsy to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: Shipped damaged item mising parts
Reviews.Author: D Doug "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: I never got a chance to use this camera.  I opened the box today when it arrived and discovered that there was no Canon battery included in the package.  To make matters worse the camera had scratches on the corners of the case.  It appeared to have been dropped.  The Battery compartment opening around the door was bulging which certainly confirmed that the unit had indeed been dropped, returned, restocked and then sent to me.The seller K&M; Camera obviously never checked the item before reselling it

Reviews.Title: I should probably return it I am so disappointed already
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I now have to admit that the popup flash is in the absolutely worst place possible.  Even when I try to avoid placing my finger on it I still cover it.  I can't figure out how to manually prepop the flash up and the only other way to hold that side of the camera is to put my thumb on screen and finger on front of camera body.  Less than ideal for sure and leaves thumb print all over view screen.  It's almost like nobody on Canon design team ever even snapped a photo with this camera in low light conditions.As for GPS and Wifi, well the controls are so far embedded into the menu system I can't see these as being easy to use and I have given up.  I guess I also didn't realize Bluetooth was what I really wanted rather than Wifi.  I can't transfer a photo from SX280 to iphone 5 in field because I don't have a router in the field. Argh.  My iPhone has GPS, Wifi, and Bluetooth so why leave bluetooth out of SX280 Canon?The SX280 also needs a touch screen to make menu selections logical. I know I paid way more for my iPhone 5, but I also like it way more. The iPhone 5 came with 32 Gig of memory preinstalled rather than no memory at all like this SX280 requiring me to make a trip to the local Walmart to get $30 memory card.About the only thing I can do on this point and shoot camera that I can't already do on my iPhone 5 is optical zoom and I am not sure that functionality alone is worth keeping this superficially desireable purchase just for that feature.The battery is also a problem in that I can't use off-the-shelf AA  lithium batteries from Walmart or Walgreens etc. like I do with my last Canon camera. I would really rather have a larger camera body with room for AA replaceable batteries and a place to hold the camera.My complaint with Canon's menu design is that it changes depending on whether I turn the camera on with the ON/OFF button or with the Blue right arrow in a blue box button.  If you use the ON/OFF button followed by Menu button you get two categories: Camera icon and Tools icon.  But if you use the Blue Arrow button followed by the Menu button you get three categories: Blue Arrow icon, Print icon, and Tools icon.  This is confusing.  Make Menu the same no matter how I get there and make it touch screen too.

12.1 megapixel, 1/2.3-inch CMOS sensor and Canon DIGIC 6 image processor for improved low-light performance up to ISO 6400 and enhanced image quality
